text:
My family and I stumbled upon Japanese Curry Zen after 5 days of mediocre, overpriced food on the Strip. It was by far the most memorable meal of our Vegas adventure. I lived in Japan for three years and make curry rice at home quite often.  This was the real deal; spicy, flavorful Japanese-style curry with several interesting additions.  I tried the tacoyaki appetizer and it was great.
Highly recommended, especially if you've never had Japanese curry before.
Short and simple review. GO HERE. Katsu was awesome and the service was fast. Only gripe was the parking lot. But once you get in, wow.

Delicious Japanese curry that definitely hits the spot. You really can't go wrong no matter what kind of curry you choose and the great thing is its so customizable! 

They have different spice levels for the curry as well. I got level 5 spice and it was a bearable medium spiciness. If you like eating flaming hot cheetos (my reference for tolerable spiciness level lol), you could probably go a little spicier.

Get cheese in your curry and you won't regret it! They even have some tsukemono, all you have to do is ask for some!
What a great little concept. The curry was good, real good. My favorite was the Spam add-on. I can't wait to come back :)

One of my favorite restaurants for Asian cuisine in Las Vegas. Don't let the the unassuming/insipid sight of their plates fool you. The dishes here pack a host of flavors. My favorites are: Pork Katsu Curry with Meatloaf (spice level: 3), Takoyaki, Gyoza. My wife loves the Curry Udon.

Had the beef curry with white rice and it was delicious. There are various levels of spices on the table as well as sliced almonds and raisins you can add. Also decided to try a curry pan, again very good. The staff is friendly. The prices are reasonable. Just be aware that it is a very small restaurant, so you may have to wait.

Best Japanese curry place in town. I always get the chicken katsu curry with cheese and croquette. Servers are always nice. Food comes out pretty quick and is always on point. Nice crispy katsu, with awesome curry. This place never disappoints.

Good stuff. It's a simple little curry place so I'm gonna keep my review nice and simple with just good stuff. If yer like me and you tend to do two plates plus an appetizer it will run you around $30 for two chicken curry plates and gyoza just a heads up on how much you should have if yer eating for two but like I said good stuff.

This is where I tried my very 1st Japanese curry. It is absolutely amazing & I have been coming here since then.  The place is small so we don't hang out here. We eat then leave because there is always a line.  It kind of makes you guilty when hungry people are looking. Try to plan ahead, parking is extremely hard to find, especially when you're picking up ur food & "HANGRY"
simple, and always perfectly made! if you like japanese curry, this place does it the best

Undeniably the best curry dish I've ever had. Food is cooked to perfection. Chef and wait staff are pleasant.

This is a must try even for a newbie.

To be fair, I'm not a big fan of Japanese curry but I've tried a few different places and I have to say the curry here is just okay. I thought the serving size was a bit too small for the price as well (or the price a bit too high for what you're getting). My sister loves this place though.

I love their curry. I just love everything about their chicken katsu and how spicy you want your curry to be. 

Also, I love that they have different options for curry and not just with chicken. They have healthy options as well. 

It's so cheap and delicious. I could eat here everyday. 

I brought my friends to this place for the first time and they now want to go back almost every week!

The Japanese curry gods have answered. Finally, there's a decent Japanese curry joint in town! Their menu is pretty small and simple. You order either a regular or half-size of white or brown rice with curry. Then you add accompaniments like tonkatsu, chicken katsu, potato croquette, and kurobuta sausage. I usually love a nice tonkatsu, but theirs is a bit dry and tough so I suggest going with the chicken katsu instead. Skip the miniscule salad . It's not worth the $1.50 price.

The best Japanese curry in town.   Always great service and delicious food.  The 16 grain rice is awesome as is just about everything else.   Not spicy unless you like it that way,  choose spicy level 1 ti 10.  I usually go with a #4 or 5, gives it just the right amount of kick. Give this place a try, you won't be sorry.

I did not know Japanese Curry existed. Here's what happened: about 150 years ago the British started bringing Indian spices into Japan, Japan liked his they tasted and local families started making their own recipes. So what happens at Zen is that you get a family recipe. It's a unique blend of healthy spices (listed on a small menu - together with their benefits).

Ok so here's how it works: what you see on the illustrated menu is exactly what you get.- with the added value of taste buds awesomeness. No frills, no fancy decoration. Rice is white, curry is brown. Flavor is insane.

I tried a handful of "hotness" options and have to say that the hottest is totally bearable. They use different varieties of chili to obtain heat throughout the scale and a nice amount of Habanero in their hottest sauces (hence the redder coloration). Perfect blend and amount. Never too much - always enough to feel it and love it.

Now - I'm not the type who goes out for dinner seeking an ambience, I don't care. I want my joints to be clean and mainly I want them to provide a fantastic food experience. Zen is pretty straight forward: don't pick this place if you're trying to impress a date with fancy stuff, maybe try Chinese at the Bellagio's Jasmine. 

Lights are bright at Zen, bill is super reasonable, staff is awesome, chef is great and food tastes better than a wish.

Since mouthful #1 I would have kept going, going, going....

Loved it!
X

.

Addicting. Consistent every time. Delicious.

I have been to this place no less than thirty times. It's odd that curry-gravy could have such an effect on me, but this place stays on my mind. 

It's so simple: choice of meat, white or brown rice, and curry sauce. And yet, it's so much more. 

The breading on the Chicken Tender is crispy and perfect every time. I've had the Katsu and grilled chicken as well, also great. The rice is standard, though I am impressed that their brown rice is just as soft and easy to eat as the regular white rice. Not all restaurants have the capability or knowledge to do this, and its evident that brown rice is often the more "challenging" of the two. Not here.

The curry sauce is to die for. It's as mild or spicy as you choose, and I love that I can choose. It is more of a gravy consistency, which is very different from the thinner Indian or Thai curries. The taste isn't for everyone though. I happen to be half Middle Eastern and grew up on my grandmother's afterschool curry, so I welcome the heat and the spices. Also, I'm not a fan of dark-meat chicken, so the Chicken Tender option was made for me.

The toppings are fun too. There are little jars on the tables with things like pickled radish (red), pearl onions (white), sliced almonds, and raisins. I was a little hesitant to throw these on my curry at first, but the flavors are so mild and add a brightness and a fresh element to the rich curry. Still won't do the raisins, but everything else is a must for me.

The service is standard for a Japanese restaurant. Every employee greets you when you come in, and thanks you when you leave. My favorite server is Misaki, as she remembers me every time, always has a great attitude, and is the most personable of all.

I will be back in the foreseeable future, like probably twice this week.
Great little spot. Good curry, sake and customer service. Cold sake helps to combat the spice. Don't pass this place up

What a GEM! i love to eat here for many reasons. they owners and employees are genuine, thoughtful and sweet. the curry is delicious. the new menu has spice levels you can add to make hotter. I love the list of all of their spices. it explains many health benefits of curry spice. I even came here with a group of friends for my birthday back in May.  try the coffee jello, i like it with extra milk! i feel major inner joy when i think about zen curry.  this place is great even down to how they serve water--clean tasting water with perfect-ish square cubes. 

Please eat here, its for your health!
Was recommended to this place by a friend and have found myself going very often . The food and service is great. Now that I moved out of state, I am going to miss this place.

It's about time they put a curry house in Las Vegas. I was very excited about trying out their curry. The menu is a little small compared to other curry restaurants I've been to. I ordered the pork cutlet curry rice and it was very good, especially with the pepper seasoning and Japanese pickles. 

I paid $9.13 for the plate and I thought it was more worth $6 or $7. The restaurant is a little smaller than Monta, so you might have to wait outside. The owner was very nice; he said the curry recipe was a family recipe. All in all, I would have to say the curry is legit and I would come back.

This is one of the Japanese style curry house . The spicy level from 1 to 10. I normally get between 3 to 5 . Chicken Katsu curry is my favor. With a fried oyster ( 3 pieces ) and a drink . Total : $15.68 . The price is fare. For any curry lover this is a good place to go .

Love this place! Hands down best curry place. I love the food and the service! I usually get the chicken katsu and shrimp, but lately I've gotten the five piece kushi which is so yummy and has a bit more variety with quail eggs and zucchini. Highly recommend. 10/10

Excellent curry! Came here for lunch, service was fast and very friendly! I had chicken curry, it was so moist inside and crunchy outside! Will definitely come back and will recommend this place to everyone!!!

Great atmosphere and the food is good for anybody who is willing to try curry. The service is great. The curry isn't watered down like many places who serve curry. This place is just up the alley if you want a thick curry curry plate :)

I love this place!!  I've only visited this place once, but my first experience was a pleasure!  Tiny restaurant, but clean and cute.  We were automatically greeted upon arrival by the cook and the server.  I tried the chicken tenderloin with extra sides (veggies, corn, cheese).  It was so damn good!!  I was so pleased by both the presentation of the dish and the taste.  I wish they had served more rice on my plate though.  On my next visit, I'd have to order an extra side of rice.  This place is a must see and must try!  Good food for such a good price!  Yummy!!

Pork tenderloin katsu curry is the best!! Husband and I even like their katsu curry more than that of Curry House! Will come back again for sure! The katsu did take 15 mins to make but so worth the wait!! The only drawback for a big party is that it has a max occupancy of 18 and u might have a difficulty in seating all of ur party during prime time.

Loved the curry! I'd definitely come back. 
Seating is limited though...small place.

Taste is close enough to that good stuff in Japan, CoCo's!!

Omg I love this little curry house. The prices are reasonable, the options are plenty and the taste is very homey to me.  Taste like my mother's homemade curry...WELL made curry! 

A must- always order a beer and a Tako yaki!

This is the best place to get Japanese curry, the few times I have eaten here it was outstanding I have only tried the chicken Katsu Curry. The restaurant is small and drafty but who cares when you have curry this good. the plaza is cramped and hard to find parking on weekends and evenings so go early to find a spot.

First time I'm leaving a review but I can't count the number of times I've come here either by myself or with friends. A friend introduced me to this place a year and half or so ago and it's one of these best places to eat in Vegas without a doubt! 

They've got an easy to read menu, easy to customize your food and all the food is so tasty that you couldn't go wrong with trying something new. As for me, I started out with Beef curry, went to Curry Udon, and now I've ended on Tofu Katsu curry. And every single thing I've ordered in between was DELISH.

If you grew up with this kind of food, rice and a side, you're gonna love this food. If you haven't tried something like this before, it's a welcome change and I promise you'd love it. 

Cute atmosphere, extremely friendly and welcoming staff, and above all top notch food! Stop by Curry Zen and you'll keep coming back.

Amazing curry, done Japanese style. Staff is very attentive, and all of the food cooked fresh to order. They do give you options on your spiciness level desired, I'm a wimp and do 1. My husband does a 7, and he loves the bracing kick it has. All of the fried foods are perfectly done, juicy when appropriate. The sauce is the best part of the meal, hearty and ultra flavorful. My fave place to eat in Vegas!

My hunny 's family had taken my son and I here before and all the food was on point to the point we crave their curry dishes often. Each time we have gone we have amazing service everyone is kind and welcoming and the food is very reasonably priced and everything is delicious.  My son's favorite is sausage curry, and gyoza as the appetizer.  We will always keep coming back :)

Came here for late snack. I end up finishing a plate of curry. I just couldn't resist the smell of curry. The curry was as awesome as it smells. I totally recommend this place. It's really affordable too.
Items are so simple but they keep me coming back. Their curry is REALLY spicy even at level 0!
Wanted something with rice and this hit the spot. Got curry with chicken and vegetables. I would come again if I had the time.
The chicken katsu curry has the right crispiness! You can choose the level of curry spiciness to suit your taste. Fast service too.

WOW- this place is yummy!

Great curry!  Great fried food.  Even the sausages are super tasty.  You really can't go wrong with anything you order here.

This is my one of my favorite places to eat in Las Vegas! Probably the best plate of curry I've ever consumed. The service is fast, staff is friendly, and the food comes out quick and delicious! If you're over in Chinatown give this place a try!
me and my bf were trying to get a quick bite after a 5-hour driving from Grand Canyon and before heading to the show. The curry is spicy and surprisingly good
I went here for the first time back in November.  It was very good.  The service was friendly and quick.

Really good curry. I got the spicy level 2. Just the right amount of spicy. I would definitely go again. And they didn't pitch a fit about my Kung fu tea like the staff at monta ramen. If you are in that square to dine, choose zen curry for sure.
Amazing Japanese curry! I could have it everyday.  Clean & courteus service. Affordable and delicious!

Great curry house! I finally got around to trying this place out, and I'm glad I did. The curry is authentic and the spice level can be adjusted according to your preference. The first time I went here it was a Saturday night and was part of a large group (more than ten  people) and we were seated within 10 minutes. For me spicy level 4 was perfect. It creeps up on you though and lingers after, so beware! I like the spinach curry with chicken cutlet and sausage. There's some jars of pickled veggies on the table and they add a nice texture to the dishes. I like the ginger the best. Try this place out ... Great food, fast and friendly service, clean space - what's not to like?

After 3 years in Vegas this is my favorite restaurant, I love the spinach curry, tofu salad and curry pan. The prices are incredibly affordable, every time we come we are shocked to see how low the bill is. My kids love that they can pick a la carte.

Oh sweet curry zen, I fell for you the first time my taste buds...ok never mind. The curry here is amazing! I simply can't get tired of it! 3 times in one month! And the best thing about it is that you can customize it! The staff here is incredible! Service is prompt! Food is delicious!

Folks, this is the closest you can get to Coco's curry house. I had the chicken cutlet and it was on point! The curry tastes just like it does at Cocos! The service was excellent, I almost felt like I was back in Japan! The only negative thing i have to say is that its a small area to dine in and theres only 3 people preparing the food so it takes a while, but so worth the wait. Oh and they don't have Naan Bread, i know, big disappointment, but you can go to the Indian store and grab some and bring it with you, im sure the people at Zen will throw some cheese on it and heat it up for you with your meal.

Katsu breading is perfectly made. Not burnt or undercooked like other places make Katsu. Pretty big portions and filled me up good. Had vegetable curry with tofu katsu. Curry was delicious and well prepared. Everyone that I've brought to this place has enjoyed it as much if not more than I have.

Just came back from lunch here. It was totemo oishii desu yo! I had the pork katsu and croquette. The waitress told me the portions weren't that big and I was really hungry so I got the croquette too, but now I am very full and happy.  I paid $15.08 with tax for the pork katsu, croquette ($2.00), and thai iced tea ($2.50). The food came out pretty quickly. The service was prompt and the owner came out and checked on us to make sure everything was good. 

The pork katsu was crispy fried on the outside but still tender on the inside. The curry tasted as if it were home made and I suspect it is, unlike other places in town which openly state that they use a curry base that I could easily buy at the store and make myself (i.e. the curry place in the food court adjacent to Clark County community college). There was a lot of curry sauce which I like to sop up with my rice. You can get different levels of heat 1-10, everything about a 5 though there is a surcharge for. I asked for level 5 and it was a little hotter than I would have preferred but that's what i get for asking for a 5. I assumed that as Japanese food is generally not known for heat a level 5 would be about a level 2 in a thai food place but I was wrong. It was still really good and whew... my sinuses are cleared at the moment. I also liked that they give you condiments, I love condiments, they provided pickled radish which was not too heavy on the vinegar and had a really good flavor, onions that had a little beat of heat, almonds, and raisins. Also, tonkatsu sauce and extra hot chili powder. Taking another yelpers suggestion I tried the almonds which added a nice crunchiness and texture to the dish. 

That is what I like to see a restaurant that has a relatively simple menu but does it well. If anyone has seen Jiro Dreams of Sushi, then they would understand you do one thing and you do it well and you always strive to do better - and if you haven't seen it definitely a must see. 

The dining room was small but modern and clean. Upbeat vibe. I would recommend for anyone who is up for some curry. In fact with so many great places to choose in the shopping center where Japanese Curry Zen is located there is no way to go wrong!

The biggest thing I miss about living in Japan is access to really good curry rice, and Zen's is by far the best I've found this side of the Pacific. The other things on the menu are okay, but the reason to come here is a big plate of curry rice.

Some tips if you're new to Japanese curry rice:
- Don't use chopsticks. In Japan it's always eaten with a spoon. Plus it's impossible to get enough of the delicious rich curry sauce with chopsticks.
- Get a topping. Tonkatsu (pork cutlet) is traditional, but I love the chicken katsu. Try to get a bit of rice, curry sauce, and topping in every spoonful.
- Add a spicy level. The base sauce is complex and tasty, but even a level 1-2 spicy (out of ten) adds more depth without much heat. (If it helps to calibrate, it takes a level 5 spicy to get my nose running.) 

It's super busy right at the lunch and dinner hour, but has immediate seating the rest of the time. (If you have to wait, stop by Kung Fu Tea next door.) With all the businesses in a little square, parking is tight most of the time, but well worth it.

The curry is great here and the service is efficient.
But the food comes with curry is only acceptable. Especially, the meat is always dry out and taste is just ok.

So delicious! We ordered chicken katsu curry, tofu katsu curry, curry pan, and iced green tea. The green tea was from a can but still tasty. My husband loved it and it reminded him of his favorite curry place when he was stationed in Okinawa. The tofu was silky inside and crunchy on the outside. Condiments like pickled vegetables and sliced almonds were available on the table. I suggest trying them all. The curry pan was toasty, crunchy but still light and fluffy. We will visited again before we go back home! Tons of options to add to your curry to make it special.
This place is on the rotation whenever my wife and I are in Vegas. I haven't really had that much Japanese curry, but it is damn good here.

Had a Katsudon, and it was really good.
probably the best in town.
curry was real good.
yet, there was a long hair in my rice.
And I showed to a server then she replaced it.
They still cha4ged for it.
it is only a dollar, but I think they should not charged that dollar.
well, shouldn't  be a hair in the rice in  the first place, of course.
someone fromthe kitchen really should came to apologize.
it can happen, but the way they reacted was not very appropriate.
other than the incident, everything was good.
I will come back though.

Best curry in town, hands down! No other curry restaurant can compare! The chicken Katsu curry is my favorite! Come here almost every week because the food is addicting! I love it here! Service is great! I recommend everyone to try this place!

Curry was decent i got the katsu chicken curry. Nothing beats the curry from L.A but since i live here in vegas this spot will fix urge. Portions are on the smaller side so i have to order 2 plates to feel satisfied... Don't judge me.

Best Japanese curry I've ever had! It was smooth, flavorful, spicy and not too salty at all. There was no wait at 9:30pm.

I had the mini curry (cheaper and still decent portion size) with pork katsu. You could tell the katsu was freshly fried. They have the fujinikjumi (sp?), the crunchy pickled red daikon on the table so you can take as much as you want. I ate half of that little pot lol. 

Curry udon was also good but barely had any meat so best bang for the buck would be a rice curry dish. 

Only downside is the plaza is pretty tight on parking. Even at 10:30pm people are circling around trying to find parking.

The food is absolutely amazing! Chicken katsu curry is simple, but so goooood. However, the service is a little cringing. The people themselves are nice, but the actual service time itself is just so long. The longest I've probably waited for a check was 10-15 minutes. I keep coming back for the food, but I'd usually prepare ahead of time if I have some other place to be after.

This place is seriously amazing! Super fresh and authentic Japanese curry. I love the beef curry with chicken katsu... but the curry udon is also made to perfection. Everything is delicious and priced reasonably as well. Overall... if u like curry... u will love it here!!

Hands down one of the best places for Japanese curry. My boyfriend and I are regular customers here and they never disappoint. The waiters/waitresses are always very nice. Good, quick service too. The croquette curry and curry udon are so delicious! Definitely try here, you'll be addicted.

Came here for a late night dinner with friends and we were seated right away. Service was quick and staff was friendly. However, I wouldn't go out of my way to go here to be honest. It's a little out of my way. The place is rather small so I'm assuming there's a wait when they're busy. 

Food was great but then again my friends and I were starving before we arrived. We ordered chicken katsu with spice level of 2 and there was already a kick to it (just a heads up for peeps who are sensitive to heat), tokiyaki, fried shumai, and katsu-don. All were very flavorful and the portion sizes were perfect for us. 

PS - Did anyone notice why they fill their iced water only like 75% full? I constantly had to ask them for a refill.. Lol.

Fantastic service. Some of the best Katsu curry I've ever had. Appetizers are reasonably priced and the restaurant kind of reminds me of of a fun/modern approach to a Japanese curry house. Would definitely come back again on my next visit here to Vegas.

I love this place! This was my second go at Japanese curry (the first being at CoCo Ichibanya in CA) and it was delicious. I came right around when 11am their opening time. It was a small restaurant so as usual I ordered carry out. I had the chicken cutlet with a potato croquet, vegetable curry, and cheese. When reading the menu I forgot to add in the level of hotness that I wanted but I think I was given #1 since I didn't mention it. When I got it home I was pleasantly surprised at the nice amount of vegetable curry I was given. Everything was so good that I regret not taking a photo of it before I dug in. After finishing I had a good amount of curry left that I ate it the next day on some homemade rice. Can't wait to visit here again!

Ate there the other night. Food tasted great, ordered the Curry-don mild spice,  Katsu-don and deep fried siomai. Curry-don soup broth taste delicious,  not to salty, and spice is just right. Chicken in Katsu-don was tender.  Portion of the food was ok for the price. Deep fried siomai was ok. Staff was nice and attentive. 
The only Cons, place is kinda small, limited seating.
Croquette/vegetable curry and coffee jello is so good! A little busy at lunchtime but I'm glad to see them get business.

Visited just an hour ago. Great service. Waiters and waitresses are ready to serve you. The food was phenomenal. Order the Katsu-Don. I never had the dish before but it was good. Unfortunately I couldn't finish it. I love how perfect the eggs were. The were perfectly cooked. The facility is clean and it seems to be a bit busy right around lunch but that's to be expected on a Sunday. Will return!

Japanese Curry Zen is one of my favorite places to go after a hard work out, the food is fresh and hot. I've tried many places that had curry all around Vegas and this is by far my second favorite. I've only ate here at least three times and I'm really looking forward to going back!!!
Although it might not look presentable, it's very tasty. If this is your first time at Japanese Curry Zen, I recommend the Chicken Cutlet.

A friend brought me to this place after raving about it. I was dragged along one day to try it and it blew my mind! If you like spicy food, they've got you covered AND can probably get you outside the comfort zone if that's what you're looking for! A 2-3 on their spice chart is considered "medium."

The staff is great, and you'll see familiar faces if you go with any regularity. The menu obviously focuses on curry but there are a few other great options and appetizers as well.

Japanese Curry Zen has become a pretty common default option when I go out to eat. If you like curry, it won't disappoint you!

I have a new favorite curry place and this is it!  The Curry House restaurants in Orange County and Torrance had been my previous favorites, but this place just kicks it up a notch. While getting a foot massage next door I looked on yelp to find something good for dinner, and the reviews convinced me to try it. 

After going back and forth about what to try, I saw the food delivered to the table next to me and just had to ask for exactly the same thing. The gentleman said it was double chicken katsu curry with sausage and corn, and I'll be damned if it wasn't every bit as awesome as he said, but more on that later. To get started we had the edamame which was perfectly steamed and topped with the large sea salt crystals that were a great flavor addition without being too salty. We also had the gyoza which were good, but not particularly remarkable in any way. In hind sight I should not have ordered the appetizers because I would soon be stuffed beyond capacity and feeling like an overfilled water balloon! 

When the meal came the chicken was super moist and tender, with super flakey and crispy breading that blew away my expectations. The rice was perfectly done and sticky like it should be, mixing nicely with the curry. The corn was served beside the rice in a little pile, just begging to be mixed in, and the sausage looked like hotdogs but certainly didn't taste that way- more like a Polska Kielbasa with great flavor. The guy next to me sliced everything up and mixed it together, so when in Rome...well you know. Anyway, to make a long review even longer, I will add that the curry had excellent flavor and really brought the whole thing together nicely.  It was so good I think the only thing that could have made it better was getting it for free- actually, I am in town on business so I guess that means it was free after-all!  Guess I should go buy a lottery ticket now, cause I feel like I hit the jackpot with Curry House Zen tonight!

I went with a group of 10 so I called the restaurant to make reservations. When I called Zen answered and said his restaurant only holds 18 people at a time. My answer? 8 more than we needed :)

At first menu glance all we see is deep fried. Unfortunate.  Low and behold we see a beef and sausage dish and after speaking to the server found out they made a grilled chicken too. Recommended. 

Funny note. Picture of beef showed 4 pieces. We asked the server if the picture was accurate and he said there was actually 6 pieces. We were server 5.  Um ya. The server came back later with two more pieces.  

The chicken katsu was good. Lots of rice with each dish. Don't order a side of corn as its about 2 tablespoons at most really? Give me the whole damn can! Lol 

My favorite was the spinach. Go figure. Perfectly cooked. Right tenderness and not soggy. The mix it right in the curry. 

The confusing part was the spice level. Regular was 1-5. Then they had a blazing option at 6-10.  I was told medium was between 1-5 so I ordered a 2.5 to be funny but the server wasn't amused. But smiled  :). Other friends had a 5 and I could barely tell the difference. We didn't order any 'blazing's so I could compare. 

The owner came out again to greet us all after we finished and was very sweet. Tried to explain the difference in spice levels but I was already in a rice/ food coma. 

The extra star to make it a 4 was their spice mix they leave on the table. I sprinkled it on my wrist prior to ordering and was in love. I added this to all my 'shared' plates.  They also had two hot spices one which looked like crushed red peppers and the other cayenne.

Located in the same plaza as Raku, Kabuto, and Monta, Japanese Curry Zen rounds out this wonderful menagerie of awesome eateries on Spring Mountain and Decatur. 

This place is a bit small so if you if plan on coming with a group of 3+ there might be a bit of a wait during rush hour times. The bar is better suited to single eaters or 2-people groups. Still a fun, casual dining experience.

If you're doing curry, this place is a delicious choice! I ordered the base curry pork katsu ($9.45), with sausage ($2.50), corn ($0.50), and a spicyness level ($0.20). The pork katsu was perfectly crisp without being dry meat on the inside. Sausage was flavorful. Curry itself had depth and didn't taste like it came out of a box. Along with curry bread ($2), we couldn't get enough! Curry bread tastes like crack, but with curry and whatever magic is in there to make me salivate. Think pastry without the sugar and all savory goodness.

Prices are okay. You can see how it runs up pretty quickly per person. They charge quite a bit for toppings. $2.50 for three tiny sausages? Base curry is just rice with sauce and a little bit of meat all for $8-$10ish and you're still expected to get toppings? It'd be a pretty plain curry otherwise. Not as cheap as pho, but it's still pretty savory and a nice change of pace. After all the add-ons between my boyfriend and I, the bill came out to be $35ish.

Not exactly cheap for what you get, but hits the spot! Good place for a casual date night or hang-out with friends! We both left feeling pleasantly satisfied. You know food is wonderful and delectable when it stays with you on the ride home. (Well, obviously, because you just ate it.) But for instance, it just makes you feel happy like a cat on a lazy sunday.

Would come here again!

Japanese Curry is on Point! Just the right amount of curry on your plate! This is the place to go when your in the mood for good curry! Simple menu. Add toppings! Sausage is my favorite add on with the Chicken Katsu curry. Decent restaurant size. Always steady flow. Staff are friendly and also on point with water refills. Check this place out.

Right when you walk in you are warmly greeted. The waitress is super sweet and attentive.  I ordered the Curry with Pork Cutlets, Croquette, and Curry Pan.  I have never tried a curry pan but it looked good in the picture so I ordered it. My order was to go and usually other places put your freshly fried food in the to go box and by the time you get home it is all soggy.  The merry chef at Japanese Curry Zen was so thoughtful and makes sure he let's the fried pieces set and crisp before he packs it  so when you get home they are still absolutely delicious and chrisp. The order was meant to be my dinner but when I got home I just wanted a little spoon full of curry to try it out. I ended up eating my whole order right then and there! It was so good I had to finish eating everything! Man the chef knows how to cook. Curry master!!
Probably the best curry restaurant in town, but curry are actually cold/warm, I expected that should be hot.  Poke is very good, the Squid and the Oyster, you can skip.

I like Thai and Malaysian curry, but I never before had the opportunity to try Japanese Curry. Without having anything else to compare it to, I found Curry Zen to offer a tasty lunch. I had the Pork Katsu Curry ($9.45) spicy #4. The pork cutlet was fried crisp leaving it tender and juicy. The curry was rich, thick and smooth. It was bursting with flavor from the various spices used. It had just the right amount of heat. The dish was even better with a healthy dose of fukujinzuke and rakkyo. I enjoyed the bite and crunch from the pickled radish and shallot. Service was warm and friendly. I was in & out in no time.

Service was excellent and attentive.  I would rate them 5 stars if we could separate it out.  Unfortunately,  I cannot say the same for the pork katsu curry.   The Pork Katsu was slightly dry though the actually breading was light and crispy.  The curry was actually good but I was missing the traditional potato and carrots.   Instead I had a half a plate of curry sauce that drowned the rice and pork katsu.  The best thing was that they gave me an endless supply of pickled radish which is the perfect condiment to this dish.  Even though it was not the best for me as I have high standards,  I would still recommend trying them out.
A great find in LV for authentic Japanese curry! Lots of options for customizing your curry meal! Enjoy!

I love this place. This place serves the best authentic Japanese curry in Las Vegas. I recommend this place to locals and tourists. I usually order the vegetable curry with chicken katsu. Support local! (:
This place was packed. No where to park but people still waited outside in line ready to eat. Curry was wonderful. I was amazed by how many people love curry. Friendly staff and quick service.

We popped in here on a whim and it was such an unique and cute little place! The food tastes amazing and the prices are reasonable. Although the menu seems simplified, it helps customers narrow down the choices with the addition of pictures for the dishes! 

The Edamame was fresh and scrumptious. The chicken Katsu curry was the perfect blend of spicy and traditional. The dish filled our stomachs and we're happy customers. We will definitely come back again in the future! A+ food & service.
Excellent service great food cant go wrong will definitely be coming back the beef curry and pork katsu was delish
This is a medium sized local Japanese restaurant with Japanese cooks and waiter. The atmosphere is lovely and the food are yummy!

This place is FANTASTIC if you're looking for Japanese curry.  I've been coming here for the last few months at least once a week.  The place is a little small, but intimate... i personally like that.  The Chicken Katsu or SPAM katsu with spinach curry is amazing!  chicken is moist and tender and the aromas from the spices they use are to die for.  If you like SPICY  this is the place (Ranging from 1-10).  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

Great hot curry! They have 10 levels of heat for the curry. Level 3 is just right for me. Friends brought us here because they loved it. 

 I will definitely come here again!
The curry was so good I got the vegetables curry. Yummy. Satified my craving and made me full too. The server was nice as well. I would so recommend this place.
good customer service. I should have bought their chicken katsu curry..but well next time. I'll definitely come back. :)

Richard Pro here with another review.

I was skeptical of all the positive reviews--after all, curry is curry, and I've had my fair share of it. However, I'm pleased to say this place really hits the spot. Small, cramped, cozy, and warm, Japanese Curry Zen instantly impresses with soft sticky rice, a generous portion of addicting curry sauce, and a huge selection of meats.

First off, the curry is spicy! Level 3 was already more than I could handle, and it goes up to level 10. I tried pork katsu, pork tenderloin, grilled chicken, and kurobata sausage. 

The pork katsu and tenderloin taste the same yet one costs more than the other. So if I were you, I'd choose the cheaper one. You really can't tell the difference once they cut it up and fry it. 

The grilled chicken was disappointing. Dry and unmarinated. Yes, you're supposed to lather it with sauce but it doesn't change the fact that it comes dry and unmarinated.

The kurobata sausage impressed me the most. Perhaps because I've never had it before, but I was honestly expecting some kind of hot dog and ended up being pleasantly surprised. It has a nice flavor to it.

Portion size is quite generous and service is great.

Update!!! I visited again recently and they've expanded. More room to eat, same great food and service. 

This is a great curry spot in an overall cool area.  The food is great, with various levels of spice in the curry, great cutlets and with the choice of white or brown rice.  The staff is really friendly and answered each question I had.  I went twice and had a pork and a chicken katsu plate.  Each was great.  I got one at the regular, zero spice which was quite good.  I got a two a second time, and it was nicely spicy but not overpowering.  There was a great selection of drinks including sodas, canned iced teas (green and oolong) and beer and wine.  The beer is affordable with domestics being real cheap and Japanese beers being about a buck more each.  This place is a great deal and fantastic for locals or tourists.  It is close enough to the strip that you can drive over really easily.  This is a bargain compared to the usual tourist place.  I'm a big fan and plan on returning next time I'm in town.

Can't go wrong with this place. The curry satisfies my curry cravings. My go to is the Japanese meatloaf with spinach and chicken katsu for extra protein. 

Other than this location, I do go to the other location on rainbow and robindale. The app for that location makes ordering easier and it's always ready for pickup.

I really liked this place.  I've never eaten Japanese curry before so I have no frame of reference.  But I really liked the taste.  

This was as "comforty" as any comfort food I can get back home in the land of the Norwegians and Germans.  Spicier, but still great comfort food.  I'd stack this up against cheese buttons or klub any day!  You probably don't know what cheese buttons or klub even is.  Trust me...anything that stacks up to cheese buttons and klub is pretty freaking good.

The waitress and cook talked me down from a spice level 5 to a spice level 3.  I think they were concerned for my safety or something.  :)  Wish I would've stuck to my guns, oh well.

I shall return.

THE FOOD HERE IS A1 ! Basically it is my go to spot whenever I'm hungry and the staff is always kind and welcoming. They have a variety of food you can pick out, also can pick what spicy level you want, and pick your toppings to put the curry. As for the vegetarians, they have a delicious selection for that as well. The curry is always so flavorful and fresh. I usually get the Chicken Katsu curry with an appetizer of Takoyaki which is 5 pieces for $4.50. YOU HAVE TO TRY THEIR TAKOYAKI ! It is a must. Overall, it's very cheap and will make your tummy happy :3 

10/10 for this place and I highly recommend everyone to go here !

I stumbled in here randomly  when another place in the plaza was closed and I wasn't sure what I wanted for dinner.. and I'm SO glad I did! They are very friendly here and greet you as soon as you come in and when you leave. The food also arrives quickly. 

Since I always start with the tofu salad, I'll start my review with it: LOVE. I love it. I am not a fan of salads at all, but I will eat this.. I think it's because of the sesame based dressing... MMMMMMmmm.

My personal favorite here is the spinach & egg curry -- occasionally I will add corn or cheese if I'm feeling a little hungry. There just isn't much I can really say about how amazing this curry is ... you just have to try it and see for yourself! It's not anything like Indian curry.. I would say the consistency is more like gravy. It really does sounds boring and even looks kind of weird, but I assure you the flavor is anything but that. My boyfriend and I joke about how cheap a dish of curry here is, but since he loves to add all the extra options (pork katsu, chicken katsu, sausage, etc), the entree can easily become pricey (but it's okay because it's still delicious).

I love spicy foods, but for some reason I prefer the curry here non-spicy. My boyfriend on the other hand always orders at least an 8/10. I have ordered the 5/10 before and I would say that is VERY spicy (and I can handle spicy...). A little weird tidbit-- they charge you an extra 80 cents if you order more than a 5 on the spiciness scale (1-10). So if you want a spicy level of 6/10.. just go for the 5 .. or make it worth it and get a 8 or 9.. or 10! 

I am super happy that they took over the location next door and expanded the place. It used to be tiny and really wasn't big enough for more than 20 people at once.. which was common!
Food was amazing. I have tried most of the menu and I've never had anything I didn't like. The curry has perfect flavor, and you can spice it up too if you'd like.

I am OBSESSED with this place. In my eyes, this place can do no wrong. They make the chicken katsu #4 hotness the same every time I come in. If I don't know where to eat, I KNOW I will have a good experience here. Please never leave me, Japanese Curry Zen. I want a world where my future children can enjoy you :)

Craving Japanese curry?  Look no further.   Ive been coming here since the beginning.   I usually get Spam and Tofu or Spam and Korabuta.  Their Shumai is awesome as is their Fried Oysters and Tako Yaki!  I also sometimes get the Katsudon or the Curry Udon.  This place is addictive so use caution!
Super authentic Japanese curry, rivals Coco curry in Japan which is a chain store but they have the best curry. Pork katsu isn't as juicy as those ones in Japan but the curry itself is unbeatable.

By far my favorite curry house in Vegas I even bring my friends from Japan here and they love it!  Service is great and Mr zen often visit with the guest to make sure his food is of the best quality, that shows how much he cares about the people  and his food.

My list of bests are quickly filling up... 

Hands down, best curry ever!
You can easily leave feeling satisfied and happy after spending less than $10. The curry is unlike anything I've ever had-- it's definitely thinner than other katsu curries I've tasted, but still packs in the flavor. I ordered the chicken katsu with a lower spice level (1-5), if you go beyond 6-10, it's a little extra. Ojiisan (grandpa), working his magic on every order. 

Fast, delicious, friendly service. A MUST-VISIT if you've got that soft spot for katsu curry.

Spinach curry resemble saag paneer, tofu Katsu was average. The curry is just one note- spicy, can't distinguish any other flavors in it. The spice level is very deceiving, their 4 is extremely spicy. My nostrils are running, my tongue and lips are on fire- to the point where you can't taste anything anymore. I would recommend getting spice level of 1 and adding to it. If not, you will regret it.

This restaurant is definitely a Japanese curry oasis in the desert. My family and I thoroughly enjoyed the chicken katsu and udon soup. Service was excellent! We would go back tomorrow if we didn't live in the Bay Area.

What a gem, this place is truly authentic Japanese curry deliciousness.  Started with the gyozas, which were okay not fab.  For the main dish, I had a chicken katsu curry with fried egg and corn, with a spice level of 3. The curry plate was off the charts good.  Be careful with the spice level though, i am a spicy aficionado and a level 3 was mild for my taste buds.  Service waa phenomenal.

I love going to Chinatown when I'm in Vegas. Better food than on the strip and for a better price. 
I had the fried tofu and vegetables with curry, spice level 5. I love spicy food, and that was spicy but not too bad. They also let you choose between white and brown rice. It was so good, I scarfed down my whole plate, and I was stuffed :) Could've easily made it two meals.

The restaurant is near the Kongfu tea. If you go at the dinner time, it may take you some time to wait but it worths it. You can choose how spicy you want for the curry. I have chose 5 and it's kind of spicy!

I came her on a whim for a quick dinner with a friend, and it was one of the best decisions ever. 

This is a quick, casual restaurant. Their menu isn't too extensive, but it offers different meats and sides for the curry. My friend had the chicken katsu curry with spinach, while I had the chicken Katsura curry with mixed veggies. The curry is thick and rich and very flavorful, while the chicken is cooked perfectly. The chicken is moist and tender, while keeping a crispy outer surface. I definitely recommend getting the curry with veggies or spinach because this adds an extra texture and flavor to the curry.

The service was excellent, the pork katsu was perfect, and the curry was the best I have ever had. Be careful with the spice level! I love spicy food, so I ordered a 7 and was amazed by the heat level. It was still delicious and I was able to finish with no problem, but it was pretty damn hot. Love this place.

I do like the fact meet can have some fat in it but it's still good. I love the curry souce. 
If you love meet with fat then you won't like here then you should get vegii curry.
Great services!!
Nice people!!

The absolute best curry of any kind that I've ever had. The service is nice and the prices are reasonable. There's a ton of diversity in the menu, and it's definitely vegetarian-friendly! The owner and staff are always amazingly friendly. It's just a joy to eat here!
Great place . Popular destination during peak hours so go earlier. Great for families.
Came here for the first time on a busy Saturday afternoon and had a satisfying lunch! I think the reviews speak for themselves :) This place is good !

Came here last night for the first time with hubby & sister. Since it is my first time to try Japanese curry, I have nothing to compare it to.  However, here are the key points that I feel worth mentioning:

1) Ambiance:  The place is quiet when we got there and only has 2 other tables occupied. The place is clean and quite cozy.

2) Service:  It was great and food came fast.

3) Price:  I think it is quite pricey after putting the toppings that you want unless you only want the combinations they have on the menu. That's where the deduction of star came from.

4) Food:  Overall, the food was great! We ordered the following items:
 *  Chicken Katsu + Sausage - Hubby ordered it and loved it. He got it at Level 2 spiciness and felt that's all he could go for as the spiciness lingers in your mouth according to him.

* Pork Katsu w/ Egg (Lvl 2 spiciness) - My sister ordered it and she felt that it was quite good and conparable to Curry House in Cali that she and her husband's family frequently go to get their Jap curry fix.

* Original Curry + Spam + Fried Oyster w/ corn - I ordered this with level 1 spiciness (can't handle too much heat).  I found my food very delicious specially the fried oysters. The burst of flavor when I had my first bite of the oyster with the curry sauce & rice. The best description on my food that I can come up with at that moment was "It was orgasmic!" Lol! I love to cook and have pretty good palate and the flavor of this was amazing. Even spam with the curry sauce was pretty good. I had leftover food that I brought home to my 16 y/o son and he enjoyed it as much as I did. He did agree that the fried oyster with the curry sauce was to die for.

We will definitely be back for sure.  I look forward to trying the spinach curry with fried tofu. Just writing this review makes me drool. Yum! Absolutely worth trying!

My boyfriend and I loved this place. So many of our friends have posted it on instagram and Snapchat, and we finally decided to give it a try. Usually when we go to places that are over-hyped we get disappointed, but this place exceeded expectations and lived up to its hype! The food was so good, we both loved it. Definitely a MUST TRY!

FYI, parking is a little tough in this complex!

Okay, so I went back and just ordered the curry as is, no bumps up on the spicy scale! SO MUCH BETTER this time as I was able to taste the curry all through out my meal and finished it in one go! So I would say that for first timers, just get it normal the first time so you can taste the curry and it's yummyness, then on your second try, see if you can go up a level in spice, if you so dare. XD

***Yelp Challenge 2016 4/100***

No time to cook, look no further my Southwest folks! The chicken katsu is good and love the portions! I always get the spinach curry. The curry is EXCELLENTE'! I always call ahead before picking up the food. The curry pan is also awesome. Its a fried bread stuffed with curry. If you are looking for good fast Japanese curry in the SW side of Vegas, this is the spot.

You are what you eat........eat Zen!
 I happened to be at this place on the opening day. I was actually planing to eat at Big Wong when I looked across the parking lot and saw the new place with a grand opening sign so I decided to try it. The place was packed! All the tables were taken,(all 2 of them) yes is a small place and you may have to wait outside for your table, so I sat at the bar which I didn't mind because you can see everything that's going on on the kitchen. (Cooks making curry)
I ordered the shrimp curry, And even though I'm not a real fan of any curry since the strong taste/flavors seem to revisit me all through the day, like a meal that keeps on giving, but the flavors of this curry weren't too overpowering, just enough to create that indescribable and addictive flavor. The curry is made with more than ten ingredients that the menu claims that every spice or condiment used for this curry contains some holistic health benefit. (Almost as good as snake oil) So you know that every bite is good for your health on top of being good for your taste buds which is actually what counts at the end.  
   I also had the small salad  which it was crisp and flavorful and at the end of the meal the coffee jello dessert which it was good, again, not too sweet but sweet enough to call it dessert. Can't wait to try the one other dessert.
 I left that place feeling good and healthy.
Service was great and place was spotless, I guess it had to do with being the grand opening, but I'm pretty sure service will continue to be that way, the place is too small to miss you, you can literally grab your waiter from where you're sitting anytime you need something.
 So if you happen to be in the area close to this shopping center that's quickly becoming little Japan, stop and visit this new member of the family, after all we all need a little zen in our lives.
                                                                                                   ........or curry.

Just the way I remember the curry houses in Japan.  An intimate setting with name your spice level.  Even with the expanded dinning room the chef is no further away than a dinner party at home.  If curry is not your thing you won't find alternatives. The menu is just straight to the point.  Having said the 8 year old in our dinning party was quite content with the chicken cutlet and rice, hold the sauce.  Go figure.  My pork cutlet level 4, met my curry craving with high marks. Now to work my way up the ladder of heat. 1-9.  A 4 got my nose running lol.  2-3 level should be fine for medium fans.  The staff said the difference between 4 and 5 is more than the other steps.  I'll bring some tissue and take them up on that on the next visit.

There are basically two dishes: rice and curry with your choice of meat and a pork rice bowl. Also, there are only a handful of tables and some counter space at a no-frills location in a strip mall. And yet look at all of those five-star ratings... I suppose when you do both of those items perfectly at bargain prices, you have earned your five stars. I am a huge curry fan. And with that said, Japanese Curry Zen knocks it out of the park. Hell, I do not even care for breaded meat most of the time, yet both the chicken we got in the curry and the pork in the rice bowl were superb. Both dishes are incredible. My only concern is that the place is too small for all of the curry lovers in this valley.

Pro Tip: The spice levels here are no joke. They range 1-10. I love spice, but am usually a little hesitent when trying a new joint. I went with a conservative 4 and it knocked me on my toosh!

I've been here a few times with my kuya and every time, I walk away happy. I always get chicken katsu and takoyaki. The katsu is crispy and I dipped it into mild curry sauce! Service attentive and prices were reasonable. Can't wait to come back next time

The wife and I rolled up into this place as we were in the mood for some curry.  It was overcast and a little cold in Las Vegas so this sort of homey cuisine was desired.  The menu here is quite simple with lots of options.  We both ordered curry, but chose different add-ons.  The spice levels range from 1-10.  I ordered a 3 and it was slightly too hot for me, but the food was so good that I could not stop eating.  It was nice that they had extra napkins for me to take care of my perspiration.  This is a great place to check out if you are in Sin City!!!

I've been hearing about how good this place is from my friends and all that, so I decided to go eat with them here for the first time ! Upon entering, I was amazed how tiny the place is. We were all greeted in Japanese and we were all seated at the counter seats. Luckily there were seats for all 6 of us because people had to wait to get seated because the place is pretty small.  The waiter was a super nice dude; his name was Yuta or something? Anyways, he had such a happy tone and he was really kind. The chef himself was a very nice man. I was surprised he was the only cook, but he had someone in the back preparing the rice and the plates. 

The inside of the place is pretty nice despite it being small. Apparently they changed the menu design and it looks way better now, but I've never seen the old one so whatevs. The counter had a plethora of lucky cat decorations and other cute Asian stuff. I couldn't stop staring at the Asian cat that's swaying back and forth with bells in its hand, yeahhh I get distracted easily. 

I ordered the chicken katsu and I switched it to brown rice instead of white and it was not even a problem. Needless to say, it was some damn good curry. Add some of the spices and condiments to it too, it became even more damn good. I wasn't feeling like eating curry too before I got my plate, but once I tasted all the exotic spices I added with the raisins, almonds, and the other stuff, man I was sad when the plate was cleaned. 

The only bad thing that happened was me dropping my spoon into the plate of curry twice. Other then that, I'm going to be getting some more curry, some Zen curry.

I accidentally ate here. Not a huge Japanese curry fan. But my sister insisted we dine here. They have a delicious pork tenderloin. It's perfectly Crispy and tender. All in all they have comforting food and pleasant customer service. My sister mentioned that it felt like she was being hugged from the inside with every bite.

My first Japanese curry and my favorite place so far. 

Everyone here is always so polite. When you come here, you aren't a customer. You are a guest. Because of their outstanding service, it's hard not to come back. 

As far as the food goes, the curry is thick and full of flavor. There are many additional toppings to add and specials are always changing, so you won't get bored! Food always comes out hot and fast.

Also, Curry Zen is open late, so it's a great place to hit up after a late shift or an evening class. 

I go at least once a week and so should you!
Zen was a disappointment. The dishes were uninspired. A katsu pork cutlet with rice and sauce. No side veggies or garnishes. Yawn.

Truly hits the spot! The Chicken Cutlet Curry, Rice, Corn & Cheese combo is my go-to order. Portions are adequate although they could be a tad bit more generous, I think. I finish my meal in 10 minutes. It's that delicious! The meal is simple, served with a spoon. So convenient since I grew up using a spoon and a fork. Haha!

The place is super small so big parties may be a bit hard to get in. I think 3 tables and a counter so plan ahead!

The food! 

They custom created one of the appetizer specials (deep fried oysters) as a curry for me [Chef behind the counter heard me ordering, and said "no problem, we can do that"]. 

It is so delicious!

Service was lightning fast, foods were served in under 5 minutes.

Seems a little small for how busy it is, feels crowded, they could have easily filled 3 or 4 more tables if they expanded into bigger space.

The serving sizes were just right, I cleared my plate, but wasn't hungry afterwards.

I really like that they offer a wide range of curry spiciness, on a scale of like 1 to 10 I believe. Perfectly accommodating everyone in a family or a group. They also have genuine vegetarian options, again accommodating everyone in the family.

This is my first time at a fusion Japanese curry restaurant. I will definitely be bringing my family here.

Small place located north west of Spring Mountain and Decatur intersection, in the same plaza as the popular Monta Ramen, Raku Japanese Grill, or the elegant Kabuto sushi. 

Over the years, I haven't been much of a japanese curry lover but I will still eat it periodically. This place is small but is managed by a very friendly, welcoming staff. 

Very small, defined menu highlighting their main focus, curry. Plain curry, chicken katsu curry, or pork katsu curry. Of course there are other things on the menu or add ons but in this review, i will not get into it. On the back of their menu, they list every, or almost every spice they use in the curry, as well as a brief description of each of what it does to help you (health wise) 

On the table, there are 7 different bottles. Of course the normal salt and pepper, but they have 3 others. The normal 15 spice blend they use in the curry that gives a mild spiciness. As well as a medium and a hot blend of spices. The final 2 bottles are the usual red pickled ginger you see normally in japanese restaurants and i believe was pickled baby onions? not sure. What i had found out which was a nice touch was that they do NOT put the ginger on the side of the curry, where most restaurants do. I thought it was a nice touch because i am not much of a fan of ginger, overall. 

This first, and only visit I have made (so far), i had ordered chicken katsu curry. Presented in a normal fashion. Round plate. 1/2 white rice. 1/2 katsu covered in the curry sauce. 

Of course, first thing i would taste is the curry sauce. Nice brown color. Very smooth upon taste. Very flavorful. Can taste a lot of the spices but with a small kick from i believe either paprika or cayenne (i dont remember the list of spices they had listed). This place makes their curry sauce well. 

Besides the curry sauce, of course they had the katsu. Wasn't too amazed by this though. It was cooked thoroughly, but maybe a little too long. Meat was dry and the thickness varied greatly on the piece of katsu. The breading was a bit stuff, and not "loose". Not sure how to describe it. What i believe to be a perfectly made katsu is an even thickness cut of meat either cut or pounded thin, breaded with panko bread crumbs and fried to a golden brown, long enough to be cooked but fast enough to still be juicy, as well as have a flaky crust. 

Price pretty reasonable. $4.95 for the plain curry. Then additional $3 for chicken katsu, $3.50 for a pork katsu, and they had other things. 

But aside from the katsu, maybe they are still correcting themselves on the timing, ill give them another chance in the future, the curry is great. probably the closest to genuine japanese curry you will find in Vegas for now. Good place to visit but remember, space is limited, to maybe.. 20ish seats total.

This location of Curry Zen is located on an overcrowded along with few other popular restaurants in the same strip mall, parking can be very limited during peak hours.  They do have a fast turnover rate at this place, and table free up rather quick for the times we visited them.

First time I was there was in a hurry, the curry was rather plain here, and their explanation was because their curry is so good that they do not need anything else beside the sauce... a bit too proud?  The flavor was just ok from all the curry I had eaten around the world.  Another time I avoid the curry, and got Katsudon instead, and it was actually much better choice, and they made the right way too.

Other starters we tried were Deep Fried Shumai and Takoyaki.  Shumai was just "meh", a bit too dried, and bland.  The takoyaki was just ok as well, a bit too floury on the inside.

I guess my expectation was a bit high being in Vegas and all, but Curry Zen would not be a first choice for me if I had a craving for Japanese cooked dish.  The staffs seemed like they have an attitude problem too.

First off, I just wanted to say that anyone who knows me knows that I love love love curry! Japanese and Thai Curry to be precise! Growing up, my mom's home made curry was always the best. I mean, who doesn't love 'mom's' cooking, right? 
As unfortunate as it was, I moved to Vegas and the months grew to years; my taste bud fell short, unsatisfied by the curry palettes offered in Vegas. Almost everything was a hit or miss! It was either the curry sucked and the meat was perfect, or the other way around. Booo!

Any ways, long story short, I found this place off of yelp and it was a romantic story between my dish and I. Love at first sight. I couldn't keep myself away! Is it bad that I COULD EAT IT EVERYDAY!? NO PUN INTENDED. LOL. 
Meat ever so tender, various side options to satisfy the texture cravings, and curry spices to what ever heat you wish! Simply amazing. 
Aside from the food being tastey, service is and always has been delightful. 

The End.

I don't really have a lot to say about Curry Zen.
It's just an average place all around in my opinion.

The curry is decent in flavor but the price seems a bit much. The menu is set up so that you pick your curry base and then from there you add on whatever you want to dip in your curry. So far I've gotten the chicken katsu and kushi options. The food is good. It's why I've come here a few times, but in all honesty it just feels average. Nothing really stands out to me. It doesn't leave me wanting more. It's just average.

They do earn some brownie points for having a rating system on the spiciness of their curry that is actually accurate and wonderful presentation on the plate.

Other than that, I really have to be craving curry specifically if i'm going to go out of my way to come here.

I have never had this kind of food before eating here. I just love it. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who is not afraid to try new things. I loved it so much that I went back six times in one month.

Maybe I'm not the best person to be writing this review, as curry isn't my favorite, but I enjoyed my experience so I will comment on that.

I ordered chicken katsu with the lowest level of spice. The chicken was really good and the curry wasn't spicy! I definitely could have done a couple levels higher, so if you don't like spice get level one. I also tried some of my boyfriends tofu katsu which was good as well. I usually have tofu with peanut sauce, but the tofu katsu went well with curry!

The service was great! They were very attentive and checked on us often. The restaurant is kind of small, so I can see there being a line if it was earlier on in the evening (we went around 9pm or so).

Haven't been here since they first opened.... They have expanded the menu since then and finally added croquettes!! My favorite!!! Plus they have added a spinach curry and some katsu tofu for the vegetarian crowd.... Interesting.... I'll have to try it out next time ;)
It's not my place . I tried lots of appetizers but I wouldn't go back again .It was very strange food and Tastes that I don't really like . The service was very good .

Nom nom nom!!!! 

This place is absolutely delicious!
Love the chicken katsu, pork katsu, shrimp and always curry spicy level 4!!
Very friendly, very welcoming.

Nice little addition: cute seat cushions glued to the bench for your comfort and safety :D

This is a small Japanese restaurant on Spring Mountain Rd. They specialize in Japanese curry, that is hand stirred and smooth. If you've never had Japanese curry, you need to try this joint. 
My friend and I were looking for a place to dine and to chat a little and we decided to go here. As we've never had curry before, it was interesting to us. The area is small and they have about 20 seats, it doesn't have a patio, so it's not comfy for large groups, but for two or three people it is perfect. The service is pretty good, it took about 15 min. to get our order. The prices are reasonable. 
I went for the pork cutlet curry and my friend went for the chicken. Both were very well prepared with a nice gold crust. Very yummy:) Now I can say that this is an excellent cooked home style food and after trying this food we became curry fans)))

The curry house I have been hunting for.

After living in Japan for a number of years, I developed a slight addiction to CoCo curry. For years, I have been searching to find something here in the States that could satiate my CoCo craving, and Zen nailed it.

The service is outstanding, always pleasant and willing to meet my special requests, food is spot-on every time I go.

I love this place.
The portions were good sized, you choose the flavor additions to the curry. Overall an excellent small eats spot with big portions. Just be prepared to wait for a parking spot.

2 years later I returned to visit my grandma.  This place is just as good as it was before but it has expanded!  This food is so great - the chicken and pork cutlets are so perfect (perfect amount of fat in the meat, perfect panko breading and fried perfectly).  The curry is so good and the price so reasonable.

I'm glad they expanded to allow for more people to eat this delicious food.  I'll return here every time I come to Vegas.
Fantastic, deep flavor on the curry that you might be taken aback by, katsu was on point, spinach curry so good.

Tasty Curry! I like this place a lot especially because you can chose the level of spice you want. I generally like spicy, and so level 2 wasn't so bad. There was kick to it but I'm sure I could have gotten a higher level of spiciness. I do wish the portion was a little bigger though, but I still would come back regardless! Two thumbs up!

Love this place so much! I come here so often and most times with my cousin. Never lets us down! 

First the food! I always get the tofu katsu curry which is amazing! The gyoza is always perfectly cooked and the croquette, which I just recently tried, is flavorful! Their tofu salad and the dressing are addictinggg!! Definitely a must try! As for dessert, the green tea cheesecake is heavenly. The slice is small but trust me, it's perfect and satisfying.

Now, the service is also great. There's a few servers that already recognize us every time we come in and they always greet us with a smile. They're very helpful and kind! Ill definitely continue my semi weekly visits :D

This is such a little gem. The curry was perfect and I was so happy to see that we could add the spices ourselves. I wish there was fried egg on the add-on menu but the simplicity of it is what makes this Japanese Curry amazing. 

Service was amazing and it was great to see one of the chefs interacting with us. 

Will come back for sure.

We stopped by Zen's around 8 on a saturday night. There was a waitlist, but after standing around for a few minutes, we were seated early since we only had a party of 2.

I got the vegetable curry with tofu katsu, and my boyfriend got the pork katsu curry with a spice level of 8. He loved his dish, and the spiciness was intense, but delicious - aka not just spicy for the sake of spice. My curry was amazing, and the tofu katsu was deliciously crunchy. I was so happy they had a vegetarian curry on the menu! I assume it was vegan, but I didn't think to verify.

We had only ever had japanese curry made from store-bought blocks, and this knocked it out of the park. When we're in Vegas again, we'll definitely be back!
Amazing food. Good prices and quick service! The staff was really friendly and we had a bunch of different options to try. Definitely recommend if you are the food enthusiast type

Walked in with zero expectation because I just wanted something to eat, and this place is AWESOME! Very clean, quick, and all the workers are super nice. I ordered curry udon, which I've never ever had, and wow it was so good!! My friend got chicken Katsu curry and it was amazing as well. Crunchy, yet soft... Mmm. Everything was amazing!

My husband and I were famished after our unintentional fast during the day, and on a recommendation from a friend we came down here, and we are sure glad we did! 

Curry Zen is a very small space, but very clean and cute, and I couldn't have felt more welcome. The staff there seemed genuinely happy to serve us and make sure we were okay during our short visit, which cinched me wanting to come back here (if the food didn't already!). 

Both of us ordered the same meal - Tofu Cutlet Curry with brown rice, and added corn and added vegetables. 

The presentation of this is quite nice (although it's hard to make curry look appealing) and the taste was out of this world! Just the right amount of spice and it seems so rich but still with a light feel. The tofu cutlets were definitely the stars of the show and I hope they keep it on the menu because they were fabulous - lightly breaded and fried and just crazy delicious. The amount of corn (add on 50 cents for about 1/3 cup) was decent, however for a $2 add on of vegetables there was maybe half a cup in there and it was drowned in the curry sauce. I wish there was a bit more for the price offered. If you looked at the plate, you wouldn't have seen the $2 veggies except for a couple potatoes popping up from it. 

All in all though, both of us practically licked our plates clean and also were out of there in less than a half hour - it hit all the right spots! I will definitely be back although the price was a little up there for a vegan curry plate. However I will be adding it to my favorite vegan-friendly destinations and will think of this plate of deliciousness often!
BEST Japanese Curry in town. I always bring clients here and we love the curry. Great stop for a quick and inexpensive lunch.
Place is unassuming simple menu based on Japanese Curry good price.

Came here because I wanted Monta's kimchee fried rice to go haha. I also had a good craving of places like Coco ichibanya which I can't get anymore at home unless I drive a good while so Japanese Curry Zen really hit the spot in every way.

Although the service wasn't exactly the smartest cause we were trying to share some appetizers but waiter dropped it off w/ no plates and one utensil. -_- 

With that said, I thought the  curry was great. I got level 5 and I thought it was great. It was spicier than I thought it would be but I also tried a lvl 9 and it tasted the same for odd reason so I say just get the lvl 5...save the extra cents. The pork katsu was really good. I usually get scared when they put a lot of fat into my pork(where they basically rip you off cause it's so much fat) but that didn't happen. Croquette was okay too. Really, the spotlight was the curry + pork katsu cause it really tasted great.

The one thing I did mind was the amount of rice curry ratio. So little rice(the curry amount was fine) but I didn't want my rice to be all drenched up because of how little rice they give me. 

I do recommend it if you're a local.

Basically in love with going to this place! curry Zen gives me that warm feeling (no pun intended) that I can't get at many other places. My friends and I have been frequenting this place for almost a year now and I couldn't be happier that I was introduced to this location since. I'm not the pickiest eater but I love a good presentation and a good selection. This place however, is GREAT. They have adjusted their menu/style since I first started coming here and prior that I didn't believe the place could get any better. 
Their wait staff has changed over the course of time and I'm honestly happier about that. Their staff from the past couple of months are noticeably more attentive, friendlier, and I always get the vibe that they're happy to be here. As busy as it gets, I'm appreciative that the service never seems weary and gives the place such an amazing atmosphere. 
About the food: AWESOME. I always get the tofu katsu curry, with or without extras. This time I got 4pcs extra and I was super happy about this. Lately I've been ordering their jelly vodka.. And they're usually out of the berry option but the wonderful waitress suggested the Yuzu option. Tasted great! It's hard to find a place that knows how to pair their drinks with their food so well. Usually it's random and doesn't seem to fit. But I have the best time with their selection.
Final thoughts are that I can't wait to go back! I highly recommend Japanese Curry Zen to anyone who is looking for a great dinner or lunch!
always come here.  Ppl r nice and good food. Curry wudong with fried shrimp is the most comment meal.

The curry was very authentic. Service was very good as well. We were out of town and I was craving some good Japanese food. We all get sushi and Japanese BBQ everywhere. However, to get a good Japanese Curry place was a very unique thing especially in Vegas. You guys should start something in Little Tokyo in LA. The food was delicious. The spice level was proper, the chicken was cooked perfectly.

We had fried oysters and Shumai as a appetizer. I ordered the Original Curry #2 with Pork Katsu and Croquette. It was a little too spicy for me, but still good. Next time I'll just order it without increasing the spice level. The Fried oysters we very good and the Shumai was really small, but still good. All in all, VERY yummy.

The curry udon (spice level 5) was so delicious. It was perfectly seasoned and the noodles weren't overcook! Thank goodness! I'm sad I don't live in Vegas and can't get this all the time. Still craving and dreaming about this meal!

For one, the space is so tiny and uncomfortable. If there is a wait you have no choice but to wait outside because there is literally no space to wait inside. The curry is just OK. I love curry, I make curry and I order it all the time. I was really expecting alot I guess after reading the reviews. I got katsu curry which was good but with barely any chicken. The curry sauce is pretty spicy and I only got a level 3 so be careful if you're sensitive to heat. The service was great and I have no complaints there. They also do not have fountain drinks, so if you want soda you are limited to whatever cans they have available. Over all, I don't think I will be back.

Heard good things about this place, so I wanted to check it out for myself.  Enjoyed the Chicken Katsu Curry and added Kurobuta Sausage to it.  The curry had the right texture and flavor, while the portion was just right as well.  The Chicken Katsu was nice and crispy.  You can tell great care is taken in making the curry.  Service was good and everyone was friendly.  It's not a big place so get there early or take it to go.

I like curry, but it was never something I thought about on my own or craved. When I came here, I actually wasn't sure what my expectations were because I know so many people who absolutely love this place, yet I wasn't sure how convinced I was since I'm not exactly a curry enthusiast. 

However, here I am, thinking about how much I want to eat it again every day since I went (about 4 days ago). 

I ordered a standard chicken katsu curry spice level 3. It was the perfect level of spice for me and I enjoy spicy food. No toppings were added besides the house picked radish. 

The katsu itself was delicious and had the perfect crunch. The curry was flavorful and warmed by body and the radish added a nice crunch. The meal overall just felt like comfort food. Even though I know it's part of the aesthetic, my only complaint is that I wish the curry wasn't layered over part of the katsu. I like the crunch of the katsu and layering the curry over it makes it soggy. But that's just a personal preference, like I don't really enjoy nachos because I dislike the sogginess. I'm more of a dipping type of person haha. 

Service was super friendly and food came out quick. Now I understand what the hype was all about!

I had my doubts when I saw the pictures of dishes, they look plain and lacking, but I'm glad I came.
