I ordered the Katsu Chicken at heat level 5. It's amazing. The sauce with the rice is just enough flavor.

Service, the 2 servers were extremely friendly and seemed to always smile.

Would definitely return.

I'm sure the shopping center where Curry Zen is located has now become a mini japan town. With the addition of curry, the japanese menu is just about complete for this area. 
The restaurant itself is small but very cozy. Got the pork cutlet with croquette. Both were done very well and the curry tasted delicious too. total came to around $11-12 which I guess is reasonable. I actually kinda wished the curry came with some vegetables already in it because just the sauce seems kind of... too simple for me. I guess for its price, I expected more. Overall, service was excellent and I'm actaully hoping they will add more variety to the menu.

This is really such a shame, since this place came so close to a 5 star curry perfection, marred from numerous small missteps, missing lunch menu items, and minor details.

First of all, the chicken katsu is the dish to get, hands down. I tried both pork and chicken, and the chicken was breaded and fried to such a perfection that I almost had misty eyes. The chicken is perfectly seasoned and fried with such an amazing crispy layer without requiring extra calories just to bite through the protein. The pork, unfortunately, did not get the memo, as the meat was much tougher and less flavored than its other white meat cousin. Since this was my first and possibly the last visit, I had tried a series of appetizers. However, the takoyaki was gone and we showed up literally 15 minutes after the store opened. The fried oyster exceeded my expectation as it was juicy and marinating in its own sauces when I bit through the crispy exterior. The tofu salad was good (although I've never been a fan of iceberg lettuce) and we also tried the edamame (overly salted and many were shriveled), the chicken skewers (protein on a stick, forgettable). As for the main course, my friend and I got he brown rice with curry and the respective meats. I tried a spicy level 8 and it was sizzling, but not cathostrophic. The curry, in my opinion was just a little bit too salty for my taste, but made more bearable when eaten with the curry. Oh yeah, we also ordered the peach jelly champagne, which was an interesting experience, but not sure if it was worth $7.5.

Overall, this is definitely a popular spot amongst the locals, as the place filled up pretty quickly by 12:30pm, so I recommend coming early and preparing your dining experiences.

Food: 4 stars
Price: 3-4 stars
Service: 3 stars
Ambiance: 3 stars

Wow, I didn't write a review for Curry Zen? Weird. I'm quite a regular here.

Simply put, the best Japanese-style curry house in Vegas. Period.

There's Kaba Curry nearby, which is also good, but Zen is better on all fronts.

Zen also offers Curry Pan! It is a Japanese comfort food, crispy fried bread with curry inside. You cannot imagine what it is like until you actually eat it, but believe me, it's a popular food category in Japan.

My favorite is veggie curry with pork sausages. The pork sausage is a beloved "schau-essen," if you know what I mean.

And yes, they offer brown rice too! Now you won't get sleepy even when you have a full belly.

II am 99.9 % :)sure this is the best curry in town. 

I always seem to order the potato croquet  and a side of corn and cheese, but I have also sampled the katsu and have to say that was delicious too.  Definitely take a look at their board for their daily specials. The curry is very tasty and reading the long list of its spices and health properties makes you feel good eating the curry too. They also have a condiment tray  with raisins, pickled onions, and radish which adds great taste and texture. 

The restaurant is really small with maybe 5 tables as well as a counter with stools therefore you may encounter a bit of a wait at times, but it is so worth the wait.   The coziness of this place is especially welcomed during the winter months. 

I have always experienced great service and a nice touch is also the greeting received from the owner.

I have to say this place has the best home-made curry in town. I am here at least once a week and now the staff recognized me and will automatically put in the order for me once I walk in the door. All staff are very friendly and of course, the curry was delicious. Highly recommend!!
Best tasting curry in town... I tried a lot of places. And this is the best by far. Nice and simple. Nothing to crazy

Inexpensive ($8.95 for the chicken Katsu curry). Great and attentive service. Also tried the fried tofu curry, which was battered really well. Options for spicy add-on to your curry. I usually like it medium, but even getting the 3 (out of 10) was plenty spicy for me. Cheap beer (eg. 20 oz Kirin bottle for $5). Only negative is that I would have liked something else to cut the heat of the curry a bit (the tofu curry came with corn for example).

Welcome to man vs. food:  Japanese curry edition. That's the first thing that came to mind regarding portion sizes. I always have leftovers, and the leftovers reheat very well. You can get chicken katsu curry with veggies... SPICY!  They have a spicy rating system like you'd expect from a Thai place except this is obviously Japanese.  Their spam, beef, veggies, it's all good.  You can order no wrong here.

If you love Japanese curry, I recommend this place. Ordered the beef & pork Katsu curry as well as a Katsu Don. For appetizer, we ordered he Shumai, didn't really expect it to be so small for the price you pay for it, but nonetheless, it was good. We went about 2 hours closer to closing time, on a Sunday and didn't have to wait for a long time. The service was ok, took longer than expected to order but it was probably because we were sitting in the corner. The ambience was cute and quaint, definitely felt like you were in a Japanese restaurant from Japan. This place is located in a very popular little center, so parking can be a little tight but there is street parking available.

Great place! 
Curry was just right amount of spice.
And it went perfect with rice and the chicken. 
As simple as it is, it just taste great.
And the price of the place is very affordable.

Our favorite Ramen joint (montas) was closed so we ventured into JCZ...  good call fellas!!!

Had the pork katsu curry @ level 3... added a fried egg and a croquet... da Bomb!!!

P2P was - On Point

Left there not stuffed but perfectly satisfied.

Now we know if the line is too long at Monta's we'll drop right in on the Zen.

Always come here without a fail when I come to Vegas. The curry ordering concept is pretty simple - you pick your curry base, rice, toppings, and spiciness level. There are other options on the menu - of which I've only tried the katsudon (pretty good). 

It gets pretty busy around lunch time so it's best to come earlier if you're in a rush and/or want to find a good parking spot. The complex it's in is not exactly the best, but the food here makes it worth while.
The Beef Curry & Spam Cutlet was tasty. I'll be back for some more.

If you were ever in the military and stationed in Japan and went to Coco's Curry, this place is right up there with it. Great selection of sides (shrimp, spinach, katsu, corn). Also the spice levels are really well balanced. This place is a very authentic Japanese curry house. The feel is very close to being back in Japan. The only thing is don't come around dinner time. I was here are 7 on Tuesday and the parking lot was packed. I highly recommend this place.

By far my favorite curry place in town! The curry here is so flavorful and satisfying. The staff are friendly, quick, and courteous and the food always comes out quick. Definitely worth trying if you've never had Japanese curry!

The curry is pretty okay and the portions are also acceptable. The price may stack up pretty high if you like toppings and things in your curry other than just curry sauce. 

They have ramune

I'm a Japanese curry snob and this is the best in Vegas. The flavor of this curry is really exceptional. My favorite part is when I order veggies I actually get big chunks of veggies that appear to be fresh. Other places it is the mixed frozen vegetables which are tiny and that's why it's obvious they were the frozen ones. The rice is cooked nicely, the red and white ginger are nice additions and I like that I can help myself and don't need to ask for it. A 2 or 3 is very hot, a 10 is I don't know, I never got it. I did see someone order it once though, wow. I like really spicy and a 3 is really spicy. I like seeing the list of health benefits listed for eating curry. The food comes fast to the table and has always been consistent. Menu is simple but nice. 

I also like that the chef (assuming the owner, but maybe not) always thanks us for coming (at least that's what I think he is doing since he speaks in Japanese). :)
If I had a wish, it was that a small salad came with the meal. I also wish for non fried items, since beef chunks is the only protein on the menu that is not fried.

Had the pork cutlet curry. Overall, better than average. Not the greatest but still better than normal. 

What sets them apart is the service. They're really accommodating, especially since we had a baby with us. Great service. The waiter, which we found out was the chef's son, got his friendliness from his dad.

This place is awesome.  Amazing, flavorful Japanese curry.  Spice levels from 1-10, packing some serious heat in the higher levels.  Make the 5 minute drive and get away from the nasty overpriced strip food and try this one out.

We were disappointed with multiple strip meals and decided to try something out here.  A couple minutes later we had narrowed our choice down to Japanese Curry Zen, pulled in the parking lot, and were quickly seated.

The menu is decent sized, full of chicken, pork, beef, sausage, shrimp, and all sorts of other curry.  I went with the pork katsu, my girlfriend did the chicken.  We had some fried gyoza to snack on before the meal as well.  The fried gyoza was great.  Crispy, tasty, and a good price.  The curry came out pretty quickly as well and we were in heaven.  Tasty curry, good meat, and great rice.  For under $10 this was way better than anything we had on the strip for $25+ a plate.  

Service was good, drinks were always topped off and everything was prompt.  We were in and out in under 45 minutes, paid around $30 with tip, and were on our way.

I won't eat on the strip again.  Every meal we had there was disappointing and overpriced.  5 minutes off the strip we had excellent meals, with this being one of them.  Seriously do yourself a favor and come out here if you're visiting!
The curry here is awesome and I'm not much of a curry lover. Love the vegetable curry with chicken tenderloin or pork katsu. Also love that they offer brown rice!

Straight up Best Curry in Vegas!! The flavor of their curry is phenomenal. I usually get chicken katsu, shrimp katsu, kurobuta sausage and/or corn. I LOVE their pickled condiments!! I feel so bad sometimes because I can and I have ate the whole jar before! I'm not sure what the red one is but based on flavor I think it is red daikon- japanese radish. The other one is pickled pearl onions. Oh and I love spicy anything and my first time here I ordered spicy level 6 (1-10) and omg it was really SPICY! I still ate it because it was sooo good but I had to have water and pickled daikon after each bite hence why I ate the whole jar once lol. Now I order level 3...which is STILL PRETTY SPICY but just the right amount for me.

Very good japanese curry although had to order extra tofu katsu and corn for party of 2. The Takoyaki is fine not as good as Jinya. Service was great and you get to served pretty fast which is a plus for Japanese restaurants.

Zen Curry is one of my favorite places to go if I'm feeling like treating myself to a hearty meal. It averages out to about $10-$14 a plate for a person depending on what they customize your plate with. What I really like about the menu is customizing the spicy levels of your meal, rating from 1 (mild) to 10 (burning your butthole.) 

If it is your first time trying Japanese curry, you can never go wrong with the chicken katsu curry plate. But if you're feeling adventurous, I suggest you try my plate: scrambled eggs with spinach, tomato, cheese and sausage curry with 16 grains rice--best hangover cure ever! 

Only downside, parking lot is ALWAYS full. :( but don't let that stop you from getting the best Japanese curry you'll get in Vegas!

It is Japanese style curry restaurant.
I ordered curry and fried fried oysters and Dakoyaki.

The curry tasted just ok and the others were delicious.

Came to try out this spot after a friend recommended it to me and yeah...glad I did! Cute little spot with delicious curry (you can choose your spice level..yes!) and combinations making you come back for more. 

I got the small curry with tofu, veggies, and sausage spice level 5 and my bf got the regular pork cutlet with veggies and fried shrimp spice level 3. They were both really good and filling!! I'm going to try a spicier level next time. We ordered a couple desserts (coffee jello and something with pineapples on it) and it was a good way to end our meal.

Overall, the waitresses were nice and food was delish! We'll be coming back this week... :)

This place can so no wrong 

Been here a couple times and despite the small setup, never really had to wait unlike the surround choices. 
The service is always quick and the food of course is what keeps me & my boyfriend coming back. 

Always order the chicken katsu with cheese (you have to ask for chopsticks) but they are good with making sure you have water in case you're still trying to determine which spice level is best for you. 

The menu indicates a 1-10 based spice level, but trust me, you can go beyond that. They charge extra on 5 range increment. So if you're thinking of going for an 11, it'll cost you the same to get a 15. 

I'll try it next time I'm here, but they have Kirin beer! 
The food honestly doesn't look like much when the bring it out to you, but it's the perfect amount. The chicken is always fresh and nothing ever tastes old :)

LOVE this place!
If you're craving some authentic Japanese curry, this is it! I used to always go to Curry House in LA but this place tastes much better! 
They have a lot of good options on their menu but I usually stick with the most common chicken katsu curry. Croquettes are also BOMB! They definitely have something for everyone!

One down side is that parking can get a bit crowded in that plaza but the food is well worth the hassle :P. There also may be a bit of a wait to get a table if you go during lunch/dinner hours but last time I went I had no wait.

It's so hard to find a good Japanese Curry around here, I'm used to one with more veggies in it, but this one was dee-lish. 

The staff was friendly, helpful, and there was a lot more on the menu that I wanted to try, but as a solo Diner I didn't have the stamina or strength to try everything... So I will definitely be back.

I just had the basic chicken katsu curry and it was amazing, satisfying, everything you would need on a rainy day craving some oh so good Japanese comfort food!

While the space is tiny, it's full of character and attitude. (In a good way.) The food is simple, fresh and delicious while the service is friendly and polite.
It's such a great (and inexpensive) alternative to the myriad of chain restaurants offering bland and unimaginative food on the Las Vegas Strip as well as suburbs.

WARNING: Japanese Curry Zen is by no means going to transport you back to Japan, it does not offer an upscale dining experience, nor does it feature a famous chef. It will, however, delight you with a wonderful burst of flavors and simple authenticity. I'll definitely be back.

Meh. The menu is short and simple which is fine. My beef is this: 
Overpriced rice & curry dish = Rice+ Protein +Curry*Full or Half-order. 

For $6-$9 this does not have anything worth going out of your way for. The curry itself did have a character of its own. But at the end of the meal, it wasn't worth the curry burps I inflicted on my girlfriend, coworkers, and anyone in a throwing stars reach. 

Not to mention the small butt parade stomping through my intestines by the end of the night. Christ! I love curry from all regions of Asia, but I haven't heard my stomach make these sounds since I was forced to watch 5 minutes of Twilight. At least then I passed out and it was over.

In spite of my sarcasm, the service was decent and orders came out quickly. I wouldn't make an out of the way trip for this place, but if someone is determined to go, you happen to be with them, and drinking, sleeping, taking an SAT/GMAT, or a 24hr Roberto's is still not an option because it's closed...go check it out. But there are several other places in that shopping center that are worth more of your time.

Our favorite japanese curry place closed in Los Angeles like 10 years ago and we've been trying to find something comparable since.  Most places are poser curry makers.  We can tell that curry zen put their own secret sauce so it doesnt taste generic.  

So far we've tried the chicken katsu curry as well as the vegetable curry.  Both are very good and tastes like a kick ass home-made meal.  The chicken is all white meat which I love!  You can also adjust the spiciness according to your risk tolerance.  I love spicy foods and I find they tend to make it more spicy than not...so definitely be cautious with selecting spiciness.

Parking can be a headache sometimes but its well worth it.  I think they recently renovated the restaurant so its way more spacious than before!
This place is the closest to CoCos :) They renovated and has much more seating room than before.

I went on a hike at red rock canyon. Afterwards I was starving for some spicy food. I wanted to try something new and I was in Chinatown area. I've never had Japanese style fried chicken with curry sauce. It looked interesting, so I decided to stop by.

I started out by ordering Ashi ($2.95/small glass). I ordered Toko-yaki (~$4) and fried shu-mai ($3.75). Toko-yaki was batter was good, but the octopus was bit too chewy. Fried shu-mai are really small, but they have good flavor and frying anything makes it great. 

My main course meal was the chicken katsu with level 10 spicy curry. This might be the first restaurant to charge money to make things spicy (like I won't be paying a price next morning). When I the plate the curry sauce looked red hot (not sure if you can see it in the pic), but upon eating it I was bit disappointed with the spice level. However, I became a fan of this meal. I think this is the best way to eat a fried chicken. The chicken was tender and the batter was just the right amount. Rice and curry also complimented very well with juicy chicken. The price is also perfect $9 for the whole meal. 

I will definitely be back for more. The only negatives I can say is that the TVs are tiny, and I wish the bathrooms didn't smell like someone had a curry explosion. The service is good and the servers take their time to explain the menu item if you are new. 

Check out this place, it really is a gem, but stay away from their bathroom and bring a pair of binoculars if you want to watch a football game on their TV.
Best Japanese curry in las vegas. Very authentic and pork cutlets cooked perfectly. Only place to go if you're in the mood for Japanese style curry.

Amazing Japanese Curry place in Las Vegas. I was in Japan the past couple years so I know a little about Curry, Ramen, Sushi, etc. The curry here is very similar to what I would get for lunch down the street from where I lived. I ate at their new location today on S Rainbow Blvd. It was very empty but the food was just as good. I almost prefer it because it was new, the sitting area is more open, and the fact that it was quiet atleast for now.. since I do like my quiet. Lol. Also, they were very friendly :)

It might be worth noting that I always get the Chicken Katsu Curry and Thai Iced Tea which is just over $12.

Zen Curry hands down has some of the best customer service compared to a lot of other Asian restaurants in Vegas. While the size of the store makes it feel a bit cramped at times when it's busy, I can let it slide since whenever I eat there I always end up feeling a bit better than when I left.

But let's get to the nitty gritty -- the food. I love curry and I'm not a stickler from where it comes from. Amongst all the places I've tried curry from (Thai Noodle House, Surangs Thai Kitchen, Mt Everest, Shuseki, and various Korean restaurants) I think Zen Curry's is my favorite. The curry itself has a nice density to it and the flavor always stands out. Combined with large portion sizes at a decent price, eating here won't break the bank.

The menu itself is pretty simple (katsu, pork, steak) but they have a large board that has some specials in terms of what meat or addons you can get for your curry.
True to Japanese Curry!! They should really open up more locations in town. I would be there several times a week if they were only closer. Price point to good too!
Food is very good! Curry reminds me of Jamaican style curry. The chicken katsu was perfect and the portion for price is terrific. Highly recommend.

Got the pork katsu curry, spice level 3, for takeout. Friendly service, though I was in there for a limited time. Appreciated how the curry sauce was packed separately from the rice and protein. Ample portions of all- had leftover rice and a large remaining puddle of sauce. Good value- per person total is around $11 without add-ons.

Side note about the spice: should have been a warning to see that spice levels 1-5 is "free". I thought a 3 would be safe, but the spice nearly made me sick towards the end. Good warm burn, but perhaps scale back to a two if you don't love spicy food. Solid place to get Japanese curry, love the straightforward menu.

Unbelievably simple, simply amazing.
Don't let the simplicity fool you! I could not believe how moist the chicken katsu curry and how there was a good kick with spicy level 3. 

Wine and beer available.

Great food and the best curry I have had in Vegas. Curry is great for any craving that you may have. The staff is super nice and friendly although they can get a little busy and ignore you sometimes. 

My go to are the meatloaf and beef curries. The tonkatsu is classic and great as well. Pretty much anything mixed with curry you can't go wrong.

This is literally my favorite place to eat. Not joking. I can come here literally everyday and not get sick or tired of it. If I could, I would eat curry for breakfast lunch and dinner  the service is great as well. The parking sucks but the food is worth waiting for. I only go here for Japanese curry... nowhere else. I've been coming here for years now, my best friend actually took me here my first time and fell in love with the food. I have only tried their curry up to levels 1-6, not bad actually it's tasty! Love spicy food. The curry pan is amazing! The appetizers are delicious!

Edit: update! Recently went, and I'm very disappointed in the change of the curry portion. They used to fill the whole plate. Very disappointed. Please go back to the old portion.

Nom, nom, nom!!!

The curry is out of this world, add some cheese and they definitely aren't shy about it! The tonkatsu is juicy and tender and their other offerings are just as perfect.. I usually switch it up every time I go. 

I officially crave this on the regular.

More like 3.5 stars. We got the chicken katsu with curry. The curry was fine, my two spicy wasn't that spicy even though our waitress warned us that it was spicy. Luckily there were pepper shakers on the table. I really like the red pickles that goes with the curry and they give you a lot if you ask for them so, that's a plus. The chicken katasu I got was moist but oddly bouncy? It's hard to describe, it wasn't chewy but it just had an odd bounce to it. I kinda expected some vegetables in the curry. You get a big plate but it's kind of underwhelming.
This place was packed. No where to park but people still waited outside in line ready to eat. Curry was delicious. I was amazed by how many people love curry. Friendly staff and quick service.

Loved this place. Great staff and cute restaurant. Great food. I ordered out for my family and they put it separately so nothing would get soggy. Super thoughtful and delicious! Will go to Vegas to eat there again.

My wife and I have been looking for a good Japanese Curry place every since we left Okinawa in 2003 (CoCo's was the place in Okinawa) and boy did we luck up on this place.  We have tried several places in California and here in Las Vegas...THIS PLACE IS IT!!  If I were to close my eyes and go purely on taste alone, I would think I was in Okinawa sitting at CoCo's.  The Chicken Katsu we breaded and had just the right "crisp" to it.  I opted for a level 2, which had just the right amount of heat for me, and my wife went with the mild. She also said it reminded her or Okinawa...and we took to-go plates as well.  If you have a craving for Japanese curry, try this place....if you haven't tried Japanese Curry and want to, try this place.

I lived in Yokosuka Japan for a couple of years back in my Navy days. Eating at  Curry zen brought back so many beautiful memories.  The curry was great.  I want to visit Vegas again just for the curry. They don't have placed like Curry Zen in Chicago.

Japanese Curry Zen - Average check ~$13 - Japanese Curry is mainly served. Service is nice and the place looks ok in general. Food is good I guess cos I don't know how Japanese curry suppose to taste like. The portion is big so the price worth the dish (~$10 a dish). Overall experience 4 stars, recommend for who like Japanese Curry and katsu

Their portions are huge!

Our waitress (who said she is vegan) said their curry is vegan, but the Tofu batter is not. For health benefits she recommended the 16 grain rice with the spinach curry mixed with the vegetable curry.  It was soul warming, hearty, and yummy. 

Hubby got the chicken katsu curry and liked it a lot. 

This place is tiny and super popular. Perfect for small groups, but plan ahead. At 4:30 PM on a Saturday we waited about 20 min for a table for two.

This place has a pretty simple menu, but I like the fact that it is customizable. I went with the spinach curry at a level 6 with 5 pieces of kushi. The plates here are huge but I had no problem eating it at all. The five pieces of kushi includes katsu, quail eggs, zucchini and mushrooms. It was super bomb! There is something very comforting about Japanese curry. I will definitely be coming back.
Busy restaurant but does not lack service at all. Very affordable Japanese curry option near casinos and glad we went there for quick bite!

Absolutely love curry and what makes this better is its Japanese curry! Totally reminds me of my grandmas cooking and its such a compfort feeling. The staff here are super friendly and quick service. The venue is a little small but that is the only downside. parking lot can get kinda full but people are always coming and going so your bound to find a stall if your patient. If the restaurant itself is packed and your willing to wait you wont be disappointed on the quality, price or service of this place. So if you enjoy a good japanese curry and rice, get here!!!

This place is pretty good, if it was in a small town I would be very happy with it, but it's in las vegas surrounded by some of the best cheap asian food around. I got the chicken katsu curry which tasted great, but their curry tastes almost exactly like the popular 'golden curry' everyone makes at home so nothing special. My girlfriend got the katsu-don, a rice bowl with katsu and egg. It was good, and again if this was in my hometown it would be 5/5, but you can get a way more impressive katus-don down the street for the same price. One nice thing about this place is they sell a 22 oz beer for $5. Just not sure it's worth dealing with the parking lot and waiting in line to eat here

It was a grey, rainy and chilly day in Vegas.. perfect weather for Japanese Curry. 
The Tofu Katsu was really wonderful. The curry was just amazing. It was tasty, hot and just the right side of spicy. The restaurant is way off the strip and while small, it was filled late in the afternoon with locals. Thanks Yelp for helping me find this treasure.

Absolutely love this place! I have been here so many times and every time I leave satisfied. 

I have had Japanese curry in a few places around town but this place is the best! I always get the 3 piece (quail egg, zucchini, and chicken) or 5 piece Kushi (with mushroom and shrimp)  (when I'm super duper hungry!) - add corn and spicy level 3! Of course I ask for their pickles too!! This is the perfect meal!

I usually also order their Takoyaki and sometimes gyoza! I have also tried their tofu salad which is also really good! The dressing is very light! 

The place is pretty small and can get very busy during lunch time, sometimes there is a little wait but the wait is worth it! The service is also really good compared to other places in Chinatown.

This place is authentic Japanese curry. All the spices they use are so delicious, & the variety in the toppings they offer are great. Their fried shumai & gyoza is also delicious. & they have Asahi on draft! The owner is the chef, & his hospitality is amazing, such a great person & a great establishment!

Japanese Curry Zen is one of my favorite comfort food spots. I used to come here often when I worked on the strip, but now that our office has moved further east, it is now even that much more of an effort to get to Chinatown area and all of its great food. I guess you could say that it is not really that much of a drive from Henderson, but I digress...

I typically get the pork katsu curry with shrimp. Which doesn't seem like much, but that rice is really filling and pairs oh so well with the curry. Sometimes I don't get how something like plain rice can be so good when eaten with other foods. It just tastes like home.

On the spice level - I typically get level 1 which is perfect for me because I really don't do well with even slightly spicy things.

There is a big sign on the front window "...something, something.. **HOMEMADE CURRY**" ...Seriously... No lie!  

The restaurant is not big at all and can maybe sit 15 people at a time.. but after hearing about how good this "hole in the wall" joint was through co-workers, I had to try it for myself. I was greeted immediately and traditionally (well.. it sounded pretty Japanese to me) and seated at the bar. I noticed the menu was a "build your own" style and decided on the chicken and vegetable katsu level 6 spice.

I was served a perfect sized portion of food that was unbelievably delicious!!! ..All I can say is.. Very clean curry.. perfectly fried katsu.. Authentic homemade flavor! 

Highly recommended for all you curry lovers! 

..S.C.A.

Visiting for a business trip,  friend told me to try this out when I got a chance. Was glad I did. Super bomb. 
I got the chicken katsu spicy level 6.

LOVE this place. The curry is super spicy and burns your mouth in a pleasurable way ;). 
But foreal, the rice here is always fluffy. 
The Panko breading on what I've tried so far is crispy, golden, and hot. 
The curry itself-- so deep and flavorful; one of the most authentic places I've been to.
The service is great and food comes out fast!
Just be warned: I love eating spicy stuff but I mean a 3-5 is like "burn your face off" to me. Still, one of my favorites Japanese restaurants in Vegas!

I loved this place! The food was delicious, servers were very friendly and to top it all off.... they had takoyaki balls!!! Which were absolutely off the chain! It's very hard to find these delightful little treats around town that actually taste so good but this is the place that has them! The prices are great and it's a very quaint little joint. You won't be disappointed.

I've been a fan of Curry Zen since they've opened. 

Food: A fine example of how keeping things simple and focusing on a specialty delivers a reliable, quality experience. I think they've recently expanded their menu a bit but I have always been thoroughly impressed with their Japanese curry. The curry itself is standard for their dishes. You pick your meat or veggie option, pick your level of spice and they add rice and voila...you have an awesome dish. They also have a list of add-ons that you would typical see at other places like ramen spots.

Facilities: They've recently expanded (that's a good sign). And now they're double the size that they were when they opened. There might be a wait....but given how fast they get their food ready...wait times shouldn't be a problem. but as a guest, please keep to the same manners as you would with Monta next door...don't hand around...get in...eat your food...and dip. 

Staff: This is more of a food-service spot so, by design, the staff won't chat it up too much. But they are friendly, quick with service and check back frequently. 

Now I am getting hungry.

Let me tell you; The curry here is absolutely DELICIOUS. I'm fairly picky with curry, and so far out of my choices here in vegas, this one's at the top of my list!

The service is good and friendly. It was my coworkers first time eating japanese curry and she wasn't too sure about her spice level she chose, so the server offered to adjust it for her if she wasn't satisfied! (I like spicy but even level 4 is too spicy for me! I was sniffling the whole time!)

The chicken katsu/tenders and beef is soooo good. As we say in hawaii: onolicious brah! The flavor is much more authentic compared to other places I've tried. The katsu tofu and veggies are a good add on as well. The portions are generous so I usually have some leftovers to take home for my next meal ^_^

The only reason I didn't this place 5 stars is because the prices are more on the expensive side.  Otherwise it's really good and I definitely recommend this place :)

Japanese Cutlet Curry is one of my favorite foods on this entire planet earth ever since I could even utter the words ?????????? (I want Curry!) out of my mouth. I require this stuff just to survive. When I first moved to Vegas a few years ago, I was going through some serious withdrawals, and then I found this place. I was relieved to find that this place does the job. 
There are basically two types of curry that are standard in Japanese cooking. First, there is the roux (or however you spell that) over rice with some meat bits in it. Then there is the cutlet curry which is a big slice of whatever protein you chose on top of rice, covered with the roux. I always get some sort of cutlet curry because I don't see the point otherwise. 
Now if you have one of those big "American" appetites, the standard serving isn't going to cut it for you. But fear not! There are plenty of add-ons you can choose as well as some good appetizers. Also, like any good curry place, there is a scale of spiciness from 0-10 I believe. 0 is pretty much non-existent. I usually go with 3 or 4 and my Korean friends think I'm weak. You start paying extra after 6. I think 10 would be suitable for someone like my mom who likes to take a big chunk of wasabi and eat it straight up before her meal just to cleanse her palate. If this is your first time, take it easy with the spice.
There are also two rice types you can choose. The standard white rice, and the purple rice with beans. The purple rice is very healthy for you and it doesn't taste like shit so give it a try.
Another cool trend that has been going on in Japan that this place also does is that they provide Tonkatsu sauce at your table for you to add on to your roux. It adds a very good flavor. I don't know why I always see people getting scared to try this. It's good. Just try it. Don't be vanilla. 
Finally, the service is very good. Most of the workers actually speak Japanese and they know how to treat the customers well. That always makes me want to leave my money there.
This joint isn't huge, and as everyone knows, this plaza can get mad crowded so do expect a wait during peak hours.

Good food, good price.
Definitely, will visit again, but small parking lot.

Food: Good
Price: Good
Service: Good
Parking: Avg

A lot of service workers tend to enjoy their job (or at least they pretend to) especially in front of their customers. That was not the case this evening. We were with friends from out of town and said, with pride, that there is a great curry place to check out. The other staff was great, the food was great, but the quality of service was the lowest by far.

The male server greeted us by saying, "Just so you know, we can only split the check in four ways." I thought that was an odd version of "Welcome to Japanese Zen Curry. What can I get you?" He was very short with our friends when they were trying to decide what to order, did not offer suggestions, and spoke very monotone and had the facial expression like he was contemplating throwing himself out of the window of a moving vehicle. While I was ordering, I was looking over the side dishes to add to my curry plate. As I often do, I speak while I think and the server mistook it as me ordering and said, "Can you speak up? I can't hear you." I told him I wasn't telling my order and he exhaled like he was in hurry.

We received our food (only reason for the 2-star rating) and it was great as usual. Another server offered to print out individual receipts so we can group the payment in three instead of four per request of Mr. Sunshine to help clarify the order. Before we knew it, he comes to our table scolding us saying, "I TOLD YOU WE CAN ONLY SPLIT IN FOUR." I had enough at this point and responded, "You have three cards in your hands. We only want it three ways." When I offered to tell him that we can group it for him, his response was, "I don't know what you ordered!" I can see the awkward looks on our friends' faces so I stood up and had to spell out for him how to charge us.

After signing our bills, he comes over and asks, "Do you need anything else?" I laughed. And i said, "Nope." And he walks away. I don't know if he was forced to work or a family member died, but he does not belong there. I hope the owner or the friendlier staff members speak about his rudeness. Get some sleep, guy.
So so good. Their curry really is the bomb. I love mine with katsu and croquette. Their fried oysters also amazingly yummy! Very recommended!

I lovvvee Japanese curry, and this comes close to one of my fave places in Hawaii. They've expanded since I've started going here, and they're customer service is still on point  My go-to meal is the chicken Katsu curry with cheese topped with a lot of fukujinzuke. 

And yes they're menu is limited...serving just a variety of curry and meats. It's a typical Japanese curry house.

This tiny spot was packed when I stopped in for lunch one Friday afternoon. There were a few people waiting, but since I was a party of 1, I was seated right away. There is no host stand, but they do have a piece of paper and a pen for you to write your name down. I ordered the pork katsu curry, level 2, and added corn and cheese. I also got a sprite and an order of gyoza.

The food came out quickly. The gyoza were just placed on the table and a moment later my entree was being delivered. Gyoza were crispy and hot, and I enjoyed the dipping sauce. The curry was just okay, but mind you I have never had Japanese curry before. I thought the corn and cheese were yummy additions though. The spice level 2 was just perfect for me. The pork katsu was crispy and delicious and I found myself eating that by itself because I realized I am not really a fan of Japanese curry. But certainly that is no fault of Zen's. I may not be back, but I would definitely say check this place out.

I found this restaurant by chance when I was trying to find a decent local spot off the strip. I'm glad I found this place! If you need a curry fix this is your spot! They have 10 levels of hot...I chose level 8 and it was perfect and satisfying. If you are looking for a good Japanese curry spot this is the place to go.

Great food, I always go for the veggie curry. It's delicious. Great service every time we go, we're always seated and served quickly with a smile and the food is always fresh and hot. Definitely go here if you want great food at a great price!!

It's Japanese style diner food.

I ordered the Chicken katsu curry. The cutlets are thin and dry, there's no vegetables in the curry. You get your rice, katsu, and curry sauce. Basic.

Prices are little above medium, but rent is not cheap in Chinatown.

I walk in Monday right after the place opened and it was already busy. I was immediately greeted and seated though, and was asked for my order not soon after. The menu isn't huge but it's a specialized curry place...so that's what the menu is mostly made of. I got the tofu Katsu with veggies and spinach. I have to say it was pretty good. I'd eat here again, but I'd make my order a bit more on the spicy side.

Totally tasty! And its not to far of a drive. The building was small but stepping foot into it! The smells the friendly atmosphere so lovely. The small selection made it easy for me to choose what I wanted. I wasn't gawking at a menu for 3 years like with other restaurants. I knew exactly what I wanted and ordered the pork katsu curry. The pork was crispy the curry was spicy and delicious. I'm already craving another plate and can't wait to go back. The gentleman that served us was polite and kind. Was all around a happy experience. Thank you for it. Curry zen

The owner's son is a jerk. Told him that the rice was luke warm. Told the waitress we wanted the rice very hot. Didn't happen. 

Told the son he's about to get a very bad yelp rating and just shrugged his shoulders. 

This is a shame. Don't expert rude service. Got it. Get it!

Great place for lukewarm and not made to order fried items. 

Bad attitude, poor service, lukewarm rice; leftover fried shrimps,  makes for a 2 star performance. I hope your father reads this. 

Try visiting when the father is around. He actually is very customer oriented.

Me and my kids love love this authentic place for curry! We order katsu don with curry on the side! Sooo deliciouss! Chef uses 15 spices or more and cook with alot of passion & heart for people! Owner zenbayashi san is very nice sensei! I highly recommend to eat here if you love japanese style authentic curry with white rice or brown rice. You can try takoyaki & curry bread too! Enjoy!!!
I never get tired of this place....I go here all the time and the quality of my food is always THE BEST. It never comes out differently. One of my fave restaurants in Las Vegas honestly.

This place was great, quick, good service and delicious.   My son had tried Japanese Curry on a recent trip to Chicago and wanted it again.  This was my 1st time I'm so glad we went I will be back!  If you like it spicy get it #5.
I came here wanting CoCo's curry.  This wasn't CoCo's but it's a good sub.  I had the chicken katsu level 8 (not spicy to me).  It was AWESOME!

Atmosphere: Very clean, modern, and bright inside.

Food: I love how simple their menu is and there's no fluff. I've tried both chicken and pork katsu curries but I prefer the chicken curry (don't get me wrong both are great). I only wish they had katsu fish (only because fish is my ultimate protein source)! 

Specials: Although it cost $0.20 extra for spicy levels 6-10, it's definitely worth getting some fire on the curry. I've tried spicy levels 7 and 8, and 8 is definitely hotter (my lips were burning and my stomach a little bit churning). Level 7 spicy is perfect for me with just enough heat! Almonds! Add thinly sliced almonds inside the curry for crunchy texture and because the almonds are so thinly sliced they do not contribute or detract from the curry flavor.

Service: The service is excellent. I believe all the house staff are native Japanese but we didn't really have a language barrier and ordering was really easy. They are quick on their feet and make sure our waters are always refilled and they check in on you often. The food comes out quickly so I definitely recommend this spot for quick eats.

Final Impression: I have to admit, this is my favorite katsu + curry house ever.

The Skinny: the curry is okay but nothing special(3) service is slow during their busy hours and the seating area is small although better than when they first opened (3), value: given the prices they charge, they should give you more curry (3).

My husband likes this place but quite frankly I could take it or leave it. In terms of flavor, the curry is not bad... but it doesn't taste like anything that special either. (Kinda like the Japanese curry you can make with House brand instant roux)

My beef is the portion size of curry relative to the amount of rice and toppings. When we first started coming, there as barely enough curry for the rice. Now, the amount of curry provided is even less than before.  So I end up leaving half of the rice behind because eating white rice at a curry joint is no fun . And I refuse to pay more for extra curry. I am not a big eater by any means but I normally need to hit Snowflake shavery next door to feel satisfied.

I normally get the spinach curry and I must say...it would be nice to get a bit more spinach in a dish that costs $9. The vegetable curry is also super skimpy on the veggies.

The katsu is okay - the coating is a bit too heavy for my taste.

Even worse, you have to ask for fukujinzuke or rakko. (Normally there is a little canister of these pickles that you can help yourself with or they put it a little on your plate when it is served.) And when they do get some for you, it's a tiny little dish of it. That is if they remember to get it for you.

Overall, this place is okay but provides Jenny Craig portion control. Service is easily overwhelmed and the seating areas are minimal (this place does a lot of takeout... which really is no fun if you order katsu).3 star review
The best Japanese Curry in the world! I always get the tofu salad and Chicken curry. Very inexpensive and highest quality!!

finally, an authentic japanese curry joint in vegas!
hooray!!!
i love japanese curry so i'm totally ecstatic!

the flavor of the curry is super tasty but doesn't come in spiciness levels and i would say that it's a little too mild for me.
it also doesn't contain any veggies such as carrots or potatoes which i'm sure makes no difference to most people but i must admit that i'd prefer if there was a little bit of chunkiness/thickness about the sauce.

my friend had regular white rice with his curry and, unfortunately, it was very soggy.
i believe the water to rice ratio was off.
it was only their 2nd day of business so i'd chalk it up as a noob mistake.
i'm sure it'll be better the next time we go.
i had the brown rice and it was cooked perfectly.
i love the brown rice option at no additional charge.

all in all, it was satisfying and i'll most certainly be back for more.
yay! i'm definitely a fan!

Don't bother to go if you depend on a service animal as you will be asked for your animal's "identification card" (which she is not required by law to have), and then be left without so much as a glass of water when you explain that credentials are not required.
Simple but good Japanese curry and katsu. Unfortunately they charge for increase in spice levels. The spicier the more expensive. Very friendly waiters and good experience overall
Service was so-so and food was okay. Portion size acceptable. It wasn't bad, but I wasn't impressed either. Had to spice it up a bit to my liking.

The place was smaller than I thought, but very cozy and clean!
We ordered...
-Croquette Curry 
-Chicken Katsu Curry

Both of them were very good! Tasty!
Chicken Katsu was not dry at all and you could tell that curry was made from scratch.
The only reasons why I gave 4 stars were the fact that you can't pick how spicy you want the curry to be... 
I understand that there are different kinds of spices on the side of the table so you can add your own spice to your own curry, but still... after all it is just powder you are adding to your curry, it's not the same... A lot of curry house in Japan, you can pick how spicy!
Also, we ordered hot green tea and we got hot water with tea bag inside the mug cup... I was actually surprised... If I'm paying $1.25 for green tea, I rather get one without the teabag!

The Curry magic....was I hungry or this food is just bomb dot com. Deliciousness - perfect combination of spices to bring out authentic flavors. The ZEN momemt. Definitely the best curry in town. 

Thank you ZEN s team for cooking this delicious food.
I love this place even better now that I can get my curry spicy, instead of just adding the spices they have on the tables

This place is great for a quick bite. Honestly this entire little market has great food and service! I ordered the beef curry -for under $10 mind you!- and it came out in about 5 minutes. The curry was thick and quite tasty. 

Only downside is that it doesn't come with any vegetables at all. Not sure if you can order extra but it would be nice if you could get that without added cost.
Best curry flavors I've tasted. They recommend 3 if you're not into spicy. I like heat in my food, a 7 is good.

First time trying Zen Curry I love it! 
Good environment and awesome customers service. Coming back again! Recommended!!

Curry!  OMG do I love Curry... Indian Curry, Thai Curry, Japanese Curry-it's all good.. The amalgamation of spices, creating that distinct, deep, rich, umber slurry, with heavenly wafts filling my nostrils; you literally taste it through your olfactory senses like an emotion or a memory (Curry is my Pavlov's dog)..

Curry is a favorite from my childhood; just before spending the Summer vacation in Japan, My Mom would make batches of Curry and hundreds of Fried Dumplings for my Dad to eat while we were gone.  I loved hanging out in the kitchen, helping her cook these dishes, and it is distinctly home cooking.

Curry Zen is located in the same Commercial Center as Monta, Raku and Trattoria Nakamuraya, making it's own 'Little Tokyo' deep in the heart of Chinatown.  It's a small venue with only a couple of tables and a counter, so you can imagine there's a prime, rush hour wait - makes sense to time carefully with this restaurant.  But it's clearly a family run business with Husband and Wife manning the kitchen, which is endearing.  

The Curry is a simple gravy, made entirely from Spices and Vegetables.  It has the consistency somewhere between a sauce and stew, with deep but clean flavors that highlight each Spice in a way I've never tasted.  Almost a science, a brief explanation is on a placard on each table (in Japanese) describing the ingredients and methodology- one thing that I find about Japanese culture is the cult like devotion to the culinary process.

On the table, you find various condiments that I find unusual, but welcoming: Almond and Raisins for one, then as the Curry is spicy but not hot, there's a bevy of dry spices to ramp up the heat.  I enjoyed working with a sprinkling of Mild, then incrementally moving towards Hot Chili Peppers.

Along with the Curry, there's a selection of toppings and fried accompaniments: such a Chicken or Pork Tonkatsu, Croquettes, Fried Shrimp and Vegetables. I really enjoy the fact that I can customize my Curry, and I immediately wanted to 'load up' on the fried goodies:  I ordered the Pork Tonkatsu and Fried Shrimp.  Now given the price point, the Tonkatsu was amazing; not your tough, thin piece of stringy meat, Curry Zen presented a really good piece of Pork that was fried perfectly and for an extra $3.50, it's a steal!  The breaded Shrimp was properly cooked and a great mini addition to counter the Tonkastu, you can never have enough fried meat on your plate is my philosophy!

I enjoyed the service, both the Husband and Wife repeatedly asked me how my dish tasted and I appreciated their attentiveness.  And I know I will be coming back, not only for the food, but I want to support the smaller businesses in Vegas and these are good people!

Ratings (Out of Five Stars)
Food:            5
Ambience:    3
Service:        5

I've been here several times and I decided to finally write a review. Japanese curry here is the best! Some places serve a chalky curry but this place is well done. I usually get the chicken katsu curry with cheese and sausage. Soo yummy and filling. 

I've also done curry out. Phone order is simple and estimated pick up times is on point. Food is well packaged, they separate the curry in it's own container so it doesn't make the katsu soggy. Portions are huge.

I wanted to try this because of hearsay from others, and my new found love of Japanese curry. Interior-wise it was simple, and sleek. Upon arrival, I was greeted quickly from one of the servers. The menu had selection, and options to add-on. I was pleased to see they had brown rice as an option, because although I'm Asian, I'm not a white rice type of gal. Lol :-) Since it was my first time, I just went with a basic katsu curry plate, with 3 fried shrimp. Portion size is okay, they give you curry and rice, but the katsu is a little on the smaller side. Taste wise, curry was good, their katsu was so-so. Pricing was cheap! Me and my husband's bill was a little over $20 included drinks. I'm not sure if I'll be back, I thought it was alright.

First off, I need to say I am not exactly a fan of Japanese curry. I prefer Thai curry over Japanese curry. With that said, I'll try and write this review as best I can based on the Japanese curry that I've had.

Japanese Curry Zen is actually a really nice/cozy place. It's small, so I suggest you go there during 'off' hours to avoid potential waits. The ordering process was fairly easy. A simple menu and a selection of additional meats to add on without putting a hole in your wallet =] The wait time for the food was normal, and the portions were decent. My friend ordered the pork cutlet and I ordered the chicken cutlet with a side of sausages. The sausages and the chicken cutlet was REALLY yummy. My friend's pork was slightly overcooked, and therefore was a bit harder to chew. The curry itself blended in really well, and I believe it was one of the best tasting Japanese curry I've tried =]

On each of the tables were two types of seasoning, some pickled ginger (i think it was ginger), and some PICKLED GARLIC... I haven't seen a place that served pickled garlic on the side in AGES!

I would definitely come back again, for a quick yet filling meal =]

Was looking forward to eating here. We placed our name down and went to get something in the car. This waitress (nonasian) crossed our name out and refused to seat us. She told us we had to wait at the end again when we waited for over 30 minutes. Decided to just leave and eat somewhere else. Worse experience ever.

I licked my plate clean! WHY can't the east coast have delicious places like this?! I got the pork katsu curry, level 3 and it was perfectly spicy and absolutely delicious.  Who knew that Japanese curry could be so scrumptious and spicy.  My boyfriend jokes about how he tried a level 8 before and couldn't even touch the food, but a level 3 was perfect and for comparison, it would be about a level 7-8 on a regular scale of hotness.

Anyways, can't wait to come back to Vegas and indulge.  GO try this place if you're in town!
I wish I could rate higher! Some of the best food I've ever had, all with polite staff and speedy service. Would recommend to anyone!

Funny thing about this place is that I didn't even mean to come here! It's location is in Chinatown and it's surrounded by a few other restaurants. My boyfriend and I came into this area for some ramen, and saw a big sign for this curry spot.

What'daya know...we came to check it out. I do not lie when I say I'm curry-obsessed!!!! Lately I haven't been able to eat it because of personal reasons. BUT...I do not regret coming in Japanese Curry Zen not one bit!

I ordered the katsu curry with brown rice and veggies on the side. My boyfriend ordered the Katsu curry with a spice level 7. The cool thing about this place is that you can customize the spice level, and add on extra spices (such as turmeric, cumin, oregano, etc) depending on your liking. Cool right?! I've never even heard of such a thing!! 

Service- it was fast and convenient. They were pretty busy when we came to eat, so I say come around the afternoon. Probably after lunch.

Curry Curry action! I decided too try another curry spot one that on radar just never hit yet. Really good! Not only was the Japanese Curry stayed true too japanese style curry but just from the whole decor inside and moment you step in. Me growing up in Hawaii japanese curry is common place in the islands. The first things that brought me back was soon as you walk in they great you in japanese like anything other japanese restaurant. The counter style action and the size or lack of size (four tables in the entire restaurant) so timing is everything here Japanese Curry Zen. I went odd time so missed the lunch crowd. Small business feel the owner busting out all the curry action and really appreciate your business. The little spices that can add too curry on the tables or counter. Curry done right!

I ended up going with grew up with some chicken katsu curry with add on corn. The chicken katsu was perfect. It was nice golden crispy brown on the outside, moist cooked on the inside, and combine with japanese curry it was divine! Just wished they had some kim chee action on the menu. Still it was the perfect plate lunch action without the mac salad. Lol! They do have other choices for protein and other sides. Really menu not that big just simple, delicious, and all about the curry action. I know lot of options comes too curry but if want some authentic curry Japanese Curry Zen great spot. Small menu not much dessert just walk next door for some Snowflake action!

I do not understand the ratings on this place. I went there due to a really great rave I heard from my best-friend she loved it! I So I went and got the chicken Katsu with no extra additions on my curry, but I did ask for a level 3 spicy. Sadly the one I got was more of a level 7 spicy compared to what I am used to. I thought the chicken was good nothing different than the rest of the chicken Katsu I've had before the curry spicy level may have killed it for me though, yet I still cant see myself going crazy for this place even if the curry was not spicy. The food is not bad.... but nothing to go crazy for. 
The service was great and the staff was friendly, and the place was cute and simple, but the food is meh in my opinion though.

Can't say that I am the biggest fan of this location. Slightly disappointed in the fact that this location has so many positive reviews. 

Traveled down to Las Vegas for a quick trip with friends and decided on eating curry before the trek back to LA. Searched curry and this placed popped up with 4.5 stars. We arrived, wait was no more than 5-10 minutes and sat down.

We were all in the mood to eat some curry as it was freezing cold at night and some warm curry would do the trick. Between the table, we ordered a curry chicken katsu and I ordered the pork katsu. I added level 2 spicy to my order for a little extra kick. Also order a plate of takoyaki for the table.

The first plate arrive, the chicken katsu. Portions were nice and food looks delicious. When my plate arrive, I noticed i received significantly less curry. Was it because they added a level 2 spicy so they didn't portion it correctly? The pork katsu looks crispy on the outside but after taking the first bite, the meat was dry as jerky and none to pleasant. I powered through the katsu to get to the delicious part, the curry, The spice level was just right with the right amount of kick up sadly, I had to portion control my curry to rice ration to make sure I had enough curry. The takoyaki was a little disappointing as well. Mostly all dough with very little filling.

Will all these positive reviews, maybe we just had a bad set. Was really looking forward to that meal but who knows, very hesitant to try it again,

Curry perfect. 
This curry fanatic gives Zen a solid 5 stars. More if I could.
Since it was my first visit I went simple, pork katsu curry Level 9 heat. 
Zen nailed it. Perfect heat, a deep depth of character in their curry that keeps you longing for another bite and second guessing whether you should have ordered more rice and curry.
After leaving Zen, my mouth was still watering thinking about the curry. I will be back. 
Best curry in Vegas!!!
Made my own curry and it was delicious, chose a spicy of 7.5 and had to eat my food slowly lol

From what I've heard, Zen is owned by the same people who run Curry House in Hawaii. If that's true, I wouldn't be surprised because the food here is great. I normally get the chicken katsu curry, but this last visit I got plain curry with a side of gyoza to make gyoza curry! (P.S. you guys should put that on your menu.) Both really yummy. The restaurant itself is on the small side so if you have a big party or are concerned about waiting, they also take to-go orders. My to-go's have always been hot and fresh. The place to visit if you are craving simple but authentically done Japanese curry.

We ordered the chicken katsu with tofu katsu added, spicy #4. Just the right amount of spice and the curry was great. Tofu and chicken were both fried right. We will be back to try some other dishes on the menu :-)!!!

Location: Centrally located in the heart of Chinatown (Spring Mtn. Rd). The place is small but they combined tables for large parties. If you have large party, it is better to call and RSVP rather than just drop off. Parking might be a challenge since it is in the same plaza with Monta and they get busy during lunch hour. Some people park on the side road when it's full. 

Decor: Nothing special in their decor. They kept it clean which is important. 

Menu: Obvioualy, curry is their specialty. Please note this is a Japanese curry which has a different ingredients and taste from Indian curry. They have ingredients list what goes to their curry. All of them sounds healthy. The spicy level can be adjusted from 1-10. I ordered spinach curry with a side of 5 pcs Kushi (variety of deep fried tempura items: chicken breast, quail eggs, vegetables, mushroom and shrimp). For me spicy level 5 is perfect!  They have beer and wine as well. Of course, I had to go with Calpico since it's my lunch hour. 

Service is quick and efficient. They usually have two server around and they provide an excellent service. 

Overall, this is a perfect lunch place to go. It is quick, price is reasonable. Food is prepared carefully and taste good. Oh, on the side note....They also have good selections of vegetarian menu. Will come back again soon.
So slow. The workers are slow. The wifi is slow. The cell services is slow. The food takes forever to come. Took them 20 minutes to bring water/drinks after being seated.
went here with my boyfriend a while back, and he loves it! he's from the Bay Area and we plan on going here at least once every time he visits.

I am a sucker for curry and Japanese Curry Zen does it really well. The breading is nice and crunchy and is not oily or greasy. I went for the level 4 in spiciness. It was a decent burn. I enjoy spicy food (much to my stomach's dismay) and this lived up to the spicy level. It left a warm feeling for a good hour after consumption. My boyfriend enjoys extremely spicy food so he got level 10. I tried a bite of it and it surprisingly still have good flavor not just heat.

I wish this was closer to my house and/or work so I could eat it more often!

We ordered the Kushi Curry (deep fried quail eggs, mushrooms, eggplant, chicken, and shrimp) and two Katsu Dons. The rice is delicious and fresh, and the entrees are impeccable.

Beware of two mistakes we made:
- do not order takeout from here on a Friday evening. It is a nightmare to find somewhere to park without a hike from where you stopped just to pick up your food.
- don't mix this place up with their also great but very far rainbow location... a mistake I deeply regret smh

It all comes in healthy portions that leave almost enough for leftovers.

However, for take out, I far prefer the Rainbow location in portion size and for the sake that it's not as insanely busy there as it is here.

I'm sorry. I like Zen for what it is and all, it is good, better than the other places I've tried in Vegas however it just seems too plain for me to be a fan of. Is it more that curry, rice, and fried stuff!?

The menu is simple you order what kind of curry you want (original, vegetable, or spinach), what level of spiciness (1-5 is free and 6-10 is $0.20 extra), what rice (plain or brown), and what fried stuff you want included (pork/chicken/tofu katsu, pork/chicken tender, shrimp, sausage, and a few others). I've always ordered the original curry with levels ranging from 5-10 depending on the mood, it is good, has the flavors I like but I can never get it too hot to my liking even with the additional spices on the table, sure I'll sweat but I want to breath fire. Maybe it's not suppose to be too hot!? And I'll get the plain rice. The plates are pretty much half rice and half curry. I like the kurobuta sausages but the fried stuff is standard. I could easily eat one plate and be still hungry but drink plenty of water if you're a big eater like me. Adding additional items is an option but it also means adding to the price, which could turn pricey.

The interior is nice and clean. It does get busy occasionally so you might have to wait for a seat or even maneuver around while walking through the establishment. I've never had a problem with service, food comes out in a reasonable amount of time and staff is usually friendly, refill drinks, and handles checks. 

Ask for a smaller spoon or a fork cause the spoon they usually give you is huge.

Don't let this review turn you away from going here the food's not bad or anything and I'd probably go back as long as others wanna go but you wont hear me raving about it.

The best curry in the city, hands down. I drive across town just to come here and it's worth the drive every time. 
Friendly servers, great food -- this is a restaurant you have to visit.

Let's just say I deeply regretted agreeing to share this plate of curry with one of my friends. When the plate came out and I took my first bite, I wanted the whole thing to myself. I haven't tried many curry places, but this has got to be the best curry place I've tried to date.

Located in China Town in the same plaza as Monta Ramen, Kung Fu Tea, and Snowflake Shavery. There's plenty of parking. The restaurant has a very homey and traditional Japanese feel to it. We came around lunch time on a Saturday with a group of 10 people and they seated us immediately. Our server was friendly and quick on her feet. The prices for the curry is reasonable and it's a huge portion so it's worth it.

My friend and I decided to go with original chicken katsu curry with a croquette on the side. We got The curry was absolutely delicious; it was thick, flavorful, and you can really taste the spices. The chicken katsu was light and fried to perfection. It was my first time trying a croquette and I enjoyed it a lot. It's a deep fried mashed potato? It wasn't as heavy as I thought it would be but it was light as well. 

This is such a cute, quaint restaurant with amazing prices but better than that, equally amazing food.

The curry here is great! It tastes like a true Japanese style curry.
The price is decent, their menu is limited but that's because they're just a curry shop.

This is a very tiny restaurant; seats about 15-20 people. So if you go with a big group you will have to wait. 

I ate here twice before and ordered the same thing; pork katsu curry.
It's not too spicy and not too sweet so it's the perfect combo!
If you want to make it more spicy, you can always add the spices that they have on the side of the table.
The size of the curry is big & so is the katsu.

If I'm ever craving curry, I'll definitely come back here!
curry with cheese just perfect match!!!

Food quality was good, love the chicken katsu and the curry with spice 
Only thing I would say is the portioning is a little small for the price but I guess the taste makes up for the portion

I would recommend to anyone hasn't tried it

This Japanese curry place was recommended to us by our brother and fellow elite yelper. We are so glad we tried it. It was easy to find. It's a few minutes from the strip. When we walked in, it smelled like curry heaven. The host/waiter greeted us right away with a Japanese greeting and seated us. The restaurant was about half full. They had a booster highchair for our toddler. 

The menu isn't too complex which was nice. I ordered the vegetable curry with no mushrooms and my husband got the chicken katsu curry. We both got 3 for the spicy level. It was $0.20 per meal to add a level 3 spice. The spicier you add, the more it costs but the max spicy level was still under $1. The waiter mentioned that the 3 would probably be too spicy for our toddler, and I told him he'd probably just eat the rice anyway. I thought that was very considerate of him to mention that. 

The food came out in an expected amount of time. We both took one bite of our meals and were so pleased with how our curry tasted. It was pretty spicy at first but then not too bad. My mouth was burning though. I'd probably get a 2 next time. Good thing we had ice water nearby (which was a little slow to be refilled but that's ok - my husband said that's how it is in Japan haha). 

I tried my husband's meal and LOVED the crunchy, breaded outside and tender, moist inside of the chicken. I wish they would do a chicken and vegetable curry dish. That would be perfect. The meal portions were huge! We were very full afterwards and I couldn't finish mine. 

Overall, it was $25 including the tip. We hope to be back down this way soon so we can eat here again. Someone needs to open one of these in Utah county!
The food here is really good, the presentation needs a little improvement... I would come back for the food though...

This restaurant has become a quick #1 restaurant in Vegas for me and my fiancée. Although it may not be as fancy or expensive as other restaurants, you can tell the owner's passion for food.
I always get the Chicken Katsu Curry and my fiancée's go-to is the Curry Udon.
They seem like very simple dishes, but no other places can do the same. Every bite is just full of food-godly goodness.
Give it a try, you won't regret it

I absolutely love Japanese style curry and this place has to be the best! My best friend's father is an amazing Japanese chef and his curry was the my favorite. He moved back to Japan and I just wasn't able to find curry as good as his until I tried this place out back when it first opened. I've been hooked ever since! I've been using yelp for 2 years now but realized that I never signed up and left reviews for places! I'd rave about them on my FB though! hahahaa! This place is super affordable and highly recommended.

My friends and I wanted to get a quick bite to eat before we headed back on the road after a long Vegas trip. Monta Ramen had waaaay too long of a line so we decided to give this place a try and I'm so glad we did. I recommend ordering the chicken katsu curry with a level 4 spice. I love spicy food and the 4 was perfect to me. It was still spicy but not overpowering which I really appreciated. My friends ordered the beef curry, pork katsu curry, and tofu curry. They all really liked them too. 

Overall, I will definitely be back because I want to try their curry udon. If anyone tries it or has tried it, please let me know how it is but I'm sure it's delicious like everything else here! 

Note: while you're in the plaza go to Kung fu tea too! It's great

I love curry - Thai curry, Indian curry, Steph Curry (see? I don't discriminate), and in this case, Japanese curry.

Japanese Curry Zen's namesake is made with 15 different spices.  Little containers of almonds and raisins are also at every table to sprinkle into your curry for even more enhanced flavor (I gave both the almonds and raisins a whirl.  While I preferred my curry sans these additions, I did appreciate the new flavor profiles - crunchy texture from the almonds and a subtle sweetness from the raisins).  My katsu was perfectly crisp on the outside and moist on the inside. I also went for level 6 (out of 10) on spicy, but the heat wasn't very strong.

Definitely a Vegas must worth venturing off the strip for.

While their curry may lead you to enlightenment the proteins at Japanese Curry Zen aren't worthy of your focused attention.  JCZ has some of the tastiest Japanese curry around!!!...but their proteins are regularly dry and overcooked.  

They are doing a lot of things right here.  I'm a big fan of the deep, developed flavors of their curry.  They have brown and multi-grain rice options.  I can easily get down with the fried quail eggs in the Kushi Curry.  If you're into a little heat JCZ offers 10 blaZEN levels.  I highly recommend turning up the heat to about 80% of what you can handle...the heat adds a delightful dimension!  In fact, they are so good in these areas that it's a little frustrating every time you take a bite of sub-par Pork Katsu or Chicken Tenders.  The Vegetable Curry has some potential as well.  It is a mixed veggie combo of potatoes, broccoli, potatoes, carrots, potatoes, squash, and a little more potatoes.  

I haven't written JCZ off completely....they're the old friend that doesn't' show a lot of gratitude but still wants to come over to eat every time you have people over.  And truth-be-told, I will probably be back sooner rather than later in search of their perfect dish for me.  I want to check out the Curry Pan, but they make a limited amount of these and you need to come early to secure one.  Another bright spot is JCZ's menu--created to easily explore and add-on different items.  These options make it effortless to sample several items and leave with a belly expanded greater than otherwise anticipated.

I went there with my family one day to try out their curry... and it wasnt a HIT for me. This place ONLY SERVES curry... and your choice of pork chop, shrimp, croquette.. etc etc. My dad got the pork chop curry ( shared that with my mom) and i shared a shrimp and croquette curry with my sister, and we also ordered a curry puff on the side. The curry puff came and it was COLD... like it was just taken out of the fridge and served to us. IT WAS NOTHING SPECIAL. The curry wasnt BAD but it wasnt good. i've had better and i probably wont be going back to this joint...

This venue is a definite must for those wishing to indulge in Asian-Style Curry! The shop is quaint and service is detail oriented. Our server was accurate at taking our order as well as informed us of how the Spice Scale works. If you are looking for a filling and delectable dish to try I suggest:
Starter: Takoyaki
Entree: Spam/Tofu/Vegetable Curry*^**
* I get a #2 because I like to savor the curry taste with just a little kick
** I also get a lot of food because when you try it you WILL want to take some home

My husband and I came here to get away from the strip we wanted to go to Raku Grill which is just next door but you need a reservation. This place is Japanese curry and is so very yummy and affordable. They have meat curry and veggie curry and offer brown rice instead of white rice if you want which is super nice if your health conscious. 

Raku Grill won't answer the phone. So don't try calling to make a reservation. Just walk-in make the reservation for the following night and head next door to have curry for dinner.

This is one of my top favorite food places in Vegas. I love getting the curry katsu with extra pickled radish on the side-- the pickled radishes really make it for me. I'll often find myself even getting deliveries from here through postmates to my work. And the price is really decent! I only wish there was just a little more chicken in the serving.
After living in Japan for 4 yrs, I have ABSOLUTELY fell in love with Japanese Curry. This is BY FAR the best place in Las Vegas to get some. Zen is my comfort food!

Thanks to this restaurant, I now know the wonders of Japanese curry! How have I never tried this dish before?!

Zen Japanese Curry was the perfect lunch spot during my trip to Las Vegas. It's located in a strip mall and has a casual vibe. They serve up lunch quickly, so it's the perfect place to grab a quick bite during the work day. 

My dining companion and I started off by sharing an appetizer of fried oysters. Even though I'm not a huge oyster fan, these were wonderful! We then shared the pork tonkatsu curry at level 2 spiciness. The curry reminded me of a gravy-like sauce and was bursting with umami flavor. Level 2 spiciness was still quite spicy (which I enjoyed!). Portions aren't huge, so I definitely could have ordered my own dish.

Such a satisfying, comforting meal!

Hands down the best Japanese curry restaurant in Las Vegas. We stopped in after a movie and the place was busy. They pushed two tables together for us since we were a party of three. Very nice of them. 

We started with waters and a calipico drink. For our meals the girls ordered fried tofu with curry, and chicken katsu with corn topping spicy curry #5 for myself.

The food came out quickly and we enjoyed every last bite. Check out the pics if you don't believe how good it is here.

We saw some menu items we might have to try on our next visit to Chinatown. They had chicken karage, curry udon (sounds interesting), shumai and tako taki. All sounded good but too full to sample them this trip.

Arigato Zen Japanese curry!

This is my go to curry spot. I love the curry here and the pickled daikon (i think it's daikon). I always....always get the same thing. Chicken katsu, corn, and side croquette with iced green tea. Lol. It's good stuff. 
The curry flavor is so good and nostalgic for me. There's a place in hawaii called Curry House and it's very similar. I used to make sure I hit up Curry House when I visit Hawaii but now I can get it all the time here in Vegas. Hooray for that!

Super-delicious curry spot! Loved the small, easy-to-navigate menu (everything is based around one deeply savory, umami-packed curry with white or brown rice). I went with the Spinach Curry on the Specials board ($7) to keep my dinner light, but ended up getting enough food to take some home! 

I really enjoyed the extra curry spices put on the table that allow you to either change or accentuate the spiciness of your meal. Pickled ginger and onions added crunch and an acidic sweetness that made my affordable dinner an experience of flavors. 

Service was top-notch, and drinks/alcohol are super affordable. We'll be back!

Lunch on Tuesday, 6/21/16 (first time visiting)

They're located in a plaza with many other options of dining. The parking lot can get quite busy so you'll have to circle around looking for a spot. We walked in and was seated promptly.
