It's a small restaurant so most of the tables were occupied. The staff members were attentive and for the most part, friendly.

My favorite go-to place for curry is Curry House so that's what I compare my curry to. I usually order the chicken leg katsu as a default but they don't offer it here. They only have Chicken Tender katsu so instead, I ordered the pork katsu along with white rice; it tasted quite tender. To my relief, it tasted as good as Curry House! Of course it's not the same but it can satisfy my craving. It had a similar consistency of curry, not too thick or watery. The spice levels were good too. Not sure if it's because we're in Vegas but I'm not aware of any Curry House locations that would serve alcohol. Drink up!

When I visit Vegas again and I'm up for some curry katsu, I'd definitely visit Zen Curry again.

Zen was okay. It was the very best experience I've had but decent. The server just brought us water and asked if we ready to order. She didn't greet us nor ask if we would like anything else other than water. I had to get attention of another waiter to take my order as I got done looking through the menu. He didn't give any suggestions or ask if we have been zen before. The appetizers came out fast and were the best dishes of the entire meal. The shumai was nice and hot. The tokoyaki was very delicious and hot. The curry on the other hand very bad. The rice was cold and it seemed like they just warmed the curry up in the microwave because I think we were the last customers of the night. Also curry was way too sweet for my taste.

So my friends and I went here on a Thursday night, the place is kinda packed but the time of waiting is okay too. I'm really a fan of chicken katsu and curry sauce so this is the awesome place to go to! And the Strawberry Nigori Sake is the bomb!!

First off, I LOVE Japanese Curry & usually go to the one on Rainbow but coming to this location was the one of the worst decisions I've made. I came with a party of 9, and everything seemed to go smoothly. Most of us ordered then those who came about 10 minutes later ordered after. Cool, we're waiting and plates begin to come slowly. But my sister and I noticed that the two curry udons that we ordered weren't coming out, but we waited patiently. EVERYONE else got their plates and the waiter & waitress mentioned nothing about the udon. So I asked them about it and they just said "oh," so the two udon bowls come out and they're watery? Apparently my sister likes that but everytime I've gone to the other location, it was nice THICK curry. In addition, I ordered a spicy level 6 and it was not spicy AT ALL. Maybe they forgot about it and rushed it? Who knows.. But whatever, we were just hungry and wanted to eat then go home. So we ask for the bill, and mind you, we previously mentioned that we were going to pay separately.. We wait about 10 minutes for her to bring the check, then she tells us to write numbers so that we can tell her how we split it. So I did and I handed it back. We wait 20 more minutes for the bill to come out and she separated it by entree saying that she has no time to split it the way I wrote it and said to just combine the paper checks and she'll ring it up like that. So she brings back the cards about 5 minutes later and my card is no where to be found then mentions that there is a $8 minimum AFTER the fact that most of our party paid. Luckily my sister, whose bill was only around $12, was able to combine their checks because there was a complication. So I bring their check back to the register area because the waiter & waitress didn't bother to check on us. I ask for my card and our server, Yuki, told us that she didn't know where my card was. So whatever, it stacked at the bottom of the trays. She told me to sit at my table because she didn't have time to ring me up right there. We waited longer. So she brought my check back along with my sister's.. My bill was fine but as for my sister's, she was charged for more than what she was supposed to pay for. Her bill was only supposed to be around $18, but they charged her almost double that amount. Wtf? I was fed up with this place. Yuki told me that I was supposed to say we were splitting it, which I did, and that they're too busy so she couldn't take care of us and we must wait. So another person comes in later on, named Yuta, and he clarifies and resolves the issue. But apparently we still had unpaid entrees on our check so what did she change the other people? We put the exact checks with our form on payment in separate trays so she couldn't get mixed up? The other waiter didn't even bother to help us. Should've eaten at Hwaro or Monta Ramen instead.

All in all, WORST EXPERIENCE EVER. Would not recommend this location. Go to the one of Rainbow if you want to be charged the right amount and want good service.

Food came quick. Service was great. Food though was just ok. Felt like I was eating Asian Texan food. Like almost like a country fried steak, eggs, potatoes with a spicy twist. Got the 3 for the spicy level which as a regular eater of cayenne peppers was pretty mild but because it is mixed with the gravy errr curry it sticks with you for awhile after you eat it.

What a unique, simple, yet elegant place this is!  While the space of the restaurant is about half the size of it's famous neighbor, Monta Ramen, the flavor is not.  You can get a nicely crafted plate of Japanese curry for a quick and budget lunch at this new spot!  

They serve both brown and white rice with the one thing they make here: curry.  The menu is extremely simple... what kind of meat do you want on your curry?  Condiments include raisins, ginger, some sort of pickled beat type of thing that is amazingly good, almonds, and three different heat levels of spice.  I suggest you add everything to your curry!  Yum!  Even for a Thai curry snob, the curry here is spiced extremely well.  The flavors are balanced with herbs and a slight sweetness.  I have had the fried shrimp and fried pork on my curry so far, and both have been done very well, not too greasy or too breaded and with quality ingredients.  

The price for a plate of curry here ranges from $4.50 (no meat) to around $8.50.  You really can't beat that price for a quick meal out.  The curry here is better than the one served at Shuseki and Ichiza, so give this little spot a try!

I. love. this. place. Curry got me like zayyumm. 
just kidding, kind of. Seriously though whenever I eat here and take the first bite you can always count on me looking at you from across the table with the words "oh my god I've just eaten something so beautiful" in my eyes.

when you're here get the spinach curry with a croquette or chicken katsu! I usually get spicy level 9 because I like to live on the edge, but that's just me.

Their chicken katsu is bomb, but order their croquette to have your life changed forever. 

hope this was helpful. 
PEACE

We originally came to the area to try Monta Ramen, but they were pretty busy and we didn't want to wait.
I yelped this place and saw good reviews- decided to give it a try.
It was pretty empty at that time so we were seated right away.
We ordered 2 chicken & 1 pork katsu curry.
They are so good! It's very comforting especially when the weather is so cold. I finished the whole thing- we were done in 10-15 mins.
We also ordered the takoyaki which was good also.
The food came really quick, so that was our best decision to give this place a try!

Chicken katsu + curry + with potato croquette = Omgsoyum! 

This place definitely delighted my taste buds! Their curry was traditional, very rich and thick, with a hint of sweetness. Compared to the popular chain, Curry House in California, I would say it's a neck to neck competition. Although, my biggest gripe at Zen was that they were light handed when plating the curry - they could of gave us more. We ended up buying an extra side of curry sauce for $1.50. However, the chicken katsu and the pork tonkatsu were both breaded very lightly and expertly fried to a crispy golden brown. They were extremely addicting.

We also tried their new menu item, Takoyaki $4.50. It had 5 plump balls and dressed generously with mayo, takoyaki sauce, and bonito flakes. They came out piping hot and about 2 pieces of tender octopus inside of each ball. The dough was more on the soggy end and also a tad bit bland. Maybe they could of been cooked a little longer. 

I would pass on the curry pan next time. Even though the bread was lightly crispy on the outside, I felt that the overall dough was very dense and lacked curry filling. It was mostly air once I took a bite. (Curry House in CA will continue to hold the crown in curry pan). 

We added: 
- Potato croquette - My favorite! It was lightly sweet and breaded perfectly. 
- Corn - simple canned sweet corn. I still loved it with the curry meal!
- Kushi Katsu (5 skewers of kushiage): lightly breaded and fried and quail egg, zucchini, shiitaki mushroom, chicken tender - Everything was fried perfectly and the chicken tender was very moist and juicy, but I would pass on ordering these next time. They were too boring for me. 

They have many different toppings to add to your curry: kurobuta sausage, potato croquette, corn, kushi katsu (3 or 5 sticks), vegetable, spam, tofu, tofu katsu, spinach, cheese, chicken tender.

Also their spice levels are no joke! 
- Spicy 1-5 is free.
- Spicy 6-10 is 20 cents extra.

We tried spicy #6 which had nice heat. Trust me, they don't mess around. It's not at all unbearable since we're avid spice lovers, but we could of actually went up a couple more notches as well, and loved it! I'm sure spicy 10 would be crazy spicy! 

My favorite part had to be their unique table condiments! I loved adjusting the texture, sweetness, and spiciness of my curry dish at my own discretion. All of these go perfect with curry!
- Fukujnzuke - Japanese sweet pickled radish
- Rakkyo - Japanese style pickled pearl onions. 
- Sliced Almonds - adds great crunchy texture to curry
- Raisins - adds a nice sweetness to the curry and rice 
- Curry powder - adds another level and dimension of curry flavor 
- Spicy chili powder - adds spiciness

Delicious. I ordered tofu katau curry and fried oysters for takeout Saturday afternoon. The place was busy and the servers were running around. They were very polite and the food was hot and fresh. I ordered a 10 (the most spicy) and I wish it was more spicy. I would definitely go here again.

The portion that they serve are so little that you are kind of forced to order side dishes to fill yourself up.  Definitely not the best curry I've tried but it's not bad I guess since there aren't much other options for curry in Vegas.
Katsu Don...  Pork Cutlet, lightly breaded with caramelized onion and rice under. Absolutely delicious!  My friend had vegetable curry which was also excellent.

Chicken katsu curry and spinach with brown rice- healthy but the chicken was plain, so good thing for the curry. Level 6 was mild and not spicy so I went with that. After eating the same thing in the plate, it kind of gets boring. I suggest adding toppings. I added croquette which like mash potatoes in panko crust.

I like that their fried items in a curry is on the lighter side, hence the name panko crumbs.

OMG, It was delicious.
The curry was savory and not too spicy. I love the random toppings they put on the table to go with it for a little bit of crunch. Definitely great comfort food!

Goes to show, that great things come in small packages!

I go here pretty often. I always get the Tofu Katsu with brown rice, corn and cheese. The staffs are always very welcoming and patient with me. However the only problem is that I feel that the spice levels are not consistent. There is definitely a difference in spice levels every time I come here. Some days, a spice level 8 can be a baby spice to me while other days it can be a medium spice. The portioning however is definitely more than enough for me. I can never finish my curry!

The curry here is very very good. It is flavorful, rich and probably the best I've had outside of Japan.

I just wish the portions were a little bigger. Tip: don't get the beef (literally 3 pieces of small beef cubes). Don't get any spice level above a 6. It's way too spicy to the point of unenjoyable. Also, adding veggies to the curry makes all the difference.

We ordered the Katsu Curry, Oyakodon, Tofu Salad, fried Shumai, and Kushi Teri. The tofu salad was drenched in sesame dressing so I'd definitely ask for it on the side. The fried shumai was so fried it barely had any life left but our son loved it. Of course. We all liked the Kushi Teri - was the favorite out of everything we ordered. The oyakodon was pretty average and had no complaints. The Katsu curry was lacking something in flavor but couldn't put my finger on it. Katsu itself was yummy and crunchy but I feel like I can make better curry at home... and my curry isn't even that great. This isn't to say it tasted bad, I think I was just expecting something better than what we got. Probably won't be back even though the service was pretty attentive and friendly.

FOOD:  overall is tasty and well-proportioned.  However, one time the chicken cats came out very hard and rubbery.  I sent it back and the replacement was fine.  Make sure to request the Japanese pickles to add flavor to your meal!

SERVICE:  is generally friendly and attentive.  You are greeted upon arrival and everyone is quite polite.

AMBIANCE:  is basic, but clean.  It is medium-sized with a number of tables and a counter.

VALUE:  quite good for what you get.  You'll pay about $10 per person without drink.

I have come here a few times now and I really like this place. The owner has always been here working the line and the staff is really nice. I have only done take out from here so far, but even as a take out customer, the staff still treats me like I am dining at there. They have me take a seat and ask me if I would like a glass of water while I wait. 

The first couple of times I've been here I got the same thing. Original curry with pork katsu and kurobota sausage with corn. Recently I tried the 5 piece kushi and it was delicious. I also asked if I could get a couple of extra skewers of quail eggs and I could and I did! 

I would like to try some of the other choices so I will definitely be back.

This place is sooooo yummy! Was introduced by a friend and I won't go anywhere else for curry! The food is served hot and fresh every time and we never have to wait long to dine. I'd give this place 10 stars if I could!

Great place! Service is always friendly and as attentive as possible. It is a small restaurant and very busy, especially weekends, so a wait is always a possibility.
I love the pork katsu curry! It's the best when you add the side of almonds, raisins and shallots and radish.

Delicious! I heart Japanese curry, and though it's so easy to make it also goes great with everything! This place is super tiny and challenging if you're opting to accommodating a large party, but the food is homestyle goodness. I ordered the 5-piece kushiage. So I got: quail eggs, chicken, shrimp, shiitake, and zucchini, fried on a stick all smothered with curry. I also added fried spam on top. No it's clearly not for the health guru, but it's definitely for the hearty! Their spice level is from 1-10. I was a little worried so I went for level 4, but I wish I went atleast to 7. It's not as spicy as Japan's curry so don't be afraid!

It was my first time coming to Zen and the place is small. I viewed all the reviews prior to coming here and knew exactly what to order. I ordered the chicken cutlet and rice adding shrimp with the corn and cheese and absolutely agree that the sauce is awesome! I just personally don't think that corn and cheese goes with the curry. The sauce is very tasty, spices were well balanced as well as the heat of the curry. I like the fact that you have an option to choose white rice from brown rice. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to those who love curry. This place is very inexpensive. The only con to the place is that they had there thermostat set to 80 degrees and it was pretty warm in there....
Food is good.. I ordered chicken katsu curry and fried siomai..i like it.. Service is great staff is really  friendly .. 5 star for them! :)

Love me some Japanese style Curry! Bring on the spice! 

what they lack in variety they more than make up with in quality. The food is great and the price is right on!

Was welcomed well when entering and got to sit in the booths. The service was great and the food was wonderful. The curry udon was a great meal when taking a break from the strip. The food and service was overall 5/5!!

The name says it all... It is Japanese curry at it's finest hence the zen as the ingredients are perfectly cooked and it will put you in a peaceful state of awwwww!  

For staters we like their fried gyoza (5 pieces $4.50). Tako yaki (5 pieces $4.50). 

My favorite curry is the chicken katsu curry level 3 ($9.95). Nice juicy tender chicken katsu and their famous curry is the winner. Do you want beef?  Then try the beef curry which also nice and tender beef chunks ($11.20). 

Only thing I have to warn you about is that you ask who is the cook. I say this as you can choose your spice level from level one to ten. But if it's a Thai cook, it will be really hot. Yes people that I know who really do like hot said oh my. So you might want to ask who the cook is and choose your level of spice from there. My friend got a negative two. I had to laugh but he can't handle spicy at all but he loves the taste as everyone that i brought here does. 

Winding down from a hard day at work or just want an adult beverage?  They have Japanese beer and sake.  Yes they also have a variety of soft drinks too. 

Another reason we like coming here is a awesome waitress named Tavia. We are bummed that she will be leaving here for another job. Very sad we won't be able to see her the next time we come.  Thank you Tavia for always taking care of us.

Came here when I was in Vegas before we were going out for EDC. The food was very satisfying and filling for the day. We had to wait for a while though before being seated because it was a small restaurant and we had 8 people. Once we got it, the service was very attentive and the curry was good. 

Don't get too spicy because it really does get spicy. Very flavorful and I would recommend getting the other side items too. Fried oysters were great addition.
Onolious food! Came here for my birthday busy but quick. Love eating here, service and food always consistent.

really good curry! if i'm ever craving curry, this is the place I go to! their levels of spicy are a lot spicier than you would think, so I like to stick to non-spicy haha

I could only give 4 stars because the food is great and all but the service is just ok. they're not rude or anything, but they're not engaging either. 

but you go for the food, not the service and the food is GOOD

Finally a good curry place where I feed my katsu addiction! There's just something about breaded and fried pork thats smother in a warm aromatic curry sauce that is so comforting. 
They have all the ingredients to have a successful delicious curry joint. Fried meats, a pretty tasty curry recipe, and limited seating (the longer the wait, the more delicious the food). The restaurant itself is very small, so it might not be the best place for large groups.

Curry, anyone? 

When you first come here, you cant help but notice the little flyer that is encased in lexan plastic on the table and it is also on the back of the menu. What's on there is all the spices they use and what they are all about. I just sat down and just this info alone I am better for it because I just found out more info on the usual everyday spices I use on my food.

Their menu is pretty simple. Pick your meat whether its Pork, Chicken, Beef, Sausage, etc. You receive your picked meat covered with their special curry they make from scratch along with white rice. I  couldn't make up mind so I chose the Beef but added Pork Cutlet and a Croquette. 

I shared this wonderful creation with my wifey and we were both impressed. The Pork was juicy and not dry at all. The Beef was soft and tender. As for the Croqette, I have never had it before so I don't really know how to describe it. It's basically a mashed potato cake with some vegetables in it. 

Service was spot on with everything from our order being correctly taken to refills to receiving our check and payment promptly being handled. This was one tip I didn't mind adding extra with the standard. 

Overall, just about everything was perfect except for the size of their place. It is pretty small and on really busy nights, you just might have to wait a bit. Oh well, you know what they say, sometimes good things come in small packages and this is one of them.

Cute small Japanese restaurant that's tucked away from the Las Vegas strip.  My friend and I came by one evening to have some curry.  My friend pointed out that the plaza had a few good restaurants and limited parking so there weren't any parking available when we arrived.  We ended parking on the street.  

Service was rather quick.  I had the chicken curry with cheese and she had the pork curry with cheese.  Our food arrived within 10 minutes.  

Food was delicious.  I have never had Japanese curry before so I can't compare it.  They provide a good portion of rice, lightly breaded and fried chicken with curry and cheese.  I thought it would be weird to have the cheese with the curry but it was actually tasty and all the ingredients meshed well together.  A great combination.  

Service was awesome.  I'd return to this establishment to try more dishes.

Great curry, we go there almost every week for our curry supply.  Favorite dish is the chicken Katsu which is well cooked and matches with the chicken flavored curry.  Rice is easy and plentiful.  I have tried the Curry Udon as well and would recommend that too.  Overall it doesn't have a lot of variety but what it does make it makes it really good.

Whenever I crave Japanese curry, I come to this place! It's also a nice location, just in case you want dessert after or to get something to drink at Kung fu tea! 

Their portion is quite large, so I usually have to take half of it home. I usually get Chicken Katsu curry, spicy level 5. Sometimes my sister & I mix and share an 8 and a 5. 

Their takoyaki is also quite good!

Excellent curry, great service.  My go to is typically chicken curry with spinach.  I enjoy a little bit of spice, so I usually go with spice level 1 or 2.  The boyfriend LOVES spicy, and enjoys level 6.  It's a slow burn, so the first few bites of 6 were ok for me, but was too overwhelming after about 6 or 7 bites.

The curry is so creamy and amazing! Definitely the best Japanese curry I've ever had in the US. I would definitely become a regular if I live in Vegas. This place is just off the strip, and very easy to get to. I am going to come here every time I visit Vegas now :)

I absolutely love this place! It's delicious, but a little bit pricey for what you get (hence one star off).

They offer spice levels from 1-10, and from 10-100 if you're brave. I'm stupid brave. 

I've eaten here many times. I've had a 5. Nothing.

9? No challenge.

15. Waiters are asking me if I'm sure. Still, nothing for me. 

25. I guess there's a kick? Come at me again. 

Tired of asking for more and more spice, I ask for 50. The waiter looks at me, trying to talk me out of it. I swear, at one point he ran over to ask if everything was okay. I'll be honest, 50 gave me sweats.... wiping my brow and running nose. Finally spicy enough for me!

Unfortunately, it tasted like garbage. Instead of a deliciously smooth and flavorful curry, it tasted like chalk. Moral of the story, even if you can handle a 50, don't get it! There's more powder than curry. It would probably be really tasty if they used a spicier pepper instead of more and more of their standard spice. 

That's not their fault though, Zen is delicious if you're sane and order a regular level of spice ;)

I have an addiction to this curry place, such that i had my husband doing a take-out for me and drove from vegas to LA. But it is still soooo good.
The pork katsu curry was yummy, especially with spice level 7, thats some serious kick. The best part about this katsu curry is after the long 5 hours drive, the katsu still taste good.

I am a bit disappointed that this place ran out of curry pan by 3pm in the afternoon. Why why ?

This place is awesome. Great food, fast service. It's a bit tiny, but usually authentic Japanese restaurants tend to be smaller. Sometimes I see a wait, but most times I don't really wait too long. I usually stick with the curry with pork tonkatsu. It hasn't ever disappointed me. If you're hungry and want something quick and filling, curry zen will definitely hit the spot
Super good and cheap! Very traditional Japanese flavor reminds me the curry I had in Osaka! The green tea cheese cake is a must try!

Excellent..Curry is very flavorable.  Spice levels are 1 to 10.  Level 3 quite spicy for me.  Definitely  try the tofu salad.  The dressing is delicious.  I had the tofu Katsu  and husband had the chicken, both were good.

Curry Zen is a very small restaurant that offers a small menu and will cost you a small amount of money. 

The curry is very tasty. I like all the spices and condiments at the table. 

The owner/chef(?) is very friendly and always asks us if we enjoyed it. :)

The curry here is excellent, although it actually has a spicy kick to it (if you order it at a spicy level beyond 3).  The portions are small, but that is not necessarily a bad thing; keeps one from overeating.  So just be warned, if you're looking for massive portions, I don't think this is your spot.  If you like Japanese curry, but you want it so that your mouth can breathe fiery dragon-fire, then check this place out; it's great!

The curry place that we were looking across the street was not open yet so we decided  on this place. Small corner shop probably enough for 15-20 people max! The menu is pretty basic. Curry, rice, and choice of meat. Don't expect anything else. The curry was really good tho. The service was good. Would definitely come back.

one of my favorite places but unfortunately i have to give them 1 starz When i dont see the owner the restaurant become a mess, on my last visi we order tofu katsy and the tofu had bad taste like expired product, the rice was overcooked. When i ask server to chamge it she gave me attitude and loooked at my like im stupid and dont know anything about food. Trust me i was coming this place for last 5 years amd i know hot this dish have to taste. I hope the owner will see this review and do something.

Good service. Very fast. Food was good for what it was. Very cheap meat. Don't expect anything out of the ordinary. Curry had a good spice and the rice was cooked very well! Thai tea was actually really good too.
Been here countless of times. Food and service are consistently great! Whenever me and my boyfriend can't decide on where to eat (which is often), this place is our go-to.
Be sure to try the Tako Yaki balls.. Delish!!

First time having "real" Japanese curry and can't match it better than with tonkatsu. Big plate of rice, crisp juicy pork katsu and spicy curry. Be forewarned the spice level is pretty serious business. I got a level 3 and it pushed me to my limits which really surprised me. Taste is superb though.

Unlimited pickled veggies on the table if that's your kind of thing too.

Went there for the first time. I've been knowing this restaurant since we started to live here. They always seem to come up on yelp whenever I search for restaurant. They have good rating. And I understood why today.
Curry was smooth yet spicy, creamy, tangy. Rice was cooked perfectly, not all smushy and stickly, had enough bite yet soft. 
I had Kurobuta Sausage curry, "blaZEN" level 4. I love spicy food and it was just the right heat for me. Not too hot like I had to take a break, but made my nose run (best sinus reliever!).
Kitchen was sparkly clean, and the entire restaurant was neatly kept. Waiters are attentive. Very cozy atmosphere.
I cannot wait to go back and try their new "curry Udon (oh yeah!) !!

I was craving curry and wanted something comparable to Tani's Kitchen in Daly City or Hurry Curry in LA. This place definitely hit the spot. Very clean presentation and their kitchen looks pretty clean too. There aren't actually too many tables in here, but we were having a pretty late dinner so no one else was in here. My only gripe is that the vegetables I think were $2 extra and were not a substantial portion for the price, but I wanted to feel somewhat healthy that day and would probably continue to order it here - prices are pretty low to begin with already, so I guess it wasn't that bad. Our server was very attentive and I'd definitely come back next time the craving hits.

We happened upon this place as the intended restaurant in this plaza had a long wait.

The curry dishes are super ala carte and only come with rice and your choice of meat or veggie.  But, the plus side is you can order a small portion of rice and order a bunch of add-ins, like croquette, veggies, egg, etc.  The flavor of the curry was rich and flavorful.  One each table, you can choose the level of spiciness you want, mild, hot, and extra hot by sprinking their custom peppers.  Go with the extra HOT!

As a side note, the restaurant is really small, with only a handful of tables and a counter with 6 or so seats.

Altogether, it did the job and we left satisfied.
Good curry but watch out for the spice level. Also superb service and katsudon. A entree will fill you up.

When I eat here, it's spoon to mouth time, and talking is not apart of the equation.   If I have a plate of Zen's curry and rice in front of me, you would have better luck having a conversation with Stephen Hawkins without his computer.   Yeah, it's that kind of place for me because it's that good at Japanese Curry Zen.

The first time, I walked into Japanese Curry Zen was a few months ago, and they won me over on the first spoonful of their Tonkatsu curry and rice.    It was a orchestra of flavors, and the unique herbal blend created Beethoven 5th symphony on my taste buds; it was bold, smooth, and complex.   It wasn't too spicy, but Japanese curry Zen has a  number of condiments on every table to satisfied the more picky eaters.   I'm proud to say, I didn't need any extra raisins or extra spices, because the flavors stood on it's own.     One advice to the owners, Please make a sumo sized plate for those overeating Hawaiians :) because I could go off like the Yellow Gorenger from Himitsu Sentai Gorenger series in this place.   If you never seen that series, the renger headquarters was located below a Japanese Curry cafe like Zen, and that Renger would be pounding out 5 to 6 curry plates each episode.     

Zen doesn't have a large dining area, but I don't need a lot of time to eat here because I will clean out a plate within five to ten minutes.  The owners and majority of the staff are very genuine Japanese, and have that entire business spic and span clean.    Ouch!  Sorry Monta on that comment. 

Everyone raves about Monta, which is located a stone throwaway from Zen, but I believe Zen is leaps and bounds better of the two Japanese restaurant in this shopping complex.   Heck, this might be my favorite Japanese hole in the wall that I ever been too.....and Yes, I am Japanese.
Absolutely love it here! Small and cozy environment. I always get the chicken curry katsu and it never disappoints me. Also the staff is very friendly!!
Amazing, delicious, the best. I Go here all the time. Level Five spice if you can handle the black Hot Cheetos.

Having had curry in Japan, we we're craving it ( can't find it in Texas), found this place in Yelp and decided to give it a try.  It's a nice little place with resly nice service. The food was good. My only complaint is that l ordered a spice level 6 expecting it to be fairly spicy and there was absolutely no spice( my kids thought so also)

Authentic Japanese curry is a rarity in this city, so I'm ecstatic we now have one! 

As another reviewer stated, this place is as similar to Japan's CoCo Ichiban as you can get in mainland America. I've missed this food since I left Japan, so I had the chicken cutlet curry with an extra pork cutlet, and it was exceptional in every way.

The great thing about this place is that your meal can can be as gargantuan as you'd like if you add extra toppings, though the typical serving of rice, curry, and one meat is enough.

The service was very attentive as well, which I'm sure will continue as people discover this gem. 

I'm expecting this place to become the Monta of curry, so enjoy the lull while it lasts. The word WILL get out, and this place definitely deserves more business.

I've been going to Curry Zen so much for over a year now. They really have progressed a lot in the past year. 

Before, their restaurant was very small but ever since they expanded, it has been very spacious and there is always a seat for you right away unless you are a very large party.

Their service is still amazing as always and nothing says the best customer service than the owner coming out to check on his own customers and asking how everything is. The servers themselves are always very kind and attentive.

They recently also expanded their menu and have more appetizers and desserts now. They also got new toppings to go with their curry. For all you spicy lovers out there, there is a higher level than spicy 10. Me and my friends all tried spicy 100 and it is the spiciest curry you will ever taste. It costs $5 more for spicy 100, however, if you cannot handle it and am unable to finish your food, the owner is nice enough to replace the curry for you for something that you can handle :p Therefore, only try spicy 100 if you're prepared to die!

My favorite toppings to get are sausage, tofu katsu, or vegetables. They also have spam katsu which my boyfriend loves! They also have the best thai tea you will ever taste :D

Not sure spicy level 10 is worth it. It's not overly hot at all but it doesn't feel like a 10. Might as well just get a level 3. 

Got spinach and eggs and meatloaf. Tasty dish. If you're thinking of trying it, try it. Like a healthyish Loco moco. $14.55 with spicy level 9

I come to Curry Zen as often as possible - it is my go-to restaurant any time someone is visiting from out of town! I always get the chicken katsu with the normally-spiced curry, and it is positively blissful. 

Though I am so in love with the chicken katsu that I have no desire to branch out, friends and family have gotten a variety of items from the menu, and always devour whatever they choose (with the solitary exception of the takoyaki, which, I think, was not quite what my friend thought it was). 

I almost always get a Thai iced tea (delicious!), and have, on many occasions, barely been able to resist the temptation to order multiple servings of the chicken katsu, and eat nothing else for days! Like I said - bliss!

We are now regulars. We come here at least once a week for dinner and are always greeted warmly. The food is always good. I wanted to update my review because they honestly have great and fast service and the food quality is consistent. Love it!

Place never disappoints. Curry master chef is amazing. He's so friendly too. Just the right about of everything you can think of when you're craving a rice curry dish. Love coming here every time I'm in town. I wish I could take it home and eat it for lunch the next day. Too bad it's way too far and I'm too paranoid that it'll spoil by the time I make it home
Da best Japanese style curry in las Vegas. We love the curry pan,tofu,chicken,shrimp,and etc it so crunchy and soft inside.Service was great .

I like Curry Zen but there's a few things about it that concerns me. First off there are too many dishes on their menu that should be improved or at least evaluated. The sausage curry should not belong on the menu. I'm sorry but it doesn't look like something that should be served at a 4-5 star restaurant. It's literally pieces of cut sausage covered in their curry sauce. Usually less is more, and this is a prime example!

Next, the katsudon is advertised as their prime dish, even stating it as the house dish on their menu if I remember correctly. For something that is their house dish, it was nothing special. In fact, I recommend their standard chicken curry instead. I feel like newcomers to the restaurant or even newbies to curry-eaters in general may not enjoy the katsudon. It's a little soggy and on the bland side.

I like their chicken curry especially with the cheese and corn toppings. The curry, rice and chicken were all on point. I have to say the curry is very flavorful, go to a 7 or 8 if you're around that number with thai food.

Service is friendly and prompt, food is great but I only stick with the curry chicken.

One of the best curry place i have ever eaten, my family came here pretty much every week, sometimes twice a week, the side dish like tofu salad and tako yaki are bomb, toping with corn and chesse make the curry taste more ever better. The only thing I am dislike is that they took off one of the dish call curry puff cake, i believe, and it was so good but some how they took it off the menu. Their customer service is great every-time we visit. We will be back for sure again this week.

We have random curry cravings (yeah, that's a thing) so Curry Zen is our definite go-to! Service is fast and the staff is super friendly. If you're dining on a budget, no worries here. The spice scale is on a 1-10 basis. Anything over a 4 is pretty hot (I'm a wimp)! I recommend the shrimp and fried tofu curry with cheese.

Other than Brandon's curry, I really enjoy the deep fried protein and smooth curry texture. It gets better when you add in the sliced almonds and red pickled radishes. These are hidden little gems that you can ask for (almond or radishes - trust). 

I highly recommend the kushi 5 piece curry. It comes in a variety pack of flavors of meat and veggies on a deep fried kabob Japanese style. Best part of it all, they were deep fried. I also recommend deep fried spam and their 5 piece deep fried oyster. Just sprinkle a lil bit of lemon over them for zest~

My cousin took me here for dinner last night and I am hooked! The best curry I've ever tried. The portions are generous and the curry itself is very smooth. I got the pork tenderloin with a side of tofu katsu. Everythibg was delicious. The tofu salad was bomb too.

Creamy and packed with flavor...does that interests you?...Welcome to Japanese Curry Zen.

I was so surprised at my first bite of curry...SO GOOD!

Our family ordered Curry Pan and Fired Oysters to start things off. Curry Pan is like a giant fried dumpling with curry flavored vegetables inside. The oysters were crispy outside but still fresh ocean flavor with fresh oyster texture inside. 

Next, we ordered the Curry Udon with side of a fried egg (spicy level 7), Vegetable Curry with Chicken Katsu and Brown Rice, and a side fried egg (spicy level 7), Chicken Katsu Curry with a side of Croquette on white rice (spicy level 1). They rate spicy level from 1 to 10, and they have curry powder and red pepper powder on every table to spice up yours if you like and they also have Sriracha Sauce available for the asking. 

We shared all our dishes and loved every bite. Katsus was cooked crispy and tender inside and croquette was such a hit that we almost ordered another one but decided to save room for dessert.

Japanese Curry Zen has a very casual setting with prompt service...we were in and out in about 40 minutes.  

I will go back in a heartbeat to Japanese Curry Zen with more excitement than I had for the first visit knowing how great their menus is.
This is one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas. Not only is the curry awesome, but the owner personally greets every customer as they come and go. Very welcoming, great service and food!!

I love the curry here! It has a homemade taste - you can taste the vegetables melted into the curry broth, so subtle. I love the simplicity of the menu too. The curry broth is the main ingredient of course, and then you can add a topping. Genuine service too :)

You can only eat so much strip food. 
Eventually you need "real" food. 
This became our "real food" place of the trip. 

It's not high end but, it's filling and reasonably priced. 
That counts! The katsu was delicious and juicy. 

If I could ask for anything, it'd be a bigger space! Our wait was long. Definitely worth it though for a simple tasty break in all the madness!

Honestly, I didn't know what to expect coming here. So this review is more that the food type just wasn't for me. There was too much of this fish taste that I don't like in general. I think though that the type of food represented here is really good, just not my thing.

Food is always bomb and hits the spot. I've never been disappointed with an order from here, but I took a star off because the last few times I ordered through a delivery service I recieved a noticeably smaller amount than usual.

Been obsessed with this place since I found out about it. I usually get the takoyaki here along with the tofu katsu curry. The tofu katsu is so delicious and always hits the spot and it's what got me coming back time and time again. They're very friendly here and I never get tired of the food. Definitely a great place to try, and it's so convenient because there' a couple dessert places you can go to after eating here. The only downside to this place is parking; because the center is so busy, there's usually never any parking nearby and I always find myself having to park on the side street.

My go to spot for curry! Everything is so delicious and the service is awesome! Recommend the katsu, ton katsu, kurobuta, or meatloaf. Also the gyoza or shumai! I usually order a 0 spice level because there's still a small kick to the curry. Personally I like to taste all the flavors of my food without having my mouth burning.

Japanese Curry Zen is one of those types of restaurants that you are willing to go to if you want to eat rice because you do not want to be home. 
It is also one of those restaurants that you would probably want to go to every day if only it was right by your house. 
I always go for the Katsu curry and it does come on a large plate. It is definitely more than filling and sometimes kills me inside because there is more rice than I can handle. 
The service is constantly good and I am so lucky that this restaurant is in the same plaza as Kung Fu Tea. I mean I feel like I am always in a win win situation whenever I do eat here because of all these other places in the same plaza! 
This restaurant beats Tokyo Kitchen any day.

We lived in Japan for 3 years and became obsessed with Japanese style curry. Short of hopping on a plane back to our favorite Curry restaurant in Yokohama, this place is the best! 
The curry is perfectly seasoned, all proteins are cooked very well and portions are a good size.

The chicken katsu curry is to die for!!! My boyfriend said he would have likes veggies or something in the curry, but I thought it was perfect as a plain sauce. Prices are decent, and the food is just too good. The croquettes are super duper yummy too.
The only downside is the parking lot-- it's set up really poorly. 
Will definitely come back!

SOLID Japanese curry restaurant but we weren't  wowed by our dishes 

---pork katsu with curry (spicy level 5): it wasn't too spicy, honestly more of a mild to medium spice level. The curry was good but the katsu was a bit dry, I expected a fattier cut 

NOTE: love how they offer to put everyone's food on separate bills and take credit cards

So I love Curry, and I often go here to get my curry to go, but what I really like... Is the Katsu Curry with Cheese and Corn. I have to say though, they are so Stingy on that stuff that you can probably just have some at home and save yourself a $1.00 Also when you order (extra) anything make sure you double check with them as to how they Add Extra - because I got cheated one day on my rice.. Never again will that happen. 
I advise though, there are only 3 tables in this place and 10 seats at the bar, way small place... So doing the take out thing is AWESOME!!! 
Food is good tasting stuff though... Totally love Curry... so I like this! Yes ^__^ ..

I absolutely love traditional Japanese curry houses. I was extremely excited when they opened because back home where I'm from (Hawaii) they have a curry house called cocoichibanya. This reminds me so much of home.

Friendly service, a pleasant n' cheery interior, and the most authentic tasting Japanese meal I've had since coming back to the States. The pork cutlet was delicious. I went for dinner on a Tuesday, and the place was empty, which makes no sense. The price and the quality of the food are fantastic. I also found out that they have wi-fi - maybe I'll return for lunch and get some work done, while enjoying some more of their yummy curry.

Small mom and pop joint in Chinatown LV.  Clean, newly remodeled and very popular among the locals so we gave it a whirl. We got the chicken and pork curry katsu. Deep fried fried flattened choice of pork and chicken that is smothered in their curry sauce (yum). You can choose either white or brown rice to accompany the dish, our fav is the brown. This is not your ordinary Indian or Chinese curry. It's a secret Japanese style that is usually cooked hours on end. I don't know how this recipe is prepared or how long it's cooked but it tasted really good. You can get it in a range of how spicy you like the dish from 1-10. The server didn't ask us and I totally forgot so I was a tad bit disappointed that the dish was not as spicy as I would like. Otherwise great find and a must if your in the area.

Visited on 5/31/16
Went with a party of 3 during the evening.

Atmosphere: Busy and lively
Despite the busy atmosphere, the sound and commotion actually adds to the atmosphere, bringing a live, and active feeling to the dining experience.

Service: Excellent
Despite the large amount of people present at the time of my visit, we were still well-attended by the servers. The table was clean and our food was served in a timely manner.

Food: Super good!
We ordered a tonkotsu bowl, a meatloaf curry, and chicken katsu curry. The spiciness levels we ordered were up to par with what we expected and the flavor of the curry met our expectations. Flavorful and colorful, it's a curry you'll truly enjoy.

Summary: Visit this place!
Worth a visit! If it get super packed, you know you have to be a good place to each.

Absolutely hands down the best Katsu Curry I've ever eaten!  And the tofu salad was so delicious !!! 
You must eat here if u love Japanese curry ... This place is the best in Vegas and ridiculously affordable !

Its kind of crazy how popular this place is when all it serves is curry. Especially in a strip mall that has a handful of other really well known Japanese restaurants. But the curry is insanely good and if you're craving curry, this is the place to go. 

My boyfriend and I went in for a late lunch and although it wasn't very busy at first, it filled up completely as we ate. We both had the $3 Kirin draft (can you even eat Japanese food without draft beer?) and an order of fried shumai to start. I usually like all dumpling foods to be steamed and not fried but these ended up being pretty good. They're small, but filled with meat and delicious with Chinese mustard. My boyfriend ordered the chicken katsu curry with corn and cheese and I had the beef curry spicy level 10. I'm pretty traditional with my curry... I haven't quite mastered all these add ons and it seems weird to put cheese on curry especially. Cheese isn't really a staple in Asian food. But of course cheese makes everything better. I had a bite of the chicken katsu curry and the corn and cheese did add some more texture to the dish. My boyfriend said it reminded him of the KFC Famous Bowl which is hilarious. The beef curry was awesome all by itself though. I did have to ask for some pickled radish and onion and I stirred those in, not sure why those don't come with the dish already. I was surprised at how spicy it really was since I've read they can actually get even higher than the level 10. There were about six chunks of beef in the dish, but I shredded them up and they went further. My only complaint about both dishes was that the temperature of the curry itself could have been a bit warmer. I noticed this especially with the cheese in the katsu curry, I think it would help it melt more. Anyways, great meal at Curry Zen and it's always enough food to bring home so I'll be eating it later as well!

Upon entry I am always immediately seated. The restaurant does get busy but the service and attentiveness of the staff is always on point. 

I was sad that they ran out of takoyaki and gyoza and hopefully they will be available in the near future. I always get the pork katsu curry and add corn and sometimes cheese. Delicious.

Had a taste for Chicken Katsu. The chicken was very plain with zero seasoning however the panko breading is yummy. I added Curried Veggies these were the best ever. Seasoned well, had a light crisp, and the curry gravy was delicious  . So next time I would get extra gravy to pour over the chicken katsu and white rice. Staff was very pleasant and patient. Small cute restaurant. Nice place to have a conversation.

The curry is really good, it's flavorful and has a reasonable portion. Service was quick since we arrived right when it opened. The spice numbering system is a little unclear since it goes up to 10 but from our experience 1, 2, 3 is like mild medium and hot while 10 is like depths of hell or something. My friends couldn't handle their spiciness "3" and the waitress took it back and remade their food less spicy. The chef came out to make sure it was okay and he was really friendly about it and a fantastic sport. As someone that generally can't handle spicy, a 2 was perfect for me. So go ahead and test your spiciness, and if you can't handle it, you can trade it out for no extra cost!

Decided to try this place out with some friends and the food was delicious and service was great! Definitely coming back. Had the vegetable curry with chicken katsu level 3. It was a little hotter than I thought, but still was yummy!

Love this place! My first time having Japanese curry and it was phenomenal, I am definitely recommending this place to all my friends and coworkers. Can't wait
For my next visit.

Been to curry spots all over Japan as well as the US. This place was the closest I've found to the good ones in Japan. The curry tasted homemade and the varieties of Katsu's were both tasty and crispy. Appetizers were tasty as well. Had the curry pan and it was so good I had to order another! Definitely glad I found this place and will be coming back for sure!
Best Japanesse curry in las vegas. I am no expert. I have had Japanesse curry about a dozen times. This place is the best one in Vegas. Great staff to boot!
I'll keep it short, this is the best curry in Las Vegas,
Western, not authentic Japanese curry house. Spice level 1-10 waiter insisted I order 2 as this is medium. Curry house that doesn't want you to eat curry.

Yum - had a craving for Chicken Katsu Curry and this satisfied it! Was staying on the strip and used Postmates to get dinner delivered!  Cheaper than a roundtrip Uber.  Curry was tasty and the katsu was crunchy and moist. Never seen spice level options before, I got a 1 which was just fine for me. And my hubby got a 4, which he said was pretty spicy - and he likes spice.  All in all, would order again if in Vegas.

The curry is very tasty. Very savory, perhaps slightly too salty for my taste, but I can't deny the fact that salt can be so yummy.

I've been here twice now. I got mild spicy and I would rate that as a 4 out of 10. So for people that aren't into spicy, make sure to order extra mild. Spice is so tough to calibrate though, sometimes I order a 4/10 at a thai place and it comes out 6/10 and some other places when I order medium the spicy level is 3/10. Oh well, spicy is dependent on each cook too. So, just order what you think you can handle that day.

I had the veggie curry then added meat to it. I enjoyed that veggies in the curry a lot. I highly recommend that.

Very good! We love chicken katsu curry. The flavor of the curry was what we expected and can pick 1-10. We also ordered naan bread and cheese with the curry. Chicken was fresh and juicy. The rice was sticky and just made.

We lived I Okinawa, Japan for three years with the military and had the pleasure of trying CoCo Ichibanya there. I've craved it almost every day since we left and I came across this place!!! It's curbs my craving every time and the spicy levels do no disappoint! I love this curry but the price for a beer isn't the best  sooo order it to go and buy some beer from Lees haha I can't stop eating curry

Came in for my friend's birthday, was surprised by their large menu, friendly staff, and cheap beer. The dish I got, chicken katsudon, was absolutely delicious and I was given a more than generous serving. They have japanese soda too! Great cheap dinner in a nice atmosphere. Will be coming back soon!
This is hands down the best curry place In town. I always get the veggies with chicken Katsu. Price is very reasonable and good service

Craving Japanese Curry? Stuck on the strip? Get in a cab over to this place, stat.

This place is relatively cheap, depending on what you order...

- Chicken Curry Katsu: Sizable piece of chicken katsu, nicely breaded, loads of rice, flavorful curry. ~$9

- Pork Tender: If you're going to get pork, get the pork tender. It is MUCH greater than the regular pork katsu, and only a few dollars more. ~$12.50

- Spinach Curry: Yep, this is the real deal. It has a nice kick to it and is a fantastic option if you're not looking for any meat. ~$8

Waitstaff was attentive. The wait doesn't seem to be terribly long. Adding this to the complex probably makes this the best complex in vegas (Sweets Raku, Raku, and Monta Ramen)

Located in the Seoul Shopping Center, which should be called a Japanese Shopping Center by the way since there are way more Japanese restaurants (Raku, Monta, Trattoria Nakamura-Ya and Kuboto) there than Korean. 

I tried the chicken cutlet curry and it was good. The curry sauce was really flavorful and not too spicy. The cutlet had a crispy batter and it was tender on the inside. The side pickled onion was my favorite. Sweet and a little sour, no lingering raw onions smell or taste. 

My bf had the shrimp curry and it was also good. It was a good size shrimp and was not over cooked. 

As what the other Yelpers mentioned on their reviews, I hope they add vegetable options in their menu. Veggie goes well with curry!

Decent price for this kind of food, amount of serving and location.

My most favorite japanese curry spot! Great service, reasonable prices and amazing food quality. Tip: You can also sub white rice for brown rice for free. 

Been coming here regularly for a couple years now. Still one of my top places to go to. Keep up the good work guys!
Everything we ordered was spot on. The Takoyaki was like, actually significantly better than other places enough for me to notice!

I LOVED this place when I was living in Vegas! It was a relatively new find for me when I was in Vegas a couple of months ago. I've had the chicken katsu which was DELICIOUS. The katsu was breaded very lightly and it didn't feel too heavy. The rice was perfectly steamed. The curry was rich and creamy. The rice to curry ratio is perfection. I always finished my dish without any rice or curry to spare.  Spicy level 3 was already a good kick for me -- my spice tolerance is pretty low. 

I also tried the veggie curry which was perfect for me that day. I was feeling sick that time and the veggie dish was so hearty.

AMAZE!!! The chicken katsu curry is life changing and this place knows what a 10 spice level is. If you like spicy food this is it. The curry is perfectly balanced in flavor and spice. The rice is also cooked to perfection. I always order the chicken katsu or tofu katsu with beef at a 7 spice level so I can devour the whole thing. Service is iffy but they keep a skeleton crew on the floor so it is understandable.

I've been looking for a good Japanese Curry House for over 10 years since I left my home town.  I just happened to see it when I was at Kung fu tea.  I had the Shrimp and Pork Katsu.  Flavor was  perfect but temperature of the curry was semi cold.  I want to eat steaming hot curry with medium spice.  I want the cheese to melt.  I will try this place again and I might give more stars but I'm not sure if I should request the curry extra hot temp or just chance it????!? I see the cooks working very hard in the back but I wondered why the curry was cold.  Maybe they didn't stir it up good before plating it and the curry sauce at the top got cold.  When I go to a buffet and there's soup, I always stir a few seconds wait to see the steam before I scoop and I get it hot and fresh.  I haven't given up on this place but they better notice that if the curry isn't hot then you can't finish the meal cause it's gross to eat when it's cold.

i love this place! one of my favorite restaurants in vegas. The service and food are always great! i come at least 3 times a week. As good as curry in japan, only missing the nan! Definitely a must try!!

Awesome food. Simple but done so well. Curry udon 3x in 4 days. My friend from San Francisco says this is way better than Volcano Curry up there. Wait staff is inexperienced and spacey at times but once the food comes out, I'm pretty darn happy. 

The curry spice range is 1-10. A 3 or 4 leaves an afterglow on your lips at the end of the meal. Much more than that and I don't think I'd taste the nuisances of the curry.

Thank you again, Yelp! I would have never found this little place on my own. After a long day of walking the strip this just hit the spot. This place is nestled away in a little Asian shopping center and that it's a good sign that the food is authentic. I heard this type of curry is called "Navy curry" because the Navy brought this delicious Indian spice to Japan. Thank goodness they did!

As you can see, every dish looks the same and pretty much tastes the same. You can have chicken with curry, shrimp with curry, pork with curry, tofu with curry or beef with curry. :-D If you want Japanese curry it's the place to go, if you want more variety you probably want to find another place. I highly recommend binging on the pickled onions and radishes on the table.

3 was spicy ass shyt 
It wAs more like 10 lol 
I suggest no spice but it was good 
Home cooked type food

Love this place. Good Japanese curry.  Not CoCos but it will do :) 
(At least till I go back to LA)

Japanese curry is REALLY different than Indian, and a lot of Americans aren't really familiar with its unique blend of spices. I have spent quite a bit of time in Japan, and my wife is from Kyoto. we loved this place! the owner was friendly and attentive, the food was as authentic as any we have had in Japan. the place is immaculate. try and get there early, because this place is going to be a hit.

Glad this place is getting more recognition. 

Nothing fancy schmancy about this place. Very simple yet clean decor. Serves traditional Japanese curry. 

But...Undoubtedly thee best curry I've ever had the pleasure of eating. Their curry is just bursting with flavor, and you can taste all the spices that they incorporate into it. Oishii! Their pork katsu and fried shrimp have always been perfectly crisp as well.

Their service is always superb and accommodating. Arigatou gozaimashita!

Family run business that are just awesome people. 

I will always make a trip to this joint whenever I'm back in town :)

Every time I come to Las Vegas I make sure to visit this location at least twice during my stay. I never eat curry at home or given any other opportunity to but I make sure to get the Curry Udon with chicken Katsu on the side every time I can here in Vegas. I get it with level 12 heat and it only tingles the lips but it's edible. Not that crazy amount of heat where you literally die. Last meal material. Can't wait to go back.

Pretty good curry! We arrived starving so that probably helped the case too. Food comes out very quickly - great b/c we were starving, caveat - the rice tasted cool. Rice needs to be hot!
We ordered tako yaki, and fried shumai as apps - both delish! Everyone ordered port katsu curry of varying spicyness levels. Very nifty you can choose your own level of spice (1-10). We ordered between 5-8, and it was a good amount of spice. Some ordered with white rice, some ordered with the 16 grain. Both good. The katsu was well fried and crispy, but again - not hot. So thank for getting our orders out so quickly, but food wasn't as hot as it should be.

Very solid. Condiments like raisins, nuts, etc are no charge. Not sure my palate is sensitive enough to differentiate between different japanese curry places so it's hard to really rate. Cute waitresses though :)

Well, very polite staff and delicious food.. overall, I am satisfied and would go back there anytime.

They were about to close but still made exception to cook for me veggie and beef curry with rice.. 

One critic I would have was, portions are small, I was able to eat two orders myself. Each order being 12 dollars average, making the portions bigger would bump this place 5 stars in my book.

I cannot express how much I love to eat at Curry Zen. The food is very well priced  and delicious. I have tried most everything on the menu and have never been disappointed. Curry Zen provides a variety of options for curry lovers as well as amazing appetizers. Not only that but they offer a smaller sized portion that is perfect for me.

My favorite is the tofu katsu with a side of radish and onion. Every time I come, it is made fresh and amazing. The curry is perfectly flavored and the tofu is scrumptious.

Not only is the food amazing, the staff is very friendly. They are efficient and kind. I couldn't ask for nicer service. The establishment is always perfectly clean.

I come to Curry Zen at least once a week and recommended it to everyone. I have never seen anyone not like the food here.

What a great little place! The food is exploding with flavor..... 

be warned on the level of spicy heat you ask for! They offer 1-10, and charge for over 5.  For one who typically orders Thai Spice 7-9, I was shocked when it ordered a 3 here and broke a sweat! 

The dining room is very small with only 4 tables and a small eating bar. It reminds me of curry house in Honolulu.

This is a must go!!!

Oishii! Authentic! Real Japanese curry-- like Japan! Make sure you put all the condiments on top- the red little pickles, white picked onions, raisins, sliced almonds... 

Got the chicken katsu- white rice baby. Added cheese and corn (50 cents each). Level 3 spice. Delish! The crunchy, moist chicken katsu, with the warm, sticky rice. The sweetness of raisins and the crunch of almonds, combined with the sour umami of the pickled red condiments. So good! 

Pretty lame I don't remember the real name of the red stuff. Cut some slack, 3 rd generation Japanese American :). 

Hubs lived in Japan, and said it's as authentic as it gets, except in Japan, you can add a raw egg. 

Hubs also added a potato croquet to his and loved it. 

Small place, but no problem seating our group of 9 on a Sat night. Busy little strip mall, with a convenient bobba tea place nearby. 

Edamame was a large serving for $3.50. 

Highly recommend this hidden gem!!

Got a chance to finally check this place out a few weeks ago and I wasn't that impressed. Not really sure what all the hype is about. The curry here is decent, better than most places, but nothing to rave about.  

Like most others diners, I ordered the curry katsu which runs about $10. Each add-on (corn, egg, carrots, etc) is an $1 extra so it can get pricey if you prefer toppings in the curry. The katsu which is perfectly golden and crispy is the main selling point here. The curry on the other hand is just basic. Its simply a water downed brown sauce which explains why they charge for the toppings on the side. They also charge extra if you want spice up the curry but I did notice that their level 3 is probably a level 7 or 8 at most other places. There isn't a whole lot that sets this place apart from the other Japanese curry spots in the area. Thankfully they do serve beer and wine which is always a plus. 

The restaurant itself is a small eatery located across the from Sweets Raku in the heart of Chinatown. The plaza gets busy so finding parking can be a pain. Service wasn't an issue, though its pretty obvious that English isn't anyone's first language here. There is a limited menu beyond their curry options but katsu curry appears to be the best seller by far.
Atmosphere is dope, and the food is too. It has a simple presentation but the flavor isnt simple at all. Is amazing dawg. Damn son, c'mon son damn son.

You have to love Japanese curry.   That deep spicy flavor
  Crispy katsu.   Yum.   Level 3 was good and spicy.   Could go to 5.  Hard to believe I would enjoy 6 and above.   Good service.   Very typical of what you would find in Japan. 

Not expensive and next to a great little massage place.

It's so hard to find a good curry place in Vegas.  I'm glad someone mentioned this place to us. Curry is similar to Curry House back home. Service was great. Food was ono. A place we will return to for curry.

I have been searching for a curry place in Vegas that I would always enjoy love going to and I have found it at Japanese Curry Zen. 

Inside the restaurant is really small and calm, which can be desirable or undesirable, depending on the person I guess, but I don't really see it as a negative thing. 

The curry itself is very tasty. When you order, I recommend getting the chicken or pork cutlet. You can even order an extra side of meat or anything else with it because they give you ample curry for another piece of meat! They even have different spices and condiments on the table for you to add to your curry so your curry won't ever be boring!

The owner always says hello and talks to customers when it isn't busy and asks if you are enjoying the food. That little bit of effort he puts to make sure everything is okay goes a long way.

Fantastic Japanese curry. Just like some of the better places in Japan. 

If you're like me, a typical American guy who got tired of all the healthy fish &  veggies in Japan, you've fallen in love with Japanese curry and the seemingly random assortment of available toppings. This place reminds me of the better curry shops in Japan, albeit without a ticket vending machine in front... 

Although I really wanted to try the spam katsu curry, I stuck with my traditional pork katsu & cheese curry. And the shaved almonds as a crunchy topping were fantastic. 

If you were right by my house, Japanese Curry Zen, I would need to move, because I'd probably eat there every day and gain 15 pounds the first month. Thank you,  though, for only being 15 minutes from home.

I love curry! And this place doesn't look like much in presentation but nailed it on the head in flavor! 
After reading the other reviews,  someone stated a 5 was as spicy as a 9, so I got the 5. Was it burning hot? No. But it was full of flavor. I think I'll try the 9 next time.
Husby got a 1 and said after so many bites, the heat builds up and couldn't finish it. My 6 year old finished it for him.  So if you can't handle any bit of heat, stick with the mild flavor.
My daughter ate the curry udon in the mild flavor. It came with onions, green onions and bits of chicken. She loved it but couldn't finish it since polishing off her dad's plate.
The mild taste a bit sweet with ZERO spice and is very tasty. 
The fried shumai also comes with a spicy mustard sauce, like the hot mustard from Chinese restaurants. I personally love shumai fried now.  
We all enjoyed our meal.  Our service was polite even w/ the limited English our waiter spoke.
I'll definitely be back when visiting LV again.

Very heavy but tasty.  If you're into heavy curry and fried foods, then this place is for you.  Not the healthiest and you will feel it afterwards.  Not much vegetable to this meal.  I had the pork katsu with spicy 10 curry with spinach and corn additions.  The corn was like 20 kernels and the spinach was devoured in the curry so not much green to it.  It had a little kick but nothing crazy.  The pork was your basic breaded meat.  I enjoyed the meal but it definitely hits you later in the day and gives you the bloated feeling.    I paid $13.95 total for my meal so it's definitely not that cheap either.  I'd rather eat at many of the other options in China Town or the shopping plaza alone.  But if you're into katsu then it's a good rendition.
By the far the best curry so far, that I've had. Compared to Kaba, this place has better food.
Super friendly staff! Would love to return agin to spice up my levels with curry. Food is very consistent and the small drink selection lists is also pretty accommodating to the restaurant's type.

We fell in curry love when we were brought here when we relocated to Las Vegas. At that time the had not expanded the resturant so seating was hard to find. When you have people waiting in line for food, you know it's good and they have not disappointed us with the food here. Its small, homey and did I mention that the food is oh sooo good?

Curry is excellent!!!! It is Japanese. DonKatsu was crispy meaty enough to harmonized with spicy curry. Toko Yaki was delicious!!!! Service was quick and pleasant. I would recommend to friends who will visit Las Vegas.

Small for sure and easily overlooked.  I have dined at Monta numerous times right next door and never really noticed this place.  My boyfriend wanted to try it so off we went.  There was a big party taking up the only tables in the place and we ended up at the counter.  A little claustrophobic maybe at the counter.  The menu is small.  There basically is one curry that can have a few options of meat and everything comes with rice.  But the curry is good and flavorful and makes me happy.  It has something like 13 different spices in it which all contribute to your health somehow.  None the less we gobbled up everything on our plates, didn't pay very much and we left with a warm belly of curry.
Yes, Yes 1000 times yes. Chicken Katsu with veggies - my go to and a regular craving all day every day.

There's nothing like Japanese curry on a cold day to warm the stomach.  When I'm craving comfort, this is my spot for j-curry.  Came here on weekday night for dinner with my best friend.  Restaurant was packed, but we were seated promptly.  I like how we can customize the spicyness and what is included with our meals.  The meat is fried golden brown and is crunchy in comparison to the rich spicy curry.  The steamed rice helps to balance all the flavors and all together make up a symphony of good food!

You can get all your curry craving needs taken care of here... the title says it all.  

I got the chicken cutlet curry, (so typical) but paid the extra few bucks for the vegetable curry.  I like that you can add in whatever you want to your dishes a-la-carte.  My roommate added the croquet and corn and cheese to her chicken curry, went all out on that shiz.  

You also choose your level of spicyness.  Levels 1-5 are free, levels 6-10 are extra.  I got the level 3 thinking it was like a 3/10, mild.  It was actually pretty spicy!  I had to take breaks and I was chugging a lot of water.  I cannot imagine what the 6-10 tastes like.  Next time I will get the 2 for sure.  

Condiments galore... everything you need is right in front of you.  I like to add tons of scallions and pickled radishes to my curry.  I will definitely be coming back, especially cus the weather is cooling down.

I love the food here BUT the manager named Uta was EXTREMELY RUDE. I complained that my chicken was undercooked and was extremely hard to cut and he came over and ate a piece of chicken out of my plate and said "it's fine to me" and didn't want to help me out. What manager eats out of a customers plate to prove them wrong?! That was disgusting and so disrespectful. I've been coming here for three years, once a week so I know how my order should be and taste like. I never thought I would have to write a bad review about this place.

I discovered this place because it's adjacent to Monta Ramen and Kung Fu Tea (which are both great places btw).  Plus Curry Zen is one of my bro's favorite Japanese Curry places to go.  

It always feels like the parking lot is packed, but that's just all of Chinatown.  You'll always find parking here. 

There's plenty of seating, and you have plenty of choices for toppings in curry.  I decided to get curry with spinach, cheese, and katsu.  I wish I shared because my plate was HUGE.....for me at least.  I ended up taking it to go.  I think what made if filling was the spinach.  

I've gone to one other curry place, and I have to say the portions here are very generous.  Next time, I'll have to share.
First time I went was fantastic but the batter wasn't as good the second round. Ill definitely be back, the curry itself is very authentic. Also try their oysters!
The food is great! Love the option to increase spicy levels. Only complaint is horrible parking and verry, very small interior room. But food is on point.
Great food, simple traditional dishes with super fast great service. Love love love this place. Everyone should check it out!

The pork katsu was very juicy and my veggies in the curry had the right springy done-ness. And, yes the curry does have a nice depth of flavor. That is where all the good stuff tapers off. Yelp has this place listed as one $ but with 2 people, sharing 1 drink, our bill was $48. If you get the basic chicken katsu its one $, the rest, and I mean THE REST is all EXTRA. I ordered spicy level 5 and my friend ordered 8.  Our spicy levels were extra charges and it gets more expensive the spicier you get! I think  spice level 8 is 35 cents extra. Which reminds me, they switched our spice levels and I was almost crying trying to eat my curry while his had almost no spice...we were in no mood to voice our concern as we were just hungry. The takoyaki felt a bit under done, the 'meatloaf' is more like a soft burger patty and cheese and corn cost 75 cents extra, each.... not worth the extra price (the corn was COLD). Over all I would love it if I could just get the curry sauce to go and fend for myself. Oh and the 16 grain rice was A-M-A-Z-I-N-G if you like rice similar to the purple Korean rice. *TIPS - Don't go when it's busy (we went when it was slow and still felt a bit rushed) AND tell your mom you love her.
Been going here for the past 7 years!! Love the curry! Very authentic Japanese curry!!
Flavors are clean and precise! Get the curry pan amazing! Thai tea is very tasty also.
I love their curry here. The price is perfect. I would suggest adding cheese to your curry. It gives it a little kick. Overall, the food is scrumptious and the place is very cute & petite!

I do not usually give 5 stars, I really have to be absolutely in love to give 5 stars and LOVE is an understatement for how I feel towards this place. 

1. Authentic Japanese curry flavor and restaurant feel but with many Americanized menu options

2. Gigantic portions for a very reasonable price

3. Fastest service I have ever had at a restaurant. Every time we've come here we literally got our plates within 7-8 minutes of ordering.

Brought me back to when I lived in Kochi Japan when I was little, and the quality of the food was mind blowing.

If you are a vegetarian, this place is perfect for you. The Tofu Katsu is like eating chicken. The fried food is not greasy at all and taste amazing. The chefs clearly know what they are doing, I have not one complaint about anything.

This place has become a weekly thing for me now, and I live 30 minutes away. 

I would seriously have to go through a grieving process if this place shut down.

Love that you can make it your own with all the possible combinations of add ons.
I spent part of my childhood in Japan and this is the place reminds me of that childhood. One of my family's favorite places. Got my friends all addicted to it. 
Note. As amazing as it is the cost does add up. My brother is guilty of adding lots of toppings. 
My usual is a chicken or tofu Katsu with veggies and spicy four. Then one or two curry pan to go.

really great place for good Japanese curry.

This place has some really good service and value, you definitely will walk away feeling like you snagged yourself some sort of deal when you get your meal haha. The curry is actually pretty spicy, for someone who is good with spice, so I definitely do recommend a kind of lower spice level. It's kind of sad we don't have a curry house like this back at home that I can compare this to, but it's definitely authentic.

Katsu was of course, good.

Small store located in the same plaza as Monta Ramen and Big Wong Resturant. 

I've been meaning to come here as I've heard good things from friends and others and finally was able to come. 

The overall atmosphere is very friendly with a welcoming staff. I liked the atmosphere a lot. There is a bar with maybe 10 or so seats and four tables I believe that seat four each. 

I'm very particular about my Japanese Curry as I am with a lot of Japanese foods, but I try to keep an open mind. 

They have many condiments on the table, three of them are different levels of spicy curry powder (mild, regular, spicy), ginger, almonds, raisins, and salt & pepper. The curry powder is their recipe with many blended spices that they make. 

The prices are pretty reasonable, $4.95 for the plain curry and then depending on the topping you add additional costs. You can mix and match whatever you want on their menu ranging from chicken katsu to corn and other items you would "normally" find in curry. 

I got the croquette (+$2) and corn (+$1) in my plain curry. I thought for the price the croquette would be slightly larger than what it came out as, so I was a little disappointed. They brought it out on a plate with the rice on one side and curry on the other, the croquette and corn in the middle, with an overlap of curry (Japanese don't like to "mix" the curry and rice traditionally). The croquette however was good and I believe they make it as well. It was nicely browned to the correct color and breaded perfectly. 

The curry itself was mediocre, maybe I was expecting more, but I have to come back and try it again to make a real comparison. The spices were good, but it felt like something was lacking, maybe it was an unlucky batch that I got. I'll definitely come back to give it another try before making a final opinion on it. 

It has an authentic taste to it, maybe the most authentic out of all the curry I've tried in Las Vegas, but like I said I would have to give this another try along with some others. Will update in the near future on the taste of the curry again. =]
