Oh they didn't put the ginger on the plate (thankfully, as I don't like ginger). 

I would definitely recommend at least giving it a try.

We were there at 10pm on a saturday and waited for about 15 mins to get a table for a party of 6.  Including ordering and eating it took us about an hour.  The stupid waiter named Yuta went to our table and gave us our bill.   We paid right away and he asked us if we need anything else - we said no thats all but he still kept on looking at us.  We were still talking while waiting for my husband who went to the restroom and the stupid waiter came back again at our table saying since we didnt need anything if we can leave  coz theres a big party waiting outside.  Really?  Who cares if there's a big parttly outside?   Is it right to ask customers to leave right away after they ate and they got the money already?  That was freakin rude and very disrespectful.   I asked to speak with the owber and he said the waiter did the right thing coz they do have a small place.  And that gave them the right to disrespect customers by asking to leave after eating?   Stupid and uneducated people!!!!!   Will never go.back there again.  I'll give my business elsewhere who's deserving and have  intelligent owners and workers.  Never will I go to this stupid place again!!!

I'll make this short---
16 grain rice. Spice levels from 0-100 (ok, maybe I'm exaggerating, but you've got choices). ***TAKOYAKI*** Request fukujinzuke to accompany your curry and you're all set. 

Service is fast, friendly, efficient, and food is good! I will warn you, even their milder spice levels are spicier than other places, so err on the side of caution.

I always get the chicken Katsu with cheese spicy lvl 7 just enough spice to give it a kick and make you nose run slightly but not enough to hurt your stomach they're servers are always friendly and know when to refill your water cup

Yummy! I am an islander, so we cook with curry also but I have to say....Japanese curry has stolen my heart. It's so creamy and delicious. I can't wait to go back and have more. The service is also great! They are very attentive! This place has made me into a huge fan! Yay!

This was my first time ever trying Japanese curry. The restaurant was clean and our servers were super friendly.. My main issue was the following:
I ordered a beer and there was too much head ( someone doesn't know how to pour) my beer was half a glass by the time it settled which is a rip off. We also received our meals 5 mins apart which is super awkward. My friend got his plate... 5 mins later I got mine... 5 mins later my BF got his... So my bf had to wait ten minutes into us eating to join in.. I don't mind getting our meals one plate at a time but that's way too big of a gap.

I ordered a croquette level 7 curry and it was DELICIOUS! I had 0 problem with the food. I love spicy and level 7 was the perfect level for me. 
I love the food and our waitress was nice but please work on whomever pours the beer to learn how to pour it correctly and have the food come out close to each other so it's not awkward.
UPDATE***
Came back a second time and everything was awesome. 
No complaints second time around.
Went from 3 stars to 5 stars for me!!!

Wow.  Just tried this place, very glad I did.  Great quality curry.  This is the closest I have found to the Coco Ichibanya Curry House in Hawaii since I left home.  Amazing.

At first we got there & it was nearly packed (lunch time).  Our waitress seemed rushed and didn't let me finish ordering my food, still polite though.  This didn't matter once the food came.  My husband and I were VERY impressed at the quality of Zen's curry.  Best in town. Hands down, no argument.  

Unlike other curry places in town, like Kaba Curry:  They serve my favorite, deep fried oysters.  The tables have condiments for you to personalize your curry with, like raisins, almonds, katsu sauce, hot spice shaker, rakkyo, and especially fukujinsuke (pickled radish).  The way a Japanese curry restaurant should be.  The menu is simple, but you can play it up however you like.  Zen doesn't need a fancy menu to have superior food or fancy decor, unlike other curry places.  The owner himself is very nice and seems to always be hard at work in the back.

We plan on coming here from now on for our curry craving & plan on bringing more friends along on too!  Love it!

I love curry zen! So simple, yet so good. I come to dine in a few times but I order out quite a bit. When my siblings and I are trying to decide what to eat that day,  at least one of any of the four of us will suggest curry zen! 

The dining space is small and casual but you'll see groups of friends hanging out, couples on a small date,  or business men having dinner with their colleagues. Both tourists and locals. Maybe all at the same time! The servers will work hard for you regardless of how busy it will get. Nice and polite wait staff! 

The food overall is amazing. Each time I dine in, I might get a different side.  My usual plate consists is chicken katsu choosing spice level 1-4,  depending on what I feel like having. The sides I have tried so far are takoyaki, curry pan, and spinach. All delicious,  but I gotta say my fave is the spinach.

Service 10/10. Took hour seats very quickly and the food served minutes from ordering. Me and my party all order their curry chicken katsu, some takoyaki. "Crispy/crunchy katsu". Tried the level 9 spicy curry but it felt more of a 2-3 but it's okay, spicy game weak anyways. Definitely will return to try the other stuff on the menu.

Although the menu is very basic, I think this newly opened Japanese curry place will do quite well.  There are only 3 tables in this restaurant, but they also have bar seating, where you sit facing the cooks while they are preparing the food.  I counted a total of 18 seats in this restaurant.  But for such a small restaurant, they had quite a few people working there.  I believe there were a total of 8 people including the owner.  Luckily this place wasn't very busy when I arrived for lunch, so I was able to sit at a table.  The service was very good, which is typical of Japanese restaurants.  I ordered their pork cutlet curry on rice and a side order of chicken katsu. Their curry sauce is quite good, but I would have preferred a little bit more curry sauce.  I also tried their curry pan and it was delicious.  This deep fried panko bun with curry inside would have been perfect had it been a little bit warmer.  It was very tasty and the texture of the bun was excellent.   For a quick Japanese curry fix, give this place a try.

This is the go-to curry spot for my friends and I when we visit Las Vegas. I usually order chicken Katsu curry with a spice level of 5 or 6, depending on my mood. When I am very hungy, I add an extra piece of pork cutlet so that I have more meat. The cutlet and katsu are never over breaded, which is great. The curry is filled with so much flavor, while maintaining a good spice level.

I remember coming in the first time, the place was so small but oh boy did the food live up to the expectations . Now they have expanded I love coming through to get my curry fix . My boyfriend is fan and always enjoy good meal here. Definitely recommend to anyone who's looking for some Japanese curry for an actual decent price ! Also the proportions are pretty amazing if you're down to eat a whole plate (:

Sadly, I have to update my Curry Zen review. On our last visit, we were treated really poorly by the staff and it really soured me on the restaurant overall.

We arrived in the evening when they were pretty busy but there were two empty seats at the counter. The waiter who sat us asked US if anyone was before us in line for a table- um, how should we know? There were two guys hanging around outside but they could have been waiting for take-out or something else, and it's not my job to keep track of your customers for you. Also I just got here?

So anyway, he sat us and took our drink order... and then suddenly remembered that there WERE other customers in line for a table and made us get up and leave. I was completely appalled at how unprofessional and absurd this behavior was. We were seated and had our order taken! He kind of acted like we did this on purpose, too, like we were trying to sneak ahead of the other customers. It was just gross.

Even if I still lived in the area, I would never eat at Curry Zen again. One bonus star for being yummy and introducing me to Japanese curry, which I've since enjoyed at several other restaurants.

Wow...definitely one of the best curry I've ever had!  We stumbled upon this place while trying to find some food before getting some Kung Fu tea, and we're glad we did!  The staff is super friendly and quick with our drinks and food order.  We had the tonkatsu curry, and the curry sauce was absolutely delicious.  I had craving for curry after returning to LA, but have yet to find a place that taste nearly as good.  I can't wait to go again next time I'm in Vegas!
HUGE portions, but huge with mediocre curry. Much saltier and greasier than expected. I wish the curry had more depth to it. It really tasted like a bulk of store-bought curry blocks.

We came here as we wanted a change of atmosphere from all the restaurants on The Strip. I had two other people in my group and between us we tried the chicken katsu curry, pork katsu curry, Japanese meatloaf curry, and the curry udon. The curry was basic, but cooked well. The sauce was flavorful and the katsu was piping hot! 

As good as the curry rice dishes were, the curry udon unanimously was our favorite. Broth and noodles were on point! 

You can pick the spicy level on all of the curry dishes. I don't normally do too spicy, just a mild kick and level 3 was perfect for me. The waitress said most people go with a 5 or 6, but it goes all the way to 10!

Good pork katsu that was lightly breaded and pounded thin. The curry had plenty of depth and quite a bit of heat for a level 2. The rice was a good compliment to balance things out. Needing some sweetness after the heat, I ordered their mango cheesecake after finding out the green tea cheesecake was all out. The cheesecake was somewhat dry, lacking the creaminess of better versions. Japanese restaurants aren't typically known for their desserts, so I'd pass next time but would recommend the katsu, especially if you enjoy a bit of spiciness to your curry.

Decided to go here for lunch because it has been a while since I've had Japanese curry and I was really craving for some! 

I ordered the chicken katsu curry and the curry pan. The chicken katsu was crispy and they used the white meat portion which was pretty good. I didn't have to worry about the meat being too dry since I had the curry for moisture. The curry itself was just okay. There wasn't much of a strong flavor to it compared to places like Curry House and Coco Ichibanya. It was pretty hard to taste the spices in there, but at least it didn't look watery lol. The curry pan has a nice crispy shell and the inside was a thick curry paste which more flavor than the curry from my other dish. The only critique was that it was given to me lukewarm and not warm and toasty which makes me think if they just reheated it or used a microwave or something. I didn't request for them to reheat it because it was still edible and I generally don't like to cause problems for the staff unless it was something major. 

Either way if you are in the area feel free to check this place out. It isn't the greatest, especially if you've been to other curry dishes from other restaurants, but it does fulfill the curry cravings. Be sure to ask for the red pickles because they sometimes forget to give it to you along with your dishes. They also give you onions here which is pretty neat. They aren't strongly flavored so you don't have to worry about it overpowering your dish. Parking in this small plaza can be a hassle during lunch or dinner so take that into consideration!

Pricey, but completely worth it once in a while. What is pricey, you ask? $9 a plate that leaves me still hungry is pricey. If u want a 2-item plate, will be about $14. Like I said though, very worth it once in a while. I hate curry, but this place's curry is so good, that I will definitely come back again!

Love, love, love. This is my favorite place to eat at in Las Vegas, not only because of my almost unhealthy obsession with Japanese curry and the conveniently central location in Chinatown, but also because of the people who work here. The servers are unbelievably courteous, efficient, and always have a smile on their face. Every customer is greeted with an enthusiastic "Welcome!" and is seated almost immediately. The servers are also quick to let customers know if the wait time for a specific dish is projected to be longer than usual, so there are never any unpleasant surprises regarding that. 

Although the menu isn't extensive, people who'd rather not have curry do have some other options, such as Takoyaki, Gyoza, and rice bowls, which are all pretty good. The food is prepared fast and timed just right, so orders for the same table come out at around the same time. It's definitely a perk when I go out with friends to eat and talk.

The portions are big considering the low price - just perfect for hungry broke college students. There is not all that much meat on the Beef Curry, but I usually get the Grilled Chicken Curry, which has a good meat-to-rice ratio and tastes fabulous. I come here at least once every month, and I have never had a bad experience. A day that involves Curry Zen is always a good day.

At first my friend told me that it's not that good and it's expensive to eat here and today I went to there and tried it by myself! They have really really good customer service!! They alway smile : ) it really make me feel good to eat here! I definitely will come to here again!

I went last wed after I got off of work.  The place was very quiet and clean.  The server was extremely nice and the cooks were super awesome.  I took my food to go.  They were very fast and they have a great selection of toppings and the curry has a great flavor which is absolutely perfect.  This is the curry place that I will go for my curry fix.  By far the best curry place in vegas.

Decent.  But I do like Tonkotsu Kiyoshi better.

I got the pork katsu curry and my husband got the chicken katsu curry.  Both our protein was dry.  The curry was good, but the rice was a tad dry for me.  Again, I compared this pork katsu durry to Tonkotsu's and both times, I prefer Tonkotsu Kiyoshi.

Service was great, but not enough for me to return if I can get to Tonkotsu.  Also, there are toppings that one can add to the curry.  My husband tried the raisins and almonds.  He liked neither, but it's cool that they offer it.

After visiting Okinawa, I developed an addiction to Coco Curry. This place is THE closest I've come to finding a CoCo's replacement. It still doesn't match up but you really can't get better in the states. The prices are reasonable and the service is good (not THE best, but good). 5 stars just because this is the best Japanese curry I've found out here so far.

Service is 100% 10/10 amazing and SO FAST. If you're hungry, this place is affordable, filling, and speedy!. I went here about 3 times this week alone so that should definitely speak for itself! (Currently writing this as I'm craving it at 12:30am :-) I love this place so much. Favorite place for consistent amazing fast kind service and YUMMY FOOD ALWAYS!!!

Oh btw, THEIR THAI TEA IS THE BEST!!!!

Basic Japanese curry place. Place was clean and the food was pretty good. I had their beef curry it had like 6 cubes of beef. Felt like the curry needed a little more texture. I'm used to Korean and Thai curry with lots of stuff inside it, but overall it was good!

the service is really sucks?the waitress let us waiting there for more than 20 mins and they have tables for us. I ask her why u have tables for two and u don't let us to sit .. she said because there are a group of 6 people they r before us.. so they have 3 tables for 2 .. just empty, and she said if u r important u can sit ...I don't know why this kind of people can be a waitress ?

The best curry I've ever had! The place is small but this is a great thing cause the staff is so friendly that you feel like your eating at their dinner table. I had the chicken katsu and it was breaded just right not to mention it was super moist! I loved being able to spice up my meal with all the condiments options... not that it needed it but the option was great!

Japanese curry is different from your typical Thai curry. Don't expect it to be spicy, but expect your curry to be hot and fresh from this tiny restaurant. I always order the chicken cutlet. I like it because the chicken always has a clean feeling to it compared to pork. They use white meat too! The sauce is thick and flavorful, and it's a great cure for a hangover. This restaurant is reasonably priced because the food has good quality. The rice is not cheap and mushy. I love it. Their staff here is always friendly and humble. They seem to enjoy what they do. I love seeing happy workers. I have big hopes for this restaurant, and so far they've been really consistent. I am a regular. Lastly they have free wifi.

If you're in Vegas, you have to go off the strip to this little curry place. There is a bit of a wait, but I promise you that it is worth it. We always drop by when we're in Vegas. The curry is phenomenol with just the right starch taste and spices. It also helps that the servings are on the larger end. I always get the chicken katsu curry with a spice level of 4 and leave satisfied.

CruZEN down the street in my 6 4....Nah, Just playin'......(Watchu know 'bout NWA???)

But for reals, we were cruZEN Spring Mountain because a bunch of us were hella joneZEN for some ramen action at Koraku since it had just recently opened. We were all anxious and excited, but that night, it just waZENt gonna happen....They were closed. NOOOOOOO!!!!! We had to think of a plan B yet again.

I was thinking..."This iZENt happening...again!?!? Where do we go??? Sora? Big Wong? Raku? Monta? Then it hit me.....how about ZEN???? Yeah! J-Curry sounded like a great  plan B!!!

We were all in agreement and met up there...Now its usually always packed inside with less then a few doZEN tables, but when we peeked inside, I thought I was loZEN my mind....Not a single person inside!?!?! Great for us! We were greeted by who I assume was Mr. ZENbayashi and immediately got seated towards the back. To make sure we didn't miss out on any items, I made sure to ask our waiter right off the bat if they had some Curry Udon off the menu, and he later confirmed that it waZENt available. 

I kept it simple this time and went with the Chicken Katsu Curry and  added cheese and corn. Combined with the complimentary toppings on the table, this made for another amaZEN meal with great friends. If you're looking for a spot to bring your parents, siblings or couZENs and they're in the mood for some currylicious action, look no further than ZEN.....The PERFECT reaZEN!!!   ALOHA!!!
Hands down the best Japanese curry place in town and their portions are just right. Food is consistently good and very authentic. The staff is attentive and polite as well!

Waiting for a spot at either Hwaro or Monta at peak lunch time on a weekend wasn't going to happen, so we found ourselves here, which we have also been meaning to check out. There was also a waiting list, but it was much more manageable and they seated us under 15 or so minutes. All of us got curry udon as it was highly recommended on their blackboard. It came out piping hot, and we could immediately tell the focus was on the curry broth, which was thick and full of flavor. The noodle also had the perfect texture and was able to absorb the aromas of the broth. The toppings of scallion and meat pieces were rather minimal, but that was understandable as the curry itself was already rich enough. While the bowl looked small, it actually had more depth than it appeared, and the broth helped fill us up on a surprisingly small budget.

Japanese Curry Zen is a decent place to check out if you're looking for Japanese style curry rice.

The Food (3 out of 5): 
Okay, I've been here a couple of times now, and both times I have had the Tonkatsu (pork) curry rice which is good and tasty. Now, curry rice is a staple in most Japanese households, and I am really used to not only having the white rice with pork cutlet & curry sauce over it, but also with other vegetables in the curry sauce as well (i.e. potatoes, carrots and sometimes celery). So, I was disappointed by the fact that you could not add any of these kinds of additional veggies. Also, they really should offer Tabasco sauce in the restaurant as well as another kind of ginger (their ginger is kind of sweet). 

The Service (3 out of 5): 
Service has been good here but not great. On the last time here we had to wait a little bit to get refills on our waters and to get more ginger. Yes, they were busy at the time, but then again, it's not like you can pack a lot of people in the restaurant. I didn't like the fact that our table for 2 was really close to the table for 4 next to us, it was kind of like we were there with that other party. 

OVERALL:
If you have a hankering for Japanese curry (or if you don't want to wait too long at Monta a few doors down), then this is a decent place to go. However, I do think that I can cook a much better curry rice myself though!

Curry Zen is the newest Japanese restaurant addition to Seoul Plaza, but makes me wonder when its going to be changed to Reikon Plaza? You know Reikon meaning soul or spirit in Japanese... ah nevermind, terrible joke. 

I have visited a few times now since they've opened and noticed each time the curry increases in spice slightly as well as the amount of condiments on the counter. Now they have raisins, sliced almonds, 3 different mixed spices (mild, medium, and hot of course), fukujinzuke (mixed pickled vegetables), and pickled scallions. 

The menu is small ranging from chicken katsu, pork katsu, kurobata sausages, potato croquette, shrimp, a curry hot dog, and a couple of jello desserts Maybe its not their style, but if somewhere down the line they decide to add vegetables as toppings I would be all for it!

The best things about Curry Zen is the portions are good versus price (yay for college budgets), FREE brown rice option (paging brown rice warlord Misti Y), service is friendly, and I suppose that its an option for my vegetation eating friends as you can opt for the curry and a croquette. 

Lastly the only con I can think of now is... where am I going to park? With  all these thriving businesses in this plaza it makes parking a chore. 

A side note of the most nanoscopic size possible, I did see someone wheel in a few boxes with labels saying Java Curry. I'm not suggesting that it is not homemade, but I do wonder if they use their roux some parts of their curry? Just some thoughts from a noobs. 

100th, yippee.

UPDATED REVIEW: I've been coming to Zen Curry ever since it opened and i'm still so impressed every single time i go. The only changed i've noticed is that they serve a bit less food than before but rather than that i still give this place 10/10! I never go to any other places for Japanese curry, ONLY here! It's such comforting soul food and i'm OBSESSED!! I'm constantly craving zen curry and i could eat here for a week straight which i did before lol. This is located down spring mountain in a really jammed packed location because of other popular restaurants and desert cafes so parking is a butt, but it's so worth it when you taste the curry!! You get a big plate and basically you build your own curry! What so love about this place is that they have healthy options if you're a vegetarian or watching what you eat! What I love to get here is the Chicken Katsu (so delicious and juicy) with level 3 spice and the 5 piece Kushi (quail eggs, chicken, mushroom, shrimp, and zucchini?) or i get it with cheese and corn with just the chicken katsu & curry! Remember to get the red radish as well (i can't eat it w.o this). These dishes here has so many different kind things you can add on, the spam and croquette is delicious as well. My mouth is watering just typing this and I can't wait to be back. 

The service here is AMAZING ALL THE TIME! Their staffs are super knowledgeable about their menu and are so kind. There's this one employee guy that's so so sweet (i didn't catch his name) but we left him a $20 tip and he literally went out of the restaurant to look for us and kept bowing his head saying he can't accept such a big tip and we said he deserved it, like this made me so teary and melt my heart because he's so genuine and kind. Thank you zen curry for excellent services and staffs!

Overall, I don't have any complaints but the fact that it's super tiny and the wait time is long sometimes but i mean that's what you get for having such an amazing restaurant and good quality food!!

I am very glad that we finally have a curry house in Vegas. I quickly became a regular here as soon as I discovered this spot. My favorite dishes are pork cutlet, fried shrimp and hot dog curry. You can chose white rice or brown rice to go with it. I love the crispy textures of breading of pork cutlet and fried shrimps. Pork cutlet is always juicy and never overdone. I feel fortune that they even have Japanese hot dogs on menu. This small shop is very clean and opens late. Service here is fast and efficient. It can definitely be a quick eat spot if you are in a rush.

Food 5/5 
Their curry is well flavored, I typically get a level 3 or spice and am satisfied with just the right amount of heat every time. They offer grilled chicken as a protein which is a healthy alternative compared to the Katsu which is my typical go to. I also love their potato croquettes and vegetables as options. You can Order a regular or small size portion but I don't think they are very different in portion size. They are a favorite when the craving hits. 

Mom Rating 4/5 

While they do offer high chairs many of the restaurants on Spring mountain are smaller and not as equipped for young children. Curry Zen is no different they also do not have a changing table in their bathroom which is a bit of an inconvenience.

The best curry I've ever tasted! 

1) The rice to protein ratio was perfect. We had just enough curry for every bite.  

2) Spicy levels have a meaning here! I love spicy and even with level 5 every bite had a nice kick to it. 

3) A little on the pricey side. Especially if you do add-ons, which we definitely did. 

4) Wait staff is attentive and food comes out in a timely manner. 
 
5) I can't wait to back to vegas and try it again.

I have been looking for good Japanese Curry for quite a few years. Curry Zen is exactly as I remember it. First the curry is delicious, and you can order traditional curry alone, or throw in some chicken, fried tofu, or even quail egg skewers on the dish. You can choose white, brown, or a multi-grain rice options along with the curry. They even have curry pan, which I look forward to giving a try next time I stop in. The restaurant was just recently remodeled, which has given it some more moving space, as the seating was a bit tight before. The folks who run it are very nice, and the service is good. This place fills my Japanese Curry urges hands down!
absolutely amazing. i would definitely come back here again. i got the chicken cutlet curry. it was such an amazing time. also done forget to try the edamame.

If you're looking to try some Japanese curry, this is definitely the place. You choose your item and they're going to ask you how spicy on a scale of 1 - 10. I usually get a 1 just because it already gets spicy after a couple bites. I also order their tako yaki which is to die for if you love tako. Also when we eat the curry, don't forget to ask for the red pickles, it somewhat toned down the spiciness. Great customer service as well.

I ate here a week ago and can't wait to go back.  It is Japanese comfort food to me.  The restuarant is simple and to the point.  Every dish is served with rice, curry and a protein.  Most of the proteins are fried.  My favorite was the shrimp but also had the sausage and the chicken and liked them all.  I added the vegatables to my plate because I was looking for a little nutrition.   I wouldn't get the vegatables again as they were of the most boring, bland (possibly frozen from a bag) variety that could be found.  Very friendly service.

One of the best curries I've been too.  Then to top it off they let you customize the plates for cheap prices. Chicken cutlet side for $3? Impossible anyplace else but not here. Do yourself a favor and try this place out and judge it for yourself. 

What I ordered:
Curry udon with chicken cutlet side
Deep fried shumai
Gyoza

I started this account just to write this review.

I love Curry and have eaten many curry dishes even lived in Honolulu, Hawaii where CoCos was on top of my list, but compare to the service and taste.  I got a new favorite Curry House. Also I can't stopped thinking about this curry, considering it was my first time trying Japanese Curry Zen, 3 days ago. yes 3 days of thinking about it every time eat my home cooked meals(and I love what i make at home)

So I went with my roommate Elizabeth L. (check out her review 5/13/13) to eat @ Monta Ramen(which was close by and is also pretty good) and after that we went to Japanese Curry Zen to order "To Go" for dinner because we were working that night and had no time to cook but once we got home we wanted to have a little nibble just to try and ended up eating it all. even though we were full from Monta Ramen. The staff and cooks are so nice and smiley. 

I guess you can say this isn't really a review but a praise and declaration that i will be going back there for more. =)

Tried the Curry with pork cutlets and Curry Pan and Croquettes, I love my curry spicy and the sweet Miss who gave us our order packed lots of chili powder for me togo when I asked.

Curry Zen is the jam!!  Best curry in the valley, by far.  Reminds me of the curry from home (Hawaii) and it definitely hits the spot when I'm jonesin'.  The place itself is a little small so it can get crowded in there.  However, sitting at the bar, I still have enough shoulder space to feel comfortable so that's usually my sitting spot.  I also love the pickled onion garnish and make sure to capitalize when I'm there.  The brown rice option is also a nice touch.  Definitely a good spot to get some quick curry grub and leave happy.  Next time, I'm going for the Curry Udon!!

HATE  Nothing.

DISLIKE  Nothing.

LIKE  The spinach curry. The chicken cutlet. The sides offered. The pleasant service. The close proximity to other local favorite spots.

LOVE  Nothing.

Every time I never know what to eat, I always end up going to Curry Zen. I like how the price for this place is cheap and the portions are really big. The service is amazing - all of the servers are nice and quick! I always get the chicken katsu curry with cheese and beef, and it's so good!!! Water is good too lol, I know a lot of places' water is gross

Good stuff. The price is very cheap! You can get a full bowl or a half bowl. Since I eat like a bird I opt for the half with chicken and crouquette. That was certainly enough to fill me up. The curry flavor was so full of flavor. I didn't add extra spice to it, and thankfully the curry wasn't spicy in the mouth at all. However, you can very well taste the herbs and spice in it. The croquette is certainly a recommendation. It has potato with vegetables inside, and it's fried.  Super yum. It has that nice outter crunch on the outside and a nice soft potato inside. I got to talk to the chef for a bit who was really friendly and helpful. He also recommended that I try mixing raisins and almonds in my rice. Apparently it's good for the digestive system. It's pretty good! However, I recommend you mix it with white rice. It doesn't taste as good with brown rice. The chicken was also very tender. 

I'll definitely be back soon when I need to tend on my curry fix again!

The curry here is amazing.  I've gone to many different places for Japanese curry and this is at the top of the mountain.  The curry is always flavorful and not watery.  The katsu is always fresh and crisp.  They take pride in what they serve.  My friends from LA always want to go here.  Definite, two thumbs up!

The Curry Udon is absolutely amazing.  The item is listed on the menu board as a "must try" and they are not joking.  I also got the Chicken kushi Teri, also delicious.  I am so glad they have the liquor license because draft beer is a must when I'm having delicious curry.  
The place packed up fast too so be prepared to wait for a table.

Very good authentic japanese curry.  Don't expect Indian or thai curry here. Japanese curry is very thick and full of flavors.  Also can be very spicy. Good eats over all and service was very good. Friendly staff here. Oh price is very affordable.

The service and good here was very good.    The place is kind of  small but it gives me  the impression of how I would imagine a curry house in Japan to be.

I ordered the chicken cutlet curry dish.  The curry sauce and the chicken cutlet went very well together.  The curry sauce had lots of flavor and a hint of spicy.  The chicken cutlet was cooked perfect.   It very juicy, crispy, and flavorful. 

The service was great.  The server was very attentive and checked on us a few times.  Even the chef asked us how everything was.

Definitely my favorite local Japanese curry place to eat yet!  Check it out!

The best curry spot in Las Vegas. I always come here every time I visit. Absolutely delicious and filling food. My usual is the pork katsu because of the pork being tender and juicy. The chicken is good too but pork wins. I love it here!

Their curry is SO delicious. I love the spinach curry with tofu katsu. Great place for both meat eaters and vegetarians/vegans. The staff is super friendly and are always energetic and fun whenever I go in there (which is usually once a week). One of my favorite places in town

Definitely one of my favorite places to eat! Their pork katsu is incredible as well as their chicken. I go here all the time either on dates or with groups of friends. The place is pretty small but you never feel crammed and I've never had to wait more than a couple of minutes even when I've come with fairly large groups. I'm never not in the mood for their curry! 
My one critique would be that the parking lot is always full and a bit difficult to navigate since it's really small. The food makes you forget about the headache of the parking lot though

This place is great! 
I love Japanese style curry... chicken katsu curry! Simple flavorful dish. Service here is friendly and on point.

I had the chicken katsu curry. No spice level added. I also had gyozas and eddemame. 
Everything was good.
Prices are fair. If you only get rice and curry, I believe is $5. The chiken katsu is around $7/8. Portion is large. 

This place is awesome, worth trying. 
Yum!!! :-) :-) :-)

Fantastic!

I like ordering different things from their menu, and so far they're all good. My favorite is the vegetable curry plate with a side of sausages. I also enjoy trying the different spice levels.

The chef is a really nice guy! He takes time to ask people how they're doing. The same goes for the rest of the staff.

Simple, straight forward review:

THIS PLACE SERVES REALLY EXCELLENT CURRY WITH HUGE PORTIONS!

If I remember correctly, I got the pork katsu curry and shared some takoyaki with my fiancé. We were both VERY HAPPY WITH FULL BELLIES after our meal.

I'll definitely return.

Went here on a Sunday night for dinner. Upon arrival the inside is reminiscent of Monta. Small not many tables and a counter you can sit at. The menu contains sausage, pork, chicken, shrimp. Most of it is breaded and fried but they also have just grilled chicken and pork. Also the plates come with curry, obviously and rice.

The food tastes amazing the curry flavor is really strong and tasteful. The sausages were my favorite and the fried shrimp.  The price is also a good plus for 2 people it only cost us $25. I would definitely return here.

This place introduced Japanese curry to me, and I've loved it ever since! I used to come here often but stopped, and I stopped by last night and remembered why I loved coming here! This place gets packed, especially at night.

The curry is full of flavor! My personal favorite is the tofu katsu! Honestly, if you told me this was chicken katsu, I'd believe it. I also love getting the veggie curry. Nice add-ons include spinach or cheese (Additional charge)! You can also adjust the spicy level, which ranges from 1-10 (Additional charge). I would prefer getting a MINI plate. It's just enough to fill you up, and it is cheaper.
And if you're not a fan of curry, the Katsu-Don would be my go-to!

Quality of the food and taste was good only thing that was a little off was the portioning
I got the Kushi plate and for $12 plate it was very small 
Other than that the taste is good

Good meals for a good price. Service is good minus a couple errors I had. Atmosphere is small and can get loud easily. Seating is limited in a small area.

The curry is good, but I usually get a level 1 dish. The spicy levels seems like they differ. Sometimes a level 1 will feel like level 1, but sometimes feels like level 3 or 4. Portions are filling as well.

Service is good, minus a couple bad experiences. One time I asked for a croquette as a side like always (I never had japanese curry without a croquette. EVER.) And the waiter asked "croquette? Coke?" I replied "no, croquette" and pointed at the croquette on the menu we then extended the whole croquette/ coke thing for 30 seconds more and reached an agreement of croquette. He then came back with a coke. I sent it back and got my croquette. Another time some waiter was being extremely cool and hip with it. He got my order wrong a few times, but im sure he was just having an unlucky time with me since the other people there didnt have any problems it seemed.

Environment is puny and if its full, youre probably gonna have to wait outside until one is available. It also gets loud easily with such dense seating.

Pros: good place to grab curry, carry (or curry lmao im killin myself here) out is available, nice portions.

Cons: seating is limited, gets loud easily, and inconsistent spicy levels

Advice: if seating is limited, you can get carry out. Top this place off with Kung Fu Tea, its perfect. Get croquettes as a side.

I Have moved from Hawaii where I have eaten Curry House almost every single day and had been looking for a replacement for the longest time. I finally found the most delicious curry from Japanese Curry Zen. My first sitting here was with my husband and my friend Jahi. It was his birthday and we wanted to try a new place in town. The service was amazing and the waiters were very nice. We ordered our food and it came out pretty fast. The waiters are always asking if we need anything or how they can help.
The best curry around! I always eat here when I'm home. The service is great and the food is consistently delicious. I recommend the curry pan and pork katsu curry.

Was looking for a late dinner place in Vegas.  I didn't want to do the typical Vegas Strip restaurant and wanted somewhere off-strip.

My group saw this plaza nearby and decided to check it out.  Checking Yelp, Japanese Curry Zen had very high ratings (highest in the plaza) so it must be good and decided to check it out.

When I first went in, a larger group was eating inside and noticed the only seating spots available were at the counter.  I was greeted with the "irashaimasae!" (welcome in Japanese) and was very pleasant to hear.

I ordered the tender pork katsu with a spice rating of 3 which was medium spice.  My wife ordered 5 and it was a little on the spicy side.  Generally if you are novices to curry, I would recommend a 2.

The tender pork was indeed tender and cooked very well.  The curry had a thickness to it and wasn't watered down like some places... it had a good spice kick to it and hands down was one of the best curry I ever had.

Their prices were reasonable and the owner is very friendly and was very humble.

He did mention that they are expanding the restaurant to the now vacant spot next door, so come January/February they will have more seating capacity.

If you are in need of some awesome Japanese curry or something different than the average Vegas Strip restaurant, check this place out!

Where do I start? Fujinsuke. Awesomely red and tasty. It goes with curry like...well like...did I already use the word Awesomely? So that.  

Katsu was perfectly cooked and the curry tasted great. To top it all off was some extremely tasty Takoyaki.  Great taste. Good amount of octopus and reasonably priced. I will gladly detour here anytime I can.

Great way to close an evening.

My wife and I lived in Okinawa Japan from 2003-2006 while stationed at Kadena AB. We fell in love with a fast food Japanese Curry place known as CoCo's. Anyone who's been to Okinawa or even mainland Japan knows about this place! When we moved to Las Vegas, we were super happy to discover Japanese Curry Zen!! It's amazing curry. Such a great comfort food. 

We eat here quite often and constantly recommend it to our friends and coworkers. If you like spicy foods and curry, you must try this place out! I normally go for the chicken cutlet level 2 spice. It's perfect and you can always turn up the heat with the extra spices they have on the tables if need be.

We've tried Kaba Curry in town as well, but prefer Curry Zen. The prices are reasonable also. They've recently expanded the restaurant which allows much more seating then before. I've had to wait outside before they added the extra seating, but now we get a table almost every time. 

They also have great iced thai tea! Check em out!!!!!!

I got the Tonkatsu with added corn and cheese and my mom had the curry udon.

the curry udon was savory, had a good amount of beef slices and scallions, and the curry sauce was liquidy enough for noodle soup.

the cheese looks a bit weird on the curry, but it was so clutch. definitely recommend and I won't eat my curry any other way now.
Yummmmmmy! So many options to customize your curry, however 9 times out of 10 I will order spam katsu as my topping. Love it!

First time here, stumble across this place because manta was too busy next door.  Every dish we had was delicious especially the chicken katsu with spinach and scrambled eggs was balanced with spices and consistent throughout. The service is great and very knowledgeable.

We come here every once in awhile when we need our curry fix. Spice level IS spicy so fair warning. The parking isn't the best, but it's sure worth it. We're from Hawaii so the spam katsu is yuummm! Fried oysters is a must try as well!
The best curry in Vegas. Their food is always delicious and fresh and it's at a great price.

I have been looking for some good brown curry for like 8 years in the Vegas area. Based on reviews, I made sure that during some business one day in vegas I made the time to stop in for lunch. No disappointments here. This place is awesome. The only complaint is it is tiny! So you gotta eat and run so the folks hanging outside the front door can get some great food also!
I am a fan of the beef curry and potato croquets. I ordered a side of curry cause I like the rice and beef swimming in it! 
They keep it simple and I think this has helped them become successful. Not all curry is created equal.....

If you love curry, you need to go here! I love Japanese curry. This place makes the best curry in my opinion! You can also range your spicy level from mild to hot or hotter! The curry is offered with rice and Katsu. I always get the chicken Katsu and spam katsu. -try it when you go there. They also serve alcohol. But it's pretty pricey just for a small bottle. The wait time to be seated is always immediate or a little while because it's popular. Even the time for your food to come out is generally quick. This place also does take out if you!just want to eat it somewhere else.

Since I grew up in San Francisco I was used to having my Japanese curry taste a certain way. I have tried many curry places around town and they have all let me down. Until I came here, I have not looked back. 

Their curry flavor is almost like the curry places from back home. It is filling and hearty. The food is delicious and they have different items to chose from. It is also affordable. The servers are always friendly and quick to say hi. Since the restaurant is small, they sometimes get busy. The wait can be a long time. Overall this place is amazing.

I was spoiled with amazing curry when I went to Japan over the summer. After a few friends and I agreed to try this restaurant out, I was really excited!

I got there a little early compared to the rest of my group, however, because the restaurant itself is pretty small, the whole group needs to be present in order to get seated...so make sure to scold the friends that are always late to be on time! Lol The interior smelled amazing and the decor was simple, reminiscent of the restaurants I visited in Japan. 

I ordered the vegetable curry, spice level 7, and added chicken katsu. As a big fan of spice, I'll vouch that you'll get the level you asked for! It has always annoyed me when you're expecting a certain spice level and it's either either too spicy or not spicy enough. If you want to stay on the cautious side and order low, you can always add some extra chili flakes they have on the table. The curry itself was delicious and very flavorful. The veggies were cooked tender enough to cut with just your spoon. Although the chicken katsu was small, it was yummy and all white meat! I also ordered the takoyaki and I was happily surprised. The outside was crispy and the inside still tender but not undercooked, with large pieces of octopus. 

The waitress came by frequently to refill our waters and was nice enough to ask if we needed our checks split. I was very happy with my experience at this place and I will definitely be bringing my boyfriend here to check it out.

I LOVE this place!! I could eat here everyday if i want to and not get bored of it!! The usual that i always get is the egg and spinach with chicken katsu and fried tofu on the side with spicy level 8! Yummy!!!! And i would have to also say they have the best takoyaki here in las vegas:)

I love, love, love this place! Since the first check in just over a month ago, I can't get enough of it. Everything that I love about a restaurant is here and aligns perfectly like a balance of the universe. I swear, the stars align when I visit this place!

- I love how the place is so small and cozy; the capacity is only 18 people. 
- The prices are very affordable with the base price starting at $4.95.
- The menu is simple and easy to breeze through
- You can customize your curry: toppings? spiciness? brown rice? They got it!
- The food is delicious, fresh and doesn't weigh a person down. It's pretty healthy too, so that feeling of "I ate pretty good," resonates through my head instead of, " I can't believe I ate _that_. I think I'll go hibernate now."

Finally, the owner and his staff are some of the nicest most appreciative people that I have met. I have been here 4 times now and the gentleman behind the counter (I believe he's the owner) always takes the time to greet guests entering the restaurant as well as thanking them as they exit. If you're up at the bar eating, he'll most likely ask you personally how everything was. The rest of the staff are warm and attentive too. This really hits it home for me because it shows that the owner really cares about his restaurant and the customers.

Curry Zen gets 5 stars from me because I honestly can't get enough of it. Whether it's the next day, whether I'm on the other side of town, or whether it's four in the morning, it always sounds good. My boyfriend is also a big fan and jokes that they must put crack in it ;)

So if the line at Monta is a little long, try swinging by this little gem and giving it a go. You might find your Zen here ^_^

You can find me here at least five times a week and two days are to go orders! Got the whole family addicted and make family try it when they out in vegas. For a tiny girl who doesn't eat much I finish the plate! That's how amazing it is! The staff is great and fast. Clean restaurant which makes it a better place. We always challenge how spicy we can eat which makes it fun. Chicken, pork, and shrimp curry are all tasty! And the cold beer just hit the spot!
The taste was good but the amount of meat was so little. I literally counted 6 small pieces.

OHHH YESS. Give me ALL of the curry. This place has our hearts and is one of our fall-back restauraunts anytime we need some delicious food and wouldn't mind a bit of heat. We have come 3 or 4 times and have had a great experience each time. 

Beware, their curry truly is HOT. I can only tolerate a 3-4 out of 10 and I'm no wimp. The heat builds the more that you eat so that by the end of the dish, you have to take a few gulps of water after every bite. The pickled vegetables on the side help with the heat, as does added cheese and corn, but nothing will help you if you order a level 10 heat. Nothing... Your insides will be your outsides and I pity the fool that plays like that!

Anyway, if you're a pro with hot curries, I would go with a level 6 or 7 and work from there. They have shakers on the side with curry powder and chile powder to add. 

I personally recommend their croquette as it is so fluffy and crispy and delightful, no regrets. If you are a vegetarian or avoid meat, their tofu katsu is perfectly crisp and tastes great with the dark sauce in the squeeze bottles at the table. 

I always get the 16 grain curry because I really love the varying texture of the rice. My boyfriend is a fan of the plain white rice with his curry. He normally gets the pork katsu but has tried the Japanese meatloaf before. He wasn't the hugest fan of it but he did like it, just not as much as the pork! ^_^

Overall, you could go to Curry Zen every day of the week and try something new, with amazing service each time to boot! This is definitely one of my favorite places for food on Spring Mountain and I think anyone that likes curry will love Curry Zen :D
This place is awesome! Great food and service! It's a little far away from me but it's worth the drive.

Woo-hoo! Best curry in Vegas! Me and my coworkers came here late one night after work and got seated right away. Got the chicken katsu curry spicy level 5 and it was perfection! It was just enough spicy for me to still enjoy the crunchy goodness of the katsu with my curry. Plus the portions were pretty hearty and all for a very affordable price. Service here was fast and attentive, even though it got busy. This place is definitely my go-to whenever I need to satisfy my curry fix.

I am definitely a fan, my friend from the Bay Area yelped this spot so he wanted to have dinner here. Immediately as we walk in we notice how small the dinning area is, probably only capable of seating 15 dinners or less. I swear I think the it was the size of my bedroom, haha! However, there were only a few other patrons since it was a Monday night. I wasn't too hungry so I ordered the croquet with corn while my friend had the chicken katsu, corn with cheese. We both enjoyed our meals very much so and particularly liked that there was a slight hint of spice in the curry. The croquet was pretty standard so I couldn't complain there. The prices are pretty cheap too, most menu meals were under $10. So if you are on a budget I definitely recommend this place. I liked my first visit so much I had been craving this place days after so I came back a week later with a different friend. We came in on a Sunday night and since this place is so small, it was packed! There was a "waiting list," but I guess those people didn't like standing outside so I think they just left. Initially she was kind of iffy about trying another Curry place since she's had the legit ones in Hawaii and she recently tried Kaba Curry's original location on Charleston and wasn't a fan. I glad she was pleasantly surprised! We had both ordered the chicken katsu with corn. Yum I must say and I also like the fact you can order brown rice which makes it feel a bit healthier. A major downer is that everything is FRIED, except the beef curry stew. The menu is definitely minimal and they should consider expanding and adding options like omelet or loco moco.

You can't go wrong with a build your own curry with toppings, rice, and spice level. 

FOOD
The dish consists of rice, curry sauce, and options for different spice levels, proteins, and toppings. Super simple yet so delicious! I always order chicken katsu, croquette, and deep fried shrimps with a level 3 sauce. They also have side dishes, including my favorites: takoyaki, karaage, fried oysters, fried gyoza, and curry udon. 

OVERALL
The price to portion size is fair, the service is quick (even though there's usually a 10-15 minute wait to be seated), and the Japanese curry sauce is very flavorful.

Ever since I moved back to Vegas, I've been on a search for some good Japanese curry. This place is definitely a winner and will now be my go to place. 

I got a small chicken katsu curry and added a croquet. In all honesty, the small was plenty enough. I do recommend adding some other stuff since a small is about 3.50, it's forsure worth it. 

My friend added some cheese, which was also pretty good.

I thought it was kind of weird that you have to pay extra to make it spicier.

The place in general is pretty small, so definitely avoid the lunch rush hours. Another plus? It's right next to snowflake shavery so don't stuff yourself too much and grab dessert after.

This place is so cute inside, it almost made me sad that we were only picking up instead of staying. The beef curry is amazing, full of flavor even with the spicy level added! The beef pieces are large and soft like pot roast without all the fatty parts (it's basically perfect). I tried the spice level "Blazer level 2" and it kicked my ass all up and down ass-kicking street. So hot. So good. So worth it. Definitely going here again whenever the curry cravings come back.

I love this place. You'll definitely feel the zen when you eat here! I lived in Japan & always wished there was a place in Las Vegas that was similar to taste & atmosphere to that of a Japanese Curry Shop & this is the place! The female waitress has top notch customer service & is very genuine and helpful! The curry menu has expanded & you can basically get traditional japanese curry to create your own type of curry! I would definitely recommend this place to any one looking for Japanese styled curry or is willing to try something new!

It's a great curry house, not to be confused with a katsu house.  Always end up being super stuffed since everything is so delicious and we over order.

Make sure you order the curry bread soon as you get your server.  NYE we went and were told a lady who just came in ordered the last 12.  Night before, we were told the table who came in after us ordered the last two orders.  Fried oysters are done right, fried shumai delish!  Gyoza spot on as well as the takoyaki.  One thing I would probably pass on is the clam chowder, it was good, but not my style of chowder.

Chicken katsu curry with corn, spice level 7 with a side of spam.  Throw in some of the red pickled veggies and almonds, and you are golden!

Oh my gosh! I have never had curry before, but a friend suggested this place. It is small inside, and it was packed when we got there on a Saturday night but the service was amazing. The waitress was very knowledgeable and friendly and answered all of my questions. The food was amazing. We ordered curry udon, fried gyoza, and pork katsu. It was all amazing.

The chicken cutlets were cooked perfectly crisp, and the curry had the right amount of texture.  I love their ginger and japanese red pickles.  It's a lot of rice for my taste but +1 for serving brown rice!    All this for under $10 bucks.   I am a big meat eater, so I ordered an additional side of sausage and I was satisfied.  I might try to replace the rice with veggies next time.  
The service was very quick and the server was very nice and attentive.

I came back here because I was craving some curry. It was a pleasant surprise to see that they had expanded the restaurant. It used to be a small hole in the wall, now it's a big hole in the wall! The layout was a bit awkward, but the whole restaurant looked nice and clean with a couple of television screens.

Now for the important part... the food. The food continues to improve each time that I come back here. The menu also keeps expanding. In this particular visit I ordered their kushi katsu 5 piece (chicken, quail egg, zucchini, shrimp, shiitake mushroom) curry plate. It was on the chalkboard where they listed their specials. It was good and I definitely will be making a return visit sooner rather the later most likely the next time I'm in the Las Vegas area.

PROS:
-This is the only place in Vegas where I get Japanese curry
-Great food & service :)

FOOD 5/5:
-Chicken Katsu Curry ($8.95 // cheese $0.50): I'm in love with their curry sauce. It compliments well with the fried chicken. At first glance it may not look super appetizing but it is! And it's not oily. I add cheese and raisins for extra flavor~
-Katsu spiciness is from 1-10. I usually have mine at 3, because 4 and up is too spicy! haha
-Takoyaki ($4.50): This is a deep fried ball filled with octopus. Super delicious!

CONS:
-I've been going to Curry Zen for a couple years now, and very recently they started to make their portions smaller :( 
-Also you have to ask for raisins and all the extra-free toppings.

+1 good curry
+1 reasonably priced food and drinks. Basic curry starts at ~$6, add $3-5 for veggie and protein, and $0.2-0.5 for spicy. 
Only 4 stars bc the husband says he can taste the sweetness/artificial ness and it's not the best curry he's had. But I loved it!

We wanted to get off the strip for some good Asian food and since husband was craving curry, we found this little gem. He got the Japanese meatball and I got pork katsu. I enjoyed it very much. Katsu was on point, curry was yummy. Spicyness was a bit too much but that's my fault for wanting 6/10. When our plates first came, the husband thought the quantity was not big BUT looks can be deceiving! The portion size is just right.

I was going to call this place a little hidden gem... but with over 170 reviews for a random curry house off the strip, I guess enough Yelpers have found their way over.  I went here with the bf's family before hitting the road home from a weekend in Vegas.  It is super tiny (luckily we got there before a second family, who had to go somewhere else due to lack of space).  I ordered the curry with tofu.  Others had pork, some with vegetables in the curry, and all with brown rice instead of white.  I love that they have that option.  The portions are HUGE!  My tofu was nice and crispy (I'm not pretending that's the healthier option, since "crispy" doesn't mean healthy, I just like tofu), and the curry was so flavorful and thick.  Everybody swept their plates clean!

Talk about surpassing expectations. While the dishes look quite plain, the flavor of the curry was simply amaZEN.

Takoyaki -- 6 deliciously crispy balls filled with firm octopus. The batter was perfectly crispy with just the right amount of tenkasu filling. There were tons of bonito shavings on top to give it that extra seafood flavor.

Pork Katsu -- Dark brown curry, mild in taste with just a hint of sweetness. They have custom spice levels 1-10 and to be safe per the waiter's suggestion, I stuck with level 5. Their pork cuts are thin and tender, with a satisfyingly thin layer of crust. 

As one who grew up with Curry House, this place blows them out of the water. Their curry is much thicker with much more depth of flavor. If you're looking for warm comfort food, keep this place in mind!

I've only had Japanese curry once in downtown Los Angeles but Zen beat that meal by a mile.  I like that they have you pick the spiciness you want.  When I ordered the chicken cutlet curry, I asked for a spice level of 7.  My server was a bit hesitant and suggested perhaps 4 and asked if I liked spicy food.  I stayed with the 7.  Next time I'll get 8.  

The servers enter your order on a tablet so the order is sent to the kitchen from your table.  I was brought a glass of water which was refilled once.  It took about 5 minutes and the curry was brought to the table.  Besides the basic curry, chicken, and rice, I added the topping of cheese and a fried egg.

Mixing the curry, cheese, and egg into the meat and the rice was my first step in enjoying this meal.  Once that was done, I took my spoon and started to enjoy the dish.  The spice level was OK.  It had a nice tang to it but it could have been spicier.  The chicken is breaded with just the right amount and cooked so that no knife is needed.  The spoon broke the chicken pieces quite nicely.

A couple of things:  this is a small restaurant so you may have a wait.  There is a sign in sheet at the door when you enter.  This plaza is filled with Asian restaurants and parking can be a pain.  Luckily, I found an empty spot.

I'll be back.  It's close to Las Vegas Little Theatre where I often go and I'll stop here for dinner again!
Great curry, fast service, and friendly staff  I love how they have the small portion of curry too so if you aren't a big eater, I recommend the smaller portion.
First time going to Curry Zen, got the tonkatsu curry and kuraage. Food was good, service was good. Will probably go again sometime in the future.

With Rice Trax closed indefinitely, my wife and I needed a place to get our curry fix. When we found Yelpers raving about this place, we thought we'd give it a shot - and we're glad we did!

The menu is very simple, because it doesn't have to be complicated. Pick a protein, pick white or brown rice, and enjoy the curry. My wife was pleased that they have tofu katsu, and I enjoyed the chicken. We both tried croquettes on the side, which were fine but ultimately took a backseat the curry awesomeness on the main plate. The proprietary spice blend is so delicious that they prepared a special card on the table explaining everything in it. I'm craving it now just thinking about it.

The place was deserted when we arrived, which meant that the waiter stood at attention for the duration of our meal. It was a little weird, but at least it meant that it was never hard to get a drink refill. (Unfortunately, speaking of drinks, pop is served only in cans - no fountain.)

Oh! And the price! This place is super-economical. I can't remember the last time I had a sit-down dinner for two under $30.

Delicious, attentive and cheap. This place hits the trifecta and I can't wait to go back!

They don't mess around with their spice levels.  If you're a spicy food lover, you'll appreciate this place.  Level 4 spice is too spicy.  I'd go with level 1 next time.  I loved how the curry sauce was very flavorful though.     
Unfortunately, I thought Coco Ichibanya's meats were better since their beef is softer and their chicken is crispier/juicier than Curry Zen's.  
Tip: Get the small portion of curry to save a few bucks.  The regular portion just has more rice and is served on a bigger plate.

Ok. So I've been wanting to come and try this place for the longest time.... I finally did for the first time last week. Sorry this is a late post/review. But let me tell you, I'm glad I came here. First of all, I LOVE curry. If only my husband would eat curry then I'll probably make it all the time. Anyway, about this curry place. I love it! The curry is how I've always known it to be. Just like when I was still living in Japan. The staff are ok. Maybe a little more friendliness won't hurt. But the food is really good. The server will ask you how hot/spicy you would like your curry to be. I chose 7. It was pretty spicy. Just the way I like it. I had the burger patty with rice and curry on it! Yum! I will definitely come back and try the Katsu curry next time.

The curry was very good and portions were reasonable. Highlight for me were unlimited pickles at the table. Perfect complement to curry. 

Don't underestimate the spiciness level. This was my first time, and to be safe, I chose spice level 3. It still had a kick!

Minus one star. They are understaffed. Service was slow.

The chicken Katsu with curry (level 5 spice) was solid esp for the price and I actually enjoy the seemingly plain presentation because the curry was very tasty , low key would come again bc it's p good.

Curry house serving up some amazing curry with spice adjustments and bunch of topping options from chicken katsu to meat loaf. Located in the same plaza as Raku, Monta Ramen and Kung Fu Tea. 

SERVICE
Every worker I have encountered have been polite and attentive. Quick to refill water, get your order and checks. Customer service here is on point everytime. 

FOOD
I grew up eating curry. Back when I was living in Japan, I remember I always looked forward to my school lunch every Friday because it was curry rice. I looked forward to it so bad I couldn't even pay attention in class. 1+1=curry? Makes sense.  

Keep in mind, curry is one of those things where everyone makes it differently and each household has different style of curry. Japanese curry has evolved in many ways because people are constantly trying to figure out ways to make it taste better- adding chocolate or coffee in curry is typical in many Japanese households. 

All of that somewhat irrelevant information aside, it's difficult to rate a curry for me because I am accustomed to my family's homemade curry. I do have to say the curry here is good in its own way. I know Mr. Zenbayashi takes pride in his curry and I enjoy the curry here, with spicy level 0 because I can't handle any spicyness. I also like mine with chicken katsu and cheese. Don't go too crazy on the spicy level as some find level 2 to be pretty spicy. There's also extra charge if you go past 6 on the spice scale. 

I appreciate that they offer many options. You can get your curry with brown rice, white rice or udon. They also offer chicken katsu, pork katsu, meat loaf, kurobuta sausage, cheese, corn, croquette, fried shrimp etc. (Anywhere from $.50 to $3.00 to add-on). Customize your way!

CONCLUSION
The portion is somewhat small but for the price range of $10-12, their rich and thick curry with crispy and perfectly fried katsu is well worth it.
I love the curry here!! Very popular place in Chinatown. My favorite thing to order is the chicken chasu curry. Customer service is good!

Currently obsessed with this place. So so so good. I get the chicken katsu curry and a level 2 spice (I'm weak). One thing I love is the chicken katsu tastes fresh. Unfortunately a lot of places will have chicken katsu and the pieces are hard or stiff. Zen's is very fresh. Their curry has great taste! Small place, but seating is available in a good time.

So yummy! A friend recommended this spot to me and I was pleasantly surprised. Here you will find the obvious choice of chicken katsu paired with curry, but there are other choices as well even for vegetarians. Choose your spice level, and enjoy!

Best Japanese curry in Vegas. They specialize in the stuff so you could only expect as such. The appetizers are fun and delicious. The staff always greets you with great attitude and this is a great place to meet with friends for lunch or dinner. Great location too but parking could be tough at times.
This place is the best... Been here multiple times and have taken other people and they have all loved it!
Curry plain and simple! I've gotten the Curry Udon and the classic Chicken Katsu. The Shumai with spicy mustard kicks your ass in a good way. Also Cheap beer and great service.

Japanese Curry Zen is a curry house in the China town area that offers a delicious base curry served with your choice of meat, spice level, and sides! I've only tried one other curry house in Las Vegas and they have my favorite sauce here. Saying this curry is like the store boat curry would be like saying the ramen you buy at a grocery store is like Monta.

They serve white and brown rice with many different proteins to go with your curry & rice like katsu'd pork/chicken, spam, sausage, meat loaf, croquettes, beef, and grilled chicken. Some other add ons are cheese, corn, and veggies. They also have some sides like fried oysters, gyoza, and curry puffs.

I got the chicken katsu curry and added veggies, corn, and cheese. I'm a sucker for a Japanese meat patty so I got one of those on the side too. Be careful because all of the sides can add up! My dinner wound up being about $18 with a water lol.

The food was delicious! Both proteins I got were cooked very well. The katsu chicken was moist on the inside & the Japanese meatloaf was flavorful and delicious. The cheese  I got added a creaminess that made the dish for me. I've never had cheese on my curry but will probably always get it that way in the future.

My one gripe would be my assumption that a 5 on their spice level would be medium. It was HOT. I would have enjoyed my dinner more had I got a lower spice level. I did try my friends 1 spice and it was a bit sweet for me so I'm sure a 3 would be solid.

The service was good. It was sweet of them to happily split our bill even though it was super busy. 

I'll definitely be back but I'll tone it down on the add-ons and get a lower spice level.

I have no idea what i can say about this place that would do it any justice. The only way one could ever truly understand how amazing Curry Zen is would be to eat there themselves. The food is absolutely astounding. It's high quality, consistent, clean, and most importantly DELICIOUS!! It's also affordable, but not by any means of cheap quality. The service is absolutely amazing, and if you are a repeat customer (like myself and my boyfriend) the employees actually take the time to remember you. We get an extremely warm welcome every time we come in! The food always comes out quickly and it's always fresh and hot. I LOVE drinking the J Pop alcoholic beverages they have available here too. Try the white peach flavor and thank me later. 
Pretty much this place is fantastic, and if you are on the fence about coming here, DO IT!!!! I love bringing friends here and watching as it becomes their new favorite place to eat. I've never heard anyone say they DON'T like it.  It's pretty much the best place to eat in Vegas.

Most of the time I am a tourist and eat on the strip when I come to the Ninth Island (Vegas).  However, on this trip I had my car and I wanted to eat where the locals eat.  Japanese Curry Zen is on Spring Mountain Rd, in the Seoul Plaza strip mall West of the 15.

They specialize in authentic Japanese curry here, that is hand stirred and silky smooth.  Curry and rice is $5.95 and you can add chicken or pork cutlet ($3.50), kushi (chicken; quail eggs (3); & zucchni - $3.50), and a variety of other toppings for an additonal charge.

We ordered the tempura oyster app ($3.60 for 3), tonkatsu ($9.45), and the foregoing w/ kushi ($12.95 - not pictured).  A can of soda was $1.

The oysters were excellent.  The tempura was cooked very well, and the oysters were fresh.  I have had overcooked, not so fresh oysters and they disintegrate when you bite into them.  These were nothing like the foregoing:  5 Stars.

Likewise, the curry was excellent.  You could see and hear the chef constantly stirring the curry sauce to perfection.  Secondarily, the color was perfect.  In addition, the pork cutlet was cooked properly.  It was not dry like other places I have experienced.  Lastly, the portion was a bargain for the price.  BTW, I ordered 3 out of 10 for spiciness, and I was SMAO:  5 Stars.

The service from our waitress was also excellent.  She was super nice, described how the menu worked, and really attentive:  5 Stars.  The ambiance is very basic, but it works for this small place.  Although the place is small, there were separate, clean restrooms:  4 Stars.

If you have a car, forget the overpriced, Americanized Azn food on the strip, and head to Spring Mountain Rd (I would compare to Garden Grove Blvd in OC).  In addition to Japanese, there is Vietnamese, Chinese and Korean.  The food is way better, and less expensive especially at this gem, Japanese Curry Zen.

I'm never really a big fan of going out for Japanese curry because it's something that is so cheap and easy to make at home, so my review might be a little harsh. My friend on the other hand is a Japanese curry fanatic and would eat it every day if he could which is why we ended up here. We stopped by this place as we were leaving Las Vegas as just a quick meal before a long drive home. It was relatively empty since we got there not long after they opened. Since there were 4 of us, we decided to each try something different. We started off with 2 appetizers: takoyaki (4/5) and shu mai (1/5). For mains, I got the kushi curry with a croquette (3/5). My friends got the chicken katsu curry (2/5), karage curry (2/5), and pork medallion curry (2/5). You pay a base price for the curry + the meat, but if you want it spicier you add money on depending on the spice level you choose. Considering their prices were already relatively high, I wasn't so keen on the idea of adding more money just for a spicier dish. The takoyaki was very fresh and probably the best thing I had over lunch. The shu mai on the other hand was sad and over fried and definitely not worth the price. All the meat in the curries were super dry and tough. My friend who ordered the pork medallions was surprised at how dried out his pork was considering he ordered medallions in hopes that they would be much more juicy and tender than just a regular pork katsu. Even the karage and chicken were dry. The best curry was by far the kushi, since it came with a variety of things (my personal favorite being the quail eggs), but it definitely was not worth the price in my opinion. Not only did I get less portion wise, but the kushi curry was $2 more than the katsu curries. Definitely would not return here next time around. 

Pros: 
- Takoyaki was very fresh 
- Offer a generous amount of curry sauce
- Large interior with a good number of tables

Cons:
- Hard to find parking
- Meats were all dried out (especially sad considering they are fried)
- Prices are way more than I'm willing to pay for something I could make at home for $5 or less

I feel that I will always be a frequent visitor for Curry Zen, even if they raise their prices on their menu. You can't really go wrong with any of the items. I normally go with either chicken katsu or beef with spinach and croquette. You can't really go wrong with any of the proteins, they're all so good! Croquette is very tasty, it is pretty much a fried, breadcrumbed mashed potato with some vegetables. Make sure to also ask for some Daikon/pickled radish as it sort of refreshes your palette.  

Adding spinach makes the curry a lot thicker so if you would rather have a runnier curry that makes the ratio equal.. I would either recommend getting extra curry or omit the spinach.

As for appetizers, make sure to get the Takoyaki! It is a must-have every time I visit Curry Zen. Can never go wrong with it.

This place is relaxed, subtle, and doesn't try too hard...because the food does all the talkin!

I find myself coming here whenever I can't decide where to eat. It's because it's quick (the parking is another story), convenient, and their menu is right to the point. 
I've been coming here since the beginning, when they only had a couple of items on their menu, and it was perfect. Since then, they have expanded their menu but for the better! There are now more options for vegetarians - fried tofu or veggie curry are usually what I order.

Tips: 
-The spicy levels on their curry do run a bit hotter than most places so if you want a mild, a 2-3 is perfect. Anything past 4 is like death to my papillae. 
- The parking is also insane! If you want a guaranteed spot, try parking on the side streets next to the center. Many people do it and so far it hasn't caused me any trouble.

when you're in vegas, this is the spot for Japanese curry! huge portions and quick service! also a good amount of variety for carnivores and vegetarians alike! only downside would be the parking lot... it's friggin tiny! when it comes to busy nights, good luck with that. the plaza shares a lot of popular spots including kbbq and boba

I agree with David V.'s Tip, this is strictly a Japanese Curry house (not Katsu house) and they do it right!!

I've been a handful of times and the curry is always consistent and has great flavor. 
In addition, I like/enjoy:
-You basically build y our own curry plate. You can either start with a plain plate and add on items, or just order one of their set plates.
-You can change the spicy level, but you pay for anything above spice level 5
-They have Curry Udon now!!!  
-Chicken Katsu is a thick cut,  not dry and fried well.
-Jasmine Tea is good
-Spinach Curry is a good way to get the greens in without taking away from the curry. 

I would definitely come back, and grab take out from time to time.

My bf and I decided to check this place out because one of my friends recommended   this place has great curry. We were skeptic at first because we never heard of Japanese curry. Let me tell you, we are hooked! The curry was soo yummy and you can choose whatever spice level you want. I eat a lot of spicy food but I can only go to  a spice level 1 haha I'm a huge fan of the vegetable curry with Tofu cutlets!

A little hole in to the wall.  It's small so expect a wait if u come on a weekend.  Nothing bad about it...the service is good for an Asian spot.  Portions are small.  But prices are good.  Great place to go with family so u can order a whole bunch of stuff and share.

the plaza it is located at is small and parking is limited, so that's one annoying point about going to japanese curry zen. the restaurant itself is quite small, too, so space is very limited. the service can be a bit slow and the waiters or waitress might have trouble understanding, but overall it isn't that bad. the food, though, makes up for all of this. it is simply the best curry i've ever had. i've gotten the chicken katsu curry, the beef curry, and the tonkatsu curry, and they all tasted great. i also like their croquette and curry pan, and usually order them when i go there.
I had the pork tenderloin. Just breaded and fried. The curry was good. Nothing to rave about but good enough to take me back to it. For the price you pay for each dish, defiantly worth it.

Finally made visit #2 after months and months. Regretted waiting so long.

When I popped into Japanese Curry Zen tonight, I almost didn't recognize where I was. They've definitely expanded their dining room at some point in the last several months. This is a great thing for what I'm sure is still a popular dining destination.
