For a change of pace, I decided to order the kurobuta sausage curry ($8.45). Kurobuta is synonymous with Berkshire, which apparently is a tasty and pricey type of pork. Google it or something. The sausage is really tasty and tender, somewhat sweet, and definitely on the small side (that's what she said). However, the flavor is more than enough to enjoy rice, curry, and kurobuta evenly for the whole meal.

Other than the choice of meat, the curry is the same for everyone. Good white rice (whoops, forgot that I had good brown rice last time) plus a savory, high temperature curry with their special blend of spices. I tried both the sweet pickled radish and the onion thingamabobs that they bring out to accompany the curry, and I went mostly with the sweet stuff to augment the flavor profile.

A note on the spice level: think a hot Thai place, or possibly worse. I went with a "3" again and ate fairly slowly, recalling how I rushed it last time and was punished for not waiting for it to cool. My advice: order conservatively and be aware that there are additional spice condiments available if you need them.

This is a must-try restaurant for anybody who eats any sort of food, and it makes the plaza that it inhabits even more special.

Ordered tofu salad for appetizer - very few tofu in it Lol and it tastes just fine - 3 stars. Curry with spicy level seven - 5 stars. Almost took the salad away when I was still on it - 1 star. Refused to let me use the wifi - 1 star.

We did have to wait in line, for about 15-20 mins, but their Japanese curry tasted delicious and authentic. Get a main dish, and then an extra side/topping. I suggest chicken katsu and then veggies added. Also, get their croquette as topping! It's a good element to balance the heat.

Something that might help people deciding on spicy level: I am okay with spicy, and realized that 5 was my hot spice level. 5 already got my face sweating, but it didn't bother me. I guess the highest I could go is a 6. My friend got an 8. I tried and thought even someone like me who loves spicy food, I no longer can stand the 8 as I love to enjoy the food more, than alloting that time for eating to just wiping my face and running nose. My friend who still finished his plate says 8 is tolerable for him (he ALWAYS ADDS chili, red peppers, and/or jalapenos in his Asian and Mexican dishes) but will next time just go with a 7 or 6, he says.

Absolutely delicious. Best curry I have had in a long time, even living on Los Angeles. Easy to customize your order to your liking in all aspects. Also helps that service was great. They even let me sample the curry to find the right level of spicy. The meats and veggies I added made my dish perfect. Must try this restaurant.

Amazing place to get authentic Japanese Curry. The employees are always so sweet and quick to serve you. The bathrooms are spotless and smells good for a restroom haha! Good place, you definitely should try it if you're on the fence about curry!

Hubby and I have been coming to Zen Curry before their expansion.  I have always enjoyed the Croquette curry with Spam culet. Hubby loves their Chicken Katsu curry.  We both love that they give us sides of Fukujinzuke,Rakkyo, Almonds and Raisins to add to our curry.  They recently added Takoyaki and Gyoza on their menu...YUM  :)

Good curry! great service! Ginormous portions! Easy on the piggy bank. It doesn't get better than that! I guess it's true what they say about hidden little hole in the wall's, they have the best food! My kinda place (^-^)
We come here all the time and it's always so freaking delicious! Even though it's over 100* outside we still make a point to have a hot meal here. The food never disappoints! Highly recommended.

Love the curry here, I always get the curry with spinach and a level 2. I tried level 3 and that was already burning in my mouth. I love that they make the curry fresh. And the owner, Mr. Zen, is an amazing, sweet man. He takes pride in his food and makes sure it's always right.

I had the 5-piece kushi curry (the skewers were shrimp, shiitake, quail egg, zucchini, and chicken) from the menu and fried oysters from the specials board.

I love their sauce--it is definitely their own fragrant blend. I didn't specify hotness, but that worked out well. At first I thought it was going to be too mild, but by the end of the meal my nose was running and my mouth was pleasantly hot.

It was very busy at lunch--the place seats something like 35 and the one waitress was just about overwhelmed--but they kept the dishes coming out at a steady pace.

While I prefer curry with ingredients cooked into the sauce, I would definitely order the kushi curry again.

The oysters were also very good.

A great new option for Japanese Curry in one of the most up and coming and/or already there china town food malls!  Read a fellow yelpers review and bookmarked it immediately.  There is a line but if its good then a line is worth the wait.  We were lucky and sat at the bar immediately.  The decor is modern, warm and clean the service was extremely polite and fast and the chef was behind the counter to be watched while plating his food.  

This is a bit like a fast food but comfort food but way better, let me explain why.  They have a 15 spice blend with a guide on the back of the menu explaining the benefits of adding these spices to your food.  I have been to a couple of curry places in town and basically I could have bought the same mixture from a box and added water and had the same thing.  This place is different you can tell it is freshly made daily.  The flavors  of the curry is a strong but very mild flavor at the same time (I know that doesn't make sense but if you eat it you will understand).  You have quite a few options for the meat portion of the meal from chicken, fried pork chop  and a few more.  The rice is plentiful and good you also have a brown rice option for a healthier carb addition to your meal.

THIS is the curry I had in Japan this is the curry I have been looking for since my trip to Japan.  I am extremely happy and will be back for sure.

3 1/2 stars. Located in the same strip center as Raku and Monta Ramen I arrived for lunch and was surprised how small but cute the place is. There was only one other patron besides myself. 

My order the pork cutlet curry. My dish arrived promptly and the curry sauce was flavorful but I added medium spicy seasoning for additional spiciness. I thought the pork was on the tough side and was a little difficult to even cut. 

I thought Japanese Curry Zen was pretty average and prefer Coco Ichiban due to they have a larger variety and offer combinations.

Don't get me wrong, if I'm craving Japanese Curry in LV I would return to Japanese Curry Zen.

It's small inside but we went at a good time cause seats were available but I can imagine easily feeling claustrophobic in there - like a bunch of sardines packed together.....

The curry was yummy - I had the pork tonkatsu curry with white rice, potato croquettes and topped with shredded cheese. The condiments provided to us were good. I loved the Rokkyo (pickled baby onion bulbs) and if you want your curry hot there were many condiments to do just that. There even were raisins and almonds -yucky to me but hey if it works for you.....

The Potato Croquette was near perfect - the texture,breading,the mashed potato - yeah it was all good.... the tonkatsu was fried well also. The curry sauce was good enough to me. I only enjoy Japanese and certain Thai curries so this place did hit the spot. 
I did suggest to the waitress that other curry options should be offered like - curry cooked with veggies (carrots & potatoes), or curry with beef cooked in it (cause the beef becomes melt in your mouth soft) or even offer more add-ins like corn,green onions,ect....
Now, the waitress didn't really speak or understand english so I don't know if my suggestions made it to the cook.....

But, yeah I'll be back to get my Japanese Curry grub on!!!!
Delicious! give it a try! I got the croquette curry level 6 with can and cheese and it was fantastic. Highly recommend!

The food here is super simple, yet super tasty.  The menu is pretty short and sweet - different variations of Japanese curry with either rice, udon, or ramen.  I love places with limited menus because that means that the restaurant must be very good at what they do.  My theory held true for Japanese Curry Zen.  I got the chicken katsu curry with rice and it was absolutely delicious.  The katsu was so crispy and juicy.  The curry was amazing and had just the right amount of heat (you can specify how spicy you want it!).  The portion size was pretty decent, probably good for a person with a regular sized appetite.  However, I was still hungry after my meal - I don't know if it's because it wasn't  big enough for me or it was just so good that I wanted to eat more of it!  

The service is good too.  I was seated quickly and my food came out pretty fast.  I  would definitely recommend this place.  Delicious simple food and great service.

However, this parking lot is pretty annoying.  I came here on a Friday night and was extremely annoyed by the large number of people who appear to not know how to operate a vehicle.  Just watch out because it could get congested and people seem to now have horrible parking skills.

Solid curry rice plate and very satisfying when hungry lol. Very customizable and I love that they offer brown and multi grain rice options! Half sizes also available which was perfect for me (half the amount of rice but same amount of protein!). 

They have a 1-10 spicy level scale, a 1-2 is considered mild/medium. I assumed that 5 was going to be a typical "medium" spicy (where it has a lil kick...) until the server warned me that anything above 3 gets quite spicy. I went for the 4 and boy am I glad I did. It was a real kicker that got me sweaty. Lol I don't think I would have been able to handle it at 5-10. So you have been warned!

Overall, a great place for lunch and I'm glad I dropped by.

I do love a good curry. And that is what I got from Japanese Curry Zen today at lunch.

I was seated right away in one of the few open tables. Its a small restaurant and it was pretty crowded. Not as bad as Monta Ramen across the parking lot but still a busy place.

I ordered the chicken katsu curry which is apparently their best seller. I can understand why. Tender, crispy fried chicken, a big scoop of rice and a plate full of Japanese curry. Its hard to beat.

I ordered my curry with a spice level of 3. It was perfect for me. I could maybe go as high as 4 but more spice than that might be too much. This was just right. It made my sinuses open up just enough. And it wasnt so spicy that I lost the taste of the actual curry. Japanese curry, to me, has a certain nuttiness that cuts through the pungent spice. Its not as sweet as say Thai red curry or panang curry. This is more savory. The thickness and color is reminiscent of Grandma's gravy on Thankgiving. It warms the soul.

I would give Japanese Curry Zen another go in the future. I like curries of all varieties but Japanese curry stands out in my mind. When I am in the mood for a good curry away from an Indian or Thai restaurant, Curry Zen has my vote. Good food. Fast service.  Ok pricing.

If you want traditional japanese curry, this is the place to go. Forget your gluten free carb free diet nonsense - get some good homestyle, delicious japanese curry with all the fixings or toppings you could want.

I love this place! I recommend anyone who likes Japanese curry! Reminds me so much of CoCos Ichiban curry in Okinawa Japan! Can't get better than that! I got the shrimp and veggie curry, level 4 spice. Don't sleep on this place my Yelpsters!
Love the curry at this place. The service is fast and attentive. Chicken katsu is super delicious. Cheap beer also.

Best Japanese style curry here in Vegas. It is similar to Coco Curry House. It's a family run business which Is nice. Dishes I've tried and liked...Veggie Curry, Chicken Katsu Curry, Takoyaki and the side salad. For the spiciness level I usually get a level 3 and add hot pepper powder as needed. The establishment is clean, the staff is helpful & friendly  (especially the owners son), speedy service and the food is delicious  :)
Me and friend went here last night 2/23 Friday night, the food was really good. The place was busy.

Love the curry, every time I visited there the taste is always consistent, I love beef, Sasami, and steam tofu curry the best.  Most importantly, everyone who works there always so polite and filled with positive energy

Terrible service, don't go at lunch time not even order to go, they will put you on hook off the phone for 9 mins and told you they are busy, and usual just don't care, and try to buy you off with free food, people are not bagger, people need service not pity. Terrible way to do business, Never Never need this around. If I can put Zero they are below zero.

I love things all curry so when my boyfriend was too lazy to cook it, we opted to eat out at Curry Zen. We decided to do take-out to stray away from the lunch rush hour and ate at home instead. I ordered the chicken katsu curry that they separated for our take-out order. Now while the amount of curry they provide is actually a decent amount, I can't say that they give you enough chicken katsu to eat WITH the curry. By the time we were done with the chicken, we had way too much leftover curry. While I do feel as if they skimped us on the chicken katsu, the curry makes up for it - I could've dumped the curry over some white rice and called it a day. I do suggest that they should really re-evaluate their food portions for a more "even" meal.

Authentic Japanese curry house...had the pork cutlet (1-2 spicy level since there's red powder you can add if you wanna up the level), on point and wasn't greasy at all. Also ordered the curry udon, not really a fan of it but hubby liked it. Servers were very nice and polite.  Definitely we would like to come back again!

Located OFF the strip in Chinatown, this place is definitely worth the drive for some authentic Japanese Curry!!!

(It's not that far off the strip)

The restaurant itself is very small, but the workers willingly accommodated our group of 9, by pushing tables together. 

Lots of different curries to choose from with many levels of spiciness. You can also customize your curry and add additional toppings. I ordered the vegetable curry and added chicken katsu with a spiciness level of ZERO! I also ordered a side of curry pan.

Everything was yummysss. Curry pan was big. Enough to share with someone else. The curry was perfect, not to thin and not to thick either. The portion size was huge too. I couldn't finish it...

One thing I would comment on is that the curry was a little bit on the saltier side. Maybe it's just me since I'm more sensitive to salt. If it was just a bit less salty, then it would have been perfect.

So sad there's no Curry Zen in LA... Curry House just can't compare..

Best Japanese Curry in Vegas, and possibly in the US.  I have tried a lot of Japanese curry across the country, and nothing taste quite like the home made curry sauce at Curry Zen.  My personal favorite is the Kurobuta (sausage) curry with a side of croquette.

This place is decently sized and clean. The couple of times I went, it was busy, but we didn't have to wait that long to be seated (a party of 4). Customer service was friendly, quick, and accommodating.  The setting is casual, nice to hang out and chat with friends. 

There's a good selection of starters and sides. The fried shumai was tasty,  served with a little shredded cabbage and spicy mustard, if a bit on the pricy side (6 for about $4). I guess the main attraction would be the curry itself. I liked the sauce overall.  It was flavorful with a good consistency, not to runny or thick.  I thought the spice was a little lacking, though.  I'm someone who usually orders the spiciest I can,  and the 10/10 (which they charge extra for) had just a little kick for me. Lots of variety in the accompaniments.  I recommend the kushi 5pc and pork cutlet mmmm fried foods!

Amazing Curry. Excellent price.

I had the chicken Katsu and vegetable Curry. Superb!

Warning: these guys are not messing around on the spicy levels. They go from 1 to 10. A level 4 is already blistering spicy. I made the mistake of ordering a 5 the first time I came. Then I went to a 3 the 2nd time and it was just right. Watch out... These guys make hellish spicy curry.

Love this place. Will come back for sure.

This is as close as you will get to Japanese Curry in Las Vegas.

It's good tasting, and a good value, but it's nowhere near the taste or quality I experienced in Japan.

My son, whom was stationed in the Navy in Japan, did like it, and my other son, who accompanied me to Japan, said it was okay, but agreed with me that it was nowhere as good as what we ate in Japan.

Place is decent, help is very friendly, and as I said before, food is decent and certainly a very fair price. 

My only complaint was; it's a busy center and parking is at a premium. 

I might go back there for a light dinner, but I doubt I will get addicted to this place.

Curry is their thing. We come here often and order the Udon curry, Takoyaki, Oysters, and basic Curry rice with pickled vegetables.
The service has extremely improved with their tech support.
If it's Japanese curry you want, this is it!

I really love this place because they're accommodating to my food allergies!! Right off the bat, the menu says if you have any allergens (especially peanut allergies) to let your waiter know. I avoid the curry because it is made with peanut oil, but from what my friends say, it's pretty great. 

What I always get is the Katsu-Don, with the egg cooked well done. Usually, the egg in the dish is served undercooked or runny. Because of food allergies, I'm only able to eat cooked egg so I really appreciate the staff being able to make the egg adjustment for me so I can eat here with my friends. In the past, I've ordered the Chicken Katsu with rice, no curry, and that was good as well. However, I prefer the Katsu-Don better, probably because it's a bit different than what I'd normally order when eating out.

I have wanted to come to Japanese Curry Zen for some time now and finally went for lunch with a friend. I had never had Japanese curry so I didn't really know what to expect although I had seen some photos and honestly the dishes did not seem to aesthetically pleasing. But I had heard great things and my friend was always raving how good it is so I went with an open mind.

I went with the chicken cutlet and the croquette. The taste was ok, but it definitely could've used some vegetables. Yes, they have corn, but something green would've been nice. It would've lent the dish some freshness too, I think. What with the rice, the croquette, the breaded chicken and the brown sauce, it just seemed kind of monotonous to me. 

The price is very reasonable, lunch was under ten dollars WITH TIP and the waitress was super friendly.

If you want Japanese curry this is the place to be. So much variety. I've been here twice ordered original curry half size with steamed tofu and a fried egg. Absolutely loved it!  Next tried out the curry udon noodles. It was a bit salty but not too bad. The pork was a little dry but the curry fish broth made up for it. I'd probably still order it minus the meat. Great price on beer. 22oz Kirin for $22. Definitely will be a regular here.

Born and raised in Japan, this place has great curry. !!!!!   tonkatsu was little bit under fried in my opinion(Tonkatsu kiyoshi does better off course).   If you love the curry, this place is the best in vegas.

I've been going to Curry Zen for several years now. It's a great place to get delicious curry.

You choose a base ingredient for your curry and then, you can add extra toppings if you like. You also choose the level of spiciness; I usually get Zero Spicy Level since I'm weak against spiciness.

I normally order a Scrambled Egg & Spinach Curry with a Croquette, but last time I went, I ordered a Croquette Curry with Scrambled Eggs and Cheese. Tomato comes with the Scrambled Eggs. They also have other food such as Curry Udon, Naan Bread, and etc. I really enjoy their Takoyaki~ The Takoyaki has a nice crunchy, but soft texture.

You can also choose to order a half curry plate which are smaller than the normal plate at Curry Zen. It's in the same area as Monta, Kungfu Tea, Hwaro, and Sweet Raku.
Its alright. Nothing special. Just the sauce and meat.
Love the chicken curry with cheese and veggies! Make sure you get a mini - the regular one is good for 2.

The staff here is great.  5 stars, no doubt.  But the selection on the menu is too limited, and the spice level does not correlate with other Japanese Curry places.  It's too spicy.  I orderred a level 5 and it definitely was closer to a lever 8.  So one less star for that.  And one star off because the steamed rice tased off.  It tasted like cheap rice.  Not sure how to describe it better, but I just recall thinking the rice tasted to ricey.  Like it wasn't washed? Or too much starch?

I would love this place if it added a few things to the menu.  Like fried rice wrapped in omlette for starters.  Then menschi katsu would be great (planko breaded hamburger patty).  And a few extra add-ons to the curry dishes.

After.school my daughter was hungry. She told me about this spot so we went there.. very good food and it came out fast and hot.. the servers were very nice and professional. . definitely coming back...

Really good curry and they know how to make it spicy. I usually get level 8 spicy and I'm sitting there crying because it is spicy lol. If you can handle the heat try to spice level I eat. I order the Katsu and add beef to my curry and it is filling. When you look at the amount doesn't look too big but afterwards you are full and satisfied.

One who seeks curry enlightenment needs not to look further. A sanctum of devoted curry worship, this establishment is focused on calming hunger and appeasing all anxiousness. The few who choose to not pursue the quiet lifestyle may also challenge themselves on their patience with spice tolerance.

Setting: Located in the busy monta ramen/hwaro plaza, good luck finding a parking spot in here during dinner and especially weekend times. Many flock to park in the Chinese church parking lot on the east side of the plaza but you have been warned, people's car's have been broken into in the past in this area.

Food: The fried food comes out crispy and delicious with the curry always on point. Spice level on the menu runs 1-10 but you can test your limits up to 100 (15 made my face numb and sweaty). 11-15 (same price) 16-20 (same price) on the spice price and so on. 

Overall: This is the go-to for Japanese style curry with usually a 0 to 5 minute wait

the curry here is sooooo Yummy! just the same as CoCo Ichibanya back home (hawaii). just missing a few things like: the vegetables minus broccoli, the squid rings which they DONT carry and the delicious salad dressing that doesnt compare to anyone else except for Pietros.

Running around Vegas gave us the late night munchies. We were so happy that this spot  was open late!  

I drowsily shuffled myself into the brightly lit and chipper restaurant. I was hungry! The menu was very simple. It focuses on the homemade curry sauce and the katsu. For the small amount of food on the plate, the prices were kind of high. We ordered the pork katsu and curry and added a side of veggies to make the plate more substantial. Bummer that there isn't a veggie and meat combo curry because adding the veggie side really bumped up the price of our dish. I'm used to Chinatown prices where you can get a substantial meal for $12. This was more of a snack for that price. 

My favorite part of the visit were the delicious bright pink, free pickles that sat on the table. The jar was full when our party of 3 arrived but when we left it was only 1/4 full. Noms.

I went to Japanese Curry Zen a couple of weeks ago with my son and brother in law. Actually didn't intend to go there as we went out to try Monta Ramen. Line was too long at Monta and there was no wait at Zen. 

I was very impressed. The curry dishes were spot on. But before I get there, because it was late and we were hungry, we ordered some appetizers. Ordered Gyozas and deep fried Siu Mai dumplings. I've never had a fried Siu Mai before. Both were good but not spectacular. They were on the smaller side (if you've been to a Chinese restaurant with good dim sum then you know good Siu Mai and Gyozas (potstickers) are pretty good sized where six to eight can make for a hearty portion). The skins were of course fried and crispy. The pork filling was good but not all that flavorful. The fact that we were hungry probably made them taste better than they were. 

Now on to the entrees. I got the pork katsu cutlet and added curry with beef to my entree. The katsu was perfectly cooked. Tender, not too much salt, and crispy breading without a large presence of grease. The beef-based curry was rich, spicy (you can pick your spiciness poison) and flavorful. It had a medium thickness so that it was slightly runny but blended  well with the rice and cutlets. The beef cubes in the curry sauce were tender and flavorful as well. I threw on some of the pickled radishes that are semi sweet and salty and it was down home comfort food awesomeness. And I'm not even from Japan. I have always liked Japanese curry and it is hard finding places that do it outside of large coast cities like LA and the Bay Area (never looked for it on the east coast). This really hit the spot. 

My son got the pork katsu donburi (rice bowl). It was excellent as well. Tender pork katsu cutlet covered with steamed egg and cooked and caramelized onions over rice with a light but flavorful teriyaki sauce. My son ate it all and I was happy to help him out with a few bites. I added some radish as a condiment. 

My bro in law got the pork katsu with a side of sausage (never seen that before) with curry. Because this place lets you customize with add one, he added corn and shredded cheese (never seen that one either). I tried some and have to say although it was not something I would have ordered it was pretty darn good. The sausage was almost like a small smoked kielbasa with a crisp snap when you bite into it. 

All in all, this place is worth a visit if you are in the Vegas Chinatown area and looking for something good and filling (not a light meal by any means).

I've been having the ugliest craving for Curry House CoCo Ichibanya, but because the closest one is 263 miles away, I thought I'd save up on gas and try this place out. At Japanese Curry Zen, I experienced great service, just as many other reviewers have, but the chicken cutlet I ordered was dry and bland, and the curry wasn't anything extraordinary. I understand that CoCo's is a franchise and it wouldn't be fair to compare this local dine-in to it, but I've also had better curry at other local Japanese/Island restaurants for half the price.

They DO serve a mini bowl, so if you just want to try it, go ahead and order that instead.

Had Indian,  Chinese,  korean, Taiwanese, Malaysian,  Japanese curry before and this place is where you come when you're homesick with mom or dad's curry. Nothing really special but special in some ways, such as adding extra toppings like cheese, corn, extra meat, veggies for extra cost and being able to choose how spicy you want your curry. 1~4 is low and 5~10 is high. Croquettes are really good though. Be sure to order your plate with at least 2 extra toppings, plate looks boring without it. Price for what you get seems little on top.

Really love the curry here! They get creative with their menu and I had the one with five different "fried skewers" on my curry. I ordered it with 4 hotness but if I go back will definitely try it at 10 lol. I had the curry as it was for half of it and then just dumped a bunch of chili flakes at the end because I like my curry hot. Good stuff though will be back!

This place was so amazing! I had the chicken Katsu curry and my boyfriend had the vegetable curry. He's a vegan but luckily the curry is vegan friendly. He also got the tofu salad, which was surprisingly amazing! The dressing on it should be bottled and sod! It's like a miso Dijon. Yum!
I got the shumi and the gyoza as well. I was pretty happy! So delicious!

The menu has a variety of choices for the toppings. Toppings included; chicken katsu, sausage, vegetables, spam, corn, cheese, meatloaf, spinach, and others. You can add as much toppings on your curry dish for additional charges. I got the original curry with sausage and vegetables. Spice level I chose was 0 although I believe I could have done level 2-3. My friend got the level 5 spice and she said it wasn't that spicy. The sausage on the dish was like mini wieners hot dog. The vegetables were carrots, broccoli, mushroom, potatoes. The curry had a little kick of spice in it but it was fine to me. I didn't care much for the sausage. The vegetables curry was good. Next time I will try the chicken Katsu with corn and cheese for toppings. The people next to us ordered it with a beer they obviously knew what to eat here. We also ordered the chicken skewers for appetizer. It looked like fried tofu but it was chicken. The chicken was tender and I liked the soy sauce served with it. I would come back here to try other dishes but overall I thought it was an okay place to eat. I'm not a big fan of curry in general.

A thwarted attempt to get Korean BBQ landed our group of three at this tiny Curry house.  The tako taking was amazing!   And my number 5 curry with chicken katsu, spinach and 16 grain rude was very good. I also order the half portion Beavis the probs are very big her and each item is stacked.. As in you get the full size piece of chicken and the full-size order of spinach when you order both.  My table mates had pork katsu and more vegetables. The curry is the real star with a ton of flavor. And so far it's one of my cheapest meals in Vegas clocking in at $16 with tip :).

Went last night after a show and wanted something filling and comforting, and it was just what I needed.  Best Japanese curry I've had so far, and he also agreed it was the best and he's from Hawaii where this more commonly found! super flavorful, fried without being to greasy or burnt.  My boyfriend had the chicken katsu curry, and I had the chicken tenders.  My portion was way bigger than his, but I think his was oddly even more tender.  I am waking up craving more right now, I can't wait to o back.

My favorite curry place in Vegas. Their food is always on point and service is great most of the time. They do get crowded around lunch and dinner times but it is so worth the wait. The only downside i can think of is that their spiciness varies from day to day. I usually get the level 1 or 2 but sometimes the level 1 would be really spicy and other times not spicy at all. Parking is also hard to find but that's more because of the location and other businesses around it. I love coming to this place though and will always pickup some late night dinner for co-workers when working overnights

Popular restaurant as it seems to be full at all hours. Friendly staff, alcohol and a custom level of heat level you can pick for your curry. Of course, its the Japanese style curry, smooth and rich. Reasonable prices and quick   service. Simple decor. Choices of rice, too. Deep fried specialties are special. Parking is easy, too.

Hm... Ya sure, over 900 reviews with average of 4.5 stars... But why?

Food quality- 3 stars. Nothing really to write about, fried stuff is crispy, curry is hot.....

Food taste- 2 stars. The curry here taste different than the one you buy from Japanese store for $4.99/box.... But that's pretty much it. Nothing really "hits" your tongue and scream "I am worth 4.5 stars on Yelp!"

Service- 0 stars. If brings the menu, utensil and water to your table is call service, than I guess this place worth one more star....

I've been here a couple times already so I guess it's time to write a review. 

My first visit: I wasn't too impressed by their curry, in fact I thought it was a bit salty (but maybe that might have been the katsu). What I did like was that the curry already had some heat without needing to add any more spice. I enjoy piling my plate with tons of fukujinzuke and a little bit of rakkyo. The topping that I chose was chicken katsu and it was a big serving of the meat. I've experienced in places where they skimp on the size of katsu and the rest of the serving is just all curry. Overall, first visit was a 3 stars.

Second visit: Was a lot better, in my opinion. I ordered korokke with fried ebi as toppings this time. If I order the croquette all by itself it might not satisfy my hunger, but since I also added fried shrimp (which comes in three) it definitely satiated the monster living inside my belly. The curry this time tasted freakin' fantastic. Their curry is definitely for those who like 'em a little on the spicy side. Plus, you have the choice of adding more heat with the three different "powders" available on each table. 

This place is reminiscent of curry restaurants I've been to as a child. Curry Zen is pretty basic though, since curry houses in Japan has tons load of different toppings available. But for what Vegas can offer, this place is pretty darn good.

I don't like most curry BUT this place is amazing. My first time trying Japanese curry and I'm now a FAN! My friends and I have been here a few times now and they never disappoint. It's a small cozy restaurant. They serve food fast and service is always on point. 

Potstickers 4/5 
Full of flavor, crispy, and the dipping sauce is yummy! 

Chicken katshu with sausage 5/5 
Chicken is tender and crispy the curry is slightly spicy (spicy #3)

They're doing something right if they have so much popularity for a plate of rice and sauce. It's the most delicious curry sauce I've ever tried. I'm not even a fan of rice, but can eat heaps of rice with Zen's curry sauce and some pickled radish. I usually get the chicken katsu, but after trying the croquette, I will be getting that from now on. Had the perfect amount of crunch on the outside and inside was moist and flavorful. You can ask for extra toppings of meats for extra, and get pickled onions, radish, almonds, and raisins for free. Takoyaki appetizer is worth a try. 
Their portions are quite large, but they do have a "small plate" option of just the curry and rice for $3.75, which is a perfect size for me.

Customer service was horrible! While sitting for a good 15mins waiting for our order to be taken we watched the waiter help everyone else except for us. I couldn't even get more water which is funny because our glasses were empty and He refilled every table around us except for us....As soon as we stood up to leave they wanted to help us lol So disappointed I was so looking forward to some curry...
If you like curry this is a good place to try out. Definitely tastes like the authentic Japanese curry I eaten in Japan.

I like their curry. But the restaurant is quite small. I always liked Curry House in California. I think this place, Curry Zen is now my curry spot in Las Vegas. I'm happy i don't have to go to California to taste decent Japanese Curry.

Beware of their Spicy Scale... it's not rated for whiteys. 

I was craving some Japanese Curry and thought I've give this place a try. The joint is super small, but it's as authentic Japanese Curry house as you can get. The place does get busy, so plan your meals accordingly. I went with their Chicken Katsu curry and added vegetables ($2.00) and corn ($0.50). Not that I like vegetables, but it'd give my curry an appetizing color and consistency. The super nice Japanese server asked me how spicy I wanted it and I went for the hottest, free, spicy level (anything above level 5 spicy costs extra.) Unlike other Japanese curry houses I've been to, their spicy, is effin' spicy. I could barely eat 2 bites without downing a glass of water. I ended up eating 1/3 of my curry, since I drank 3 gallons of water. My whitey counterpart co-workers struggled with level 2 spicy. Overall the food was fantastic, service was great, and the timing couldn't have been any quicker. I would definitely come back here for my Japanese curry fix. 

My street creds:
I first got into cooking & food when I was in college. After being rejected by numerous girls and getting zero action, I decided it was time for a change. I needed a new makeover to boost my geeky image. I applied for a cooking position at a Mediterranean-Italian Restaurant near my home and learned to cook all sorts of dishes. I never became a professional chef, but I continue to enjoy & love food. 9 years later and 55 lbs heavier, I have a new passion for traveling and trying different foods around the world.

Curry Zen has become one of my comfort foods.  Some people crave soup on a cold, rainy day; I crave Curry Zen. 

The depth of flavor the curry base has is phenomenal! It has the perfect consistency, it's not too thick or runny.  I asked for a spice level of 2 and I could feel the spice in the back of my throat, but it did not overpower the taste of the curry. I've been cutting carbs out lately so I avoid rice when I can, but this is one of the places that is the exception. I can't stop eating, it's just too good! 

Ordering is simple. You get to pick your rice/size, choice of meat, and toppings (I like to add cheese).  They also offer additional spices, pickled onions, radish, almonds, and raisins. I add in the hot powder, pickled onions, and radish to give it that extra kick. It sends my taste buds over the top!

The service is great here! I was driving around the area with my dog and decided to get some to go. It was 11:15 AM and I didn't realize they open at 11:30, but they happily took my order and said that it would be ready by 11:30 since they're just waiting for the rice to cook. I sat in my car and at 11:30 sharp, the server came out to give me the food. I couldn't wait to eat it, so I had a go at it in my car. To my surprise, the owner came out and said hi to me & my dog and asked how I liked it.

I'm back in Vegas again and got the Japanese meatloaf curry again. OMG it is every bit as good as I remember! Sooooooo yummy. Heads up the parking lot can get super busy, and there were a ton of people waiting outside for seating. Popular!
If you like curry, go. If you don't like curry, go and it will change your mind.
I'm about to go pick up one last delicious curry meal before I head to the airport. ;)

Amazing Japanese Curry food. After 2 days of eating pizza, pasta and burritos, this was such a welcome change. Loved the spice level and crispness of the croquette. And their ambiance is so simple and welcoming. Definitely recommend that you try this place. It will be great if they open one on the strip itself :)
Amazing little place to eat. Great people who give great service. I've become a regular and they truly care and get to know their customers. I highly recommend it!

Located in a plaza with some of the best collection of Asian food in the country lies Japanese Curry Zen. Parking may be hard to find, but it's definitely worth it. The menu is very simple, choose type of curry, choose meat, choose spice level, enjoy. 

I was able to indulge in the Pork Katsu Original Curry with extra Kurubota Sausage with spice level 4 and the Curry-Don which was a relatively new item on the menu. The meat in the Curry-Don was thin sliced pork and seemed to have a pretty good kick at spice level 3. 

We came a little later for lunch so didn't have to wait too long for our larger group, but service was excellent. Expect to pay $10-11 for some top-notch curry. I have to admit that this review may be a little biased because I had been craving Japanese curry for months. But I'd give this a solid 4.5 and bump it up to 5 for what was an amazing meal.
Great meal! We would go back again! Chicken Katsu was outstanding! I got the level 6 spiceyness as it was perfect'

Japanese curry holds a special place in my heart because my grandma used to make it for me as a kid. I would never imagine actually wanting to pay for a plate of curry and rice, but this place proved me wrong!

The food here is great! I usually get the chicken katsu curry or the vegetable curry. Both are delicious. I've tried the fried spam as well, and how can you go wrong with fried spam? 

I think the thing that makes this place special is the service. All of the servers are so sweet and attentive. If it becomes slow, they are genuinely sorry. There was one time when one of my friends didn't get his food while the rest of us did. The server was kind and offered my friend a free beer.

Overall, this place reminds me of my childhood and the service is the cherry on top!

Very good curry is served here and is served with a wide range of nice accompaniments. Service is very attentive and friendly. If you happen to enjoy Japanese style curry, you are going to like this place. Just a note of caution, their curry can be extremely spicy, so tell them you want your curry spiced mildly if you don't like it like that way. Their scale for spiciness ranges from 1 to 10, with 10 being the hottest. I asked for a 3 and it was still pretty spicy.
When we are in Vegas we make sure to visit. They are also open late till 0100 am so when hungry a definite place to visit. Very casual.

So glad that we found this place! Amazing curry, with genuine hospitality to go with it. Staff are extremely nice, and always available. The best thing is their scale system for spice levels. I personally get a 10 every time I go, but it's nice to bring friends that don't like spice so they can also enjoy.

This was the first place I ever had Japanese curry. I ordered the chicken katsu curry with a croquette and cheese, spice level 10. I really enjoyed the flavours much more than Thai curry. The curry itself had nice spices and the cheese complemented it well. The level 10 was a little spicy, but I could definitely use a bit more kick. The chicken katsu looked amazing and tasted much like how it looked. The croquette was merely ok to me, so I'll probably skip that next time. 

Service was quick and my water never got more than half empty. Prices were fair, I think it was just under $25 for my friend and I. I'll definitely be back the next time I get a curry craving.

Quick Review: Tasty, home cooked curry flavor. Very simple dish, complete and friendly. Very mom & pop and not good for big parties. Tasty!

Pros: Solid curry, tasty, mom & pop feel

Cons: Very small venue, seats 15 people total maybe

This is a quaint place, very small though so if you aren't lucky enough to get here when its empty, then you'll expect to wait a while. The menu is very simple, easy to decide among a few dishes. They do curry and just curry and it's done well. Not amazing but very tasty. If you get a level 5 spice, that's just above comfortable for some of us who love spicy. Just a warning.

But there are essentially two tables for groups of 8, and a long "curry bar" that will seat another 8. So keep this in mind.

If you want to eat off strip and want comfort food, this is a great place to be.

The curry is always on point when I come here! The service is a little slow but they staff is always nice .. The Curry Zen on rainbow is literally down the street from my house but I drive all the way to China Town just for this location.

I've gotten the chicken curry & pork curry which were both good. I also add cheese & corn to my curry. The gyoza & shumai are my favorite sides as well.

Raku was over 1 hr wait and didn't want to drive anywhere else so walked over and there was only a 5 mins wait around 9pm. About $9 for a cutlet curry but it was one of the best curry I've had.   The rice was perfect and although I wish I had ordered spicy level 4, the 5 had a good kick.   Def will be coming back

Best curry in town. Hands down. Very genuine Japanese atmosphere when I walk in. The servers are all very nice and always make sure you're being tended to. Their spice levels may differ depending on your tolerance towards spicy foods. I come here all the time and I always leave satisfied!

Went there the second week they opened and thought it was "ok." I'm used to the Curry House in Little Tokyo in LA. The place is tiny and cramped. Portions are a little small for the money and no veggies to go along with the meal. We ordered the sausage (tiny hot dogs) with brown rice and chicken katsu with brown rice. About an hour later, we were hungry again and had to satiate our hunger with a nice order of Carne Asada Nachos from Faustos. I wish they would offer options for veggies, pasta, and a hamburger patty.

One the plus side, the staff here is SUPER nice.

This place was good.  Very small, casual, and intimate. 
I ordered the kushi, which was a sample of shrimp, quail eggs, zucchini, shiitake mushrooms and chicken.  All were good, but the zucchini was my favorite. 
The curry sauce had a good flavor and a good heat ratio.  I ordered a 6 on the hear scale, but probably could do the 7 or 8 and still enjoy.  
Glad I came.

Amazing katsu chicken and veggie curry. Folks when they say blazing hot for 9 out of 10... they mean it . So make sure you can handle it... I would say people who can handle very very spicy venture to 8 or 9. Very flavorful and fresh.

For curry, portion was great, taste was good. I liked it! I chose spicy level 1, hoping not spicy at all. It was spicy! I would say level 4. I like spicy but I chose level 1, hoping I could feed it to my baby girl who cannot take any spicy at all. This did not work at all. We ordered "oysters" not knowing it was flied. On the menu it didn't say it is flied...Well, it was not my favorite. I wish they had a Natto & egg for toppings. Service was good.
Over-rated, but solid curry. The prices are ok, not great, and the selection is lacking. But they make a good signature dish, the fried chicken curry.

I've been going to this special little place since 2012. A few things have changed, but the things that haven't are the friendliness of the servers and the quality of the curry. 

Tucked within a crowded and small plaza, Japanese Curry Zen is pretty much THE place to go in town for, well, good Japanese curry. They make their flavorful curry with a vegetable broth and a blend of a whole bunch of spices that together make a comforting and unforgettable taste. 

Accompanied by the curry is a wide selection of meats and vegetables including tonkatsu, kurobuta sausage, deep fried shrimp, and fried tofu. I personally order the curry with either chicken katsu or grilled chicken, occasionally with spinach. You can't go wrong with any combination, really. And if I could suggest to ask for the fukujinzuke (hard to pronounce, but easy on the tastebuds), it'll give a nice sweetness to the savory plate.

"WOW... WOW...WOW" is the word I will use to describe how good they are ... while I am eating.  We ordered the Pork tender  and Chicken tender, they are excellent from outside having the crispy crust and super juicy inside.  For the curry, they are JP authentic style.  I also enjoy their oyster as side order.  They even have regular JP steamed rice and brown rice for you to choose from, and the level of spicy can be requested too.  MUST GO !!!!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED !!!!

My favorite place for curry! Always fast and friendly service, even when they're busy. 

My boyfriend and I always get the same thing, (chicken katsu curry spicy level 3) and it takes no more than 8 minutes for both plates to come out. Service is prompt and my water is always full. Great place for a quick bite on your own or a sit down dinner with friends. It is on the small side so I'm not sure they can accommodate larger parties. Try it out if you're looking for a curry place!

Solid curry house with really good katsu. Didn't blow me away though.

Came around lunch time and it was full but we got seated right away. Waters dropped off and orders taken quickly. The service here is really efficient. Both of us ordered the chicken katsu with level 3 spicy.

The chicken katsu is made really well. When you cut or bite into it, the breading doesn't just fall apart. That separates great katsu from badly breaded chicken. The curry was good, came out piping hot and had a slow creeping heat to it. I'm glad we asked what "medium" was and he said 2-3 on the spice level (out of 10!). I can handle my own with spice but I don't even want to imagine how spicy 10 is. I would recommend 3 for some heat without being too hot.

Overall, I would definitely come again, but wouldn't go out of my way for it.
Got the Katsu-Don, very good! Will remember this place and try to come back again one day!

Now I know why this place is so popular! It's just very straightforward. There are several appetizers, and a few different options for your curry--meat, vegetables, tofu, spice level, cheese, what have you... I like the tofu curry as well as the vegetable curry! Good flavor, and it definitely hit the spot!
Definitely try the curry udon! I literally should be a vip here since I eat it so often I LOVE THIS PLACE!

Something about Curry over rice man lol. Gives you the feeling of a home cooked meal done right. Depending on what you order the Rice is always perfect. Fluffy, & cooked the way Moms cooks it lmfao. 

Spice levels is not something to take kindly! Make sure you know what level you can stand before ordering! I prefer spice levels where I'm not dying from the heat but enough to enjoy the meal. The slight sweat makes you feel accomplished after eating. 

My go to will always be the Spinach & Egg combo with a side of that fire flame MeatLoaf lol. Plus cheese and corn! Can't go wrong! You'll find yourself wanting to come back in no time!!!

I had ordered the croquette and pork katsu and was an excited little boy ready to womp on the hot curry on a cold night.  When all my friends' orders came out, mine came out wrong as they gave me some sausage with katsu.  When I told them i had ordered the croquette, instead of hurrying and whipping out another dish, OR just leave the one they messed up on for me, they took about 20 min talking amongst themselves trying to figure out what in the world they did wrong.  Finally after all my friends had finished and 20 minutes later, it finally came out with brief apologies.

The curry was good but i was so mad and full from eating everyone else's food I couldn't even enjoy it.  Sorry Zen, the food was decent but the poor service brings you down a notch.

Great place for Japanese curry in the area. I know this is a popular plaza with Monta and Raku (and even the Kung Fu Tea, which I like too), but I think this place is worth a visit too. It is most similar to Coco Ichibanya. I had the pork cutlet with a level 5 spice. The pork itself was great, with good texture and taste, and the curry was yummy too. The level 5 spice definitely had a kick to it. Only thing is I would add additional items if you are looking for more than fried pork, curry, and meat. For example, a friend added the vegetables and it looked pretty good. I also tried the katsu don (great option if you don't want curry). It wasn't too busy when we came in around 6 p.m. but definitely started filling up by the time we left.

OK. 

In this trip to Vegas, we've seen Penn&Teller,  Michael Jackson One Cirque du Soleil, and even the Australian BeeGees. The food we've had in this out if the way little mall has been right up there for highlights!

Curry here is authentic and rich. Not loaded with MSG. Real good curry made by a real Nihonjin, not Mr. Lee or Pedro ( no offense meant, but this place is legit!)

There are a variety of delicious things to go with your curry and rice. 
I did the tonkatsu, which is my standard go to. Crispy, moist, not greasy. 
Wife had the Japanese meatloaf, which was moist and flavorful. 

Young guys at table next to us did 3 things with their curry. If I had the metabolism of years past, I would have done that too!

I did level 8 out of 10 for hotness. Just right. Made my nose run, but my eyes stayed dry. 

This small place, which can seat maybe 35, is a must do for curry lovers. And if you're on the fence about curry due to the MSG laden, S&B block instant curry you've tried, give this place a try. You will be glad you did!

Delicious food I been coming here for over a year and finally had the time to leave a review. The food is delicious they have more than 10 levels of spicy (secret menu) and the customer service is fantastic. It gets really busy in the weekends but the wait is definitely worth it! Try the Thai iced tea.
Fresh and good for this style of curry. Everyone super nice. Number 3 is like a 5 for spicy and my mouth was still on fire.
All I need to say is that I finished the entire plate. This place is simply AMAZING and they make to feel welcomed the second you walk in. They greet you, seat you, and serve the best japanese curry!

Yum! You can never go wrong with this place! Being from Cali and growing up with Japanese curry restaurants like curry house, this place definitely satisfies that curry craving! I first tried this place when it first opened. And I fell in love. Just as awesome as other curry places in California. Service is great as well as the food. I love spicy food so it's great that they make your curry as spicy as you want it. When you choose a spicy level 6 it's like a 10. They have various toppings you can add on as you wish which is great also.

The workers at this place are good about greeting customers as they walk in & saying bye when they walk out. 

I've been to this location a couple of times & there's never been a wait. I usually order the chicken katsu curry with brown rice, spicy level 3. I don't like my food too spicy to the point that I have to constantly drink water. I find that level 3 has just the right amount of spice. I don't like the fact that you have to pay for every little thing, i.e. Spice. The breading for their katsu is just right & isn't too heavy. Their water is also good (lol). I'm usually really picky with water & I won't drink tap water.

Their service is also not bad. Overall, this place is good & I'll definitely come back!

My first and second time coming here this past week - cannot stress enough how much I've come to LOVE this place.. I am not a huge fan of curry. But wow, I absolutely love the curry here!!!!!! IT WAS SO GOOD THE FIRST TIME I COULD NOT STOP THINKING ABOUT IT AND HAD TO HAVE IT BEFORE I LEFT TOWN. I had the chicken katsu, a must have ! And I had tofu too. Curry is exceptional. Service is great here too. There's one server in particular who is soft spoken but he is so very nice!! They are really on top of things... Please do yourself a favor and go here!!

We started with the Fried Gyoza ($4.50); it's standard Japanese-style dumplings. It was fine, but I probably wouldn't order it again.

Japanese curry with Chicken Katsu is one of my all-time favorite dishes. This one was a little disappointing. I had the Chicken Katsu Curry w/ Brown Rice ($8.95). I was really pleased that brown rice was an option with no additional cost. The katsu was decent. The curry itself is what I wasn't really feeling.  The consistency and everything else about this dish was great, but the flavor wasn't what I like (or expect) in Japanese curry. It wasn't bad, but not what I want.

Also, I was really peeved that Fukujinzuke or any type of Japanese pickled vegetables were NOT set on the table or offered with your meal. I had to ask two servers because the first one seemed to have forgotten and we waited for some time. When we finally received it, they had only brought one dish for two of us. Although rather stingy, I thought one was standard for the table until I saw the party across from us had THREE things of pickled vegetables (and two types) for three people. Totally lame. What's Japanese curry without Fukujinzuke?!

Everything about this place made me feel like I wasn't in a Japanese curry house. Besides the menu. The menu looks great and the options are fun and vast. The curry flavor, missing or shortage of wonderful pickled vegetables, and lackluster service made me leave feeling sad and disappointed.

Service is really great here! We were seated right away and the food didn't take that long to make. Our waitress refilled our drinks when needed and she asked if everything was good. I had chicken katsu curry along with vegetables & cheese. I chose level 2 which had a little bit of a kick to it. Zen curry is yumtastic!

5 STARS! Quality for a great price! At around $10 a plate, if you love curry you should try this place out for such a good price! Highly recommend the chicken katsu curry, I tried it at spice level 3 and it's perfect. If you ever find yourself at a long wait at Monta Ramen next door, you can always try curry zen if you're to eager to eat!

This place was fantastic. I have been her multiple times and each take has be great. From the service to the food and drinks. Every thing was price fairly and the portions are great. would bring all my friends here. however it does get packed so be there early or be ready to wait 5-15 min.
My new favorite curry house! Definitely coming back. Chicken katsu and takoyaki is soooo goood! Cant wait to try the pork katsu.

Great authentic curry joint. Oishi! Reminds me of Coco's curry in Japan, with it's yellow and brown color scheme. The Pork Katsu was a little tuff, could have been tenderized a little more but the flavor of the curry was spot on and spice level 5 was just right not to hot not to mild. 

The restaurant is fairly small though so don't plan on bringing a big group here. Perfect if you're by yourself cause you can pull up to the bar and put down some rice and curry. 

Parking is ruff in this little shopping center, I think there are more restaurants than parking spots, so you may have to loop around a couple times or take a chance parking on the street or better yet just get it to go...

THIS PLACE IS THE REAL DEAL. COME HERE IF YOU WANT JAPANESE CURRY. I was born in Singapore and Japanese curry was everywhere and i have eaten this dish for so many years. BUT this place was the real deal. Tucked away in a small corner of chinatown, they serve real, authentic, spicy JAPANESE curry. In fact, the curry served here is better than most places back in my hometown and i am really proud to give this place 5 stars.

Good service, great flavour, affordable prices... These things definitely lead to a great combination. I think next time I'll have to bring the boys along with me, and not keep the tasty stuff all to myself.

Curry special restaurant and very reasonable prices. Curry lovers must go.
Also curry udon is my best recommendation, oh I love it so much. Gotta eat at least once a week.

By Odin's beard, this place has curry like you wouldn't believe. It is insane how amazing it is. And it's not just the curry, the rice is awesome, too! It could just be that my tastebuds are weird but it seems that the rice is slightly sweet which provides a perfect contrast to the spice-heavy beauty that is curry. The cool, soothing rice alongside the lively and warm ocean of flavor creates a dish of emotion. One can feel the love put into these edible works of art.
I ordered a vegetable curry and rice with an addition of fried tofu. A surprisingly short time later, the friendly servers brought it. Holy seacow. Instead of only a couple small pieces of fried tofu, they placed four huge ones right on the dish! Whoo-hoo! The mushrooms in the veggies deepened the curry's flavor even more. Mmmmmm! The rice provided a sense of serenity. The curry was so incredible that I'm definitely coming back again.

I had this place bookmarked to visit so I stopped by on a Weds evening around 9pm because I'm on this whole ramen mission. I'm no expert on noodles, so when I ordered Curry Udon, I had no idea the noodles would be so thick. I didn't like it at all... but that's no fault of the restaurant, I just didn't do my research. The flavor of the curry was rich and satisfying. It's a very good dish, just not my style of noodles. So a good thing came out of my visit, I learned that I am not a udon fan. The fried shumai was wonderful. I'd go back for them alone. The waiter was extremely friendly and attentive, exactly what I'd expect at a Japanese restaurant. He was very pleased and put on a big smile when I tried my best at saying "Gochisousama deshita" at the end of my meal...This is a 5 star place.
I love to come here, because they make the best curry to be honest. I will definitely come back for it in the next few days. The waiters are very nice and also it is clean and neat.

Finally back in the bay. This place is one of the highlight in Vegas due to the kind people who works here. Authentic Japanese place. Which means, they are from Japan and some of y'all think all Asian are from Japan or China. 

Came here after a horrible massage next door. I ordered Katsu-Don and Katsu-Curry. I must admit, Katsu-Don has always been a favorite of mine since at a young age in Japan. It tasted just like how I remember it. Not too sweet and just perfect. The Curry, it was a bit too salty for me. But it was good. 

The Katsu was fried to perfection. Wasn't greasy or soggy. In fact it was crunchy even after the Curry was on top and Katsu Don Sauce was over it. 

I will be back next time I'm in the area. A go to spot for authentic Japanese good outside of Americanized Sushi spots. 

#SOLitFood

The place is very small but the food is amazing, the service is nice and the food comes out QUICK. The Japanese curry is the best. It's better than anything I've ever had. You can make it as spicy as you want or not at all. It's great!!!!

Finding a decent Japanese curry restaurant is like finding a four-leaf clover.  
It's like picking the winning numbers for the Powerball lottery.
Playing the perfect hand of poker.
Or finding jeans that don't ride up your crotch...

Japanese Curry Zen is good curry.
All the more surprising cause it's in Las Vegas.

Run by real Japanese!

Eat their curry.  I recommend slathering it on their 16 grain rice.

Then let the waistband of your crotchless jeans loose.

Did I say that in public?
I tried many Japanese curry in many cities. This is the best I think. Even my 6-year boy loves it so much! Although he needs to keeping drink ice water when he was eating the curry.

4.5 stars

My friend saw this place when we all went to get a foot massage a few days prior and wanted to try them out. There were people waiting outside to dine there so that was what struck his interest. I love curry so I was down to give them a shot. Usually busy restaurants have good food and in this case, it was true. 

When we arrived, the place was busy with their lunch rush. Something we accounted for before coming because my friend had to go straight to the airport to catch his flight after lunch. It didn't take long to get seated. We had a chance to look at the menu while waiting so we knew what to order. 

I ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry with Cheese and Spinach Level 10. Portions were good but the curry wasn't spicy at all. I really enjoyed my meal even though the spice was disappointing. We washed down our meals with a couple of beers. What an awesome meal to send him off on. Great spot and I'll be back next time I'm craving curry in Vegas.

This curry house is located in a plaza with a couple of my favorite restaurants. When I first came to Curry Zen when it first opened it was super small and only seated a max of maybe 15 people.  They've expanded it since then.  My usual plate it the chicken tender curry original spice WITH a croquette.  The flavors are wonderful and it has a light kick to it but of course you can pick a spicier level.  Sometimes I get the chicken katsu curry but since it has more fat and I'm trying to be more "health conscious" (lol) I stick with the chicken tenders.  

I think a must topping to have with curry is cheese, almonds, and raisins.  Traditional and non traditional toppings but still makes it delicious.  I've ordered the fried oysters a couple times, it's good but you can see and taste the oil its fried in so I try to stray away from eating all 3.

I really like the smell of curry when you walk into this place. Came here in the afternoon and wasn't that busy. The interior design was pretty neat and the table size had enough room for me to eat comfortably.

I ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry spice level 4. The spice level ranges from 1-10 with the lowest number being less spicy. Level 4 was still really spicy so if you're not a big fan of spicy I would recommend 1 or 2. My brother is a big fan of spicy but he can't really handle the level 7.

The dish was a nice size for the price. The chicken katsu was perfectly cooked and gave a decent portion of white rice. 

Service was very fast and friendly. She refilled my water when I needed it and the food was brought to our table in a very reasonable time.

Thank you to the staff of Zen Curry!

Great food and friendly staff! My wife and I have been looking for a good Japanese curry restaurant since we left Japan a few years ago. Thankfully we found this spot, we'll definitely be frequenting Curry Zen.

God damn, this Chef makes a mean curry! and I mean, MEAN. Now I've had my fair share of Japanese curry and as a lover of true spicy food, I know that even a level 10 at your average Japanese curry house is not going to get the job done, but not at Curry Zen, no no my friend. This Chef is serious, if you order a 10, you're gonna feel it, and it's gonna feel good :)

Since I'm not a big rice eater, I loved that I could add veggies and spinach to my curry. I didn't have to waste precious stomach space on starches, woohoo. The pork katsu was cooked to perfection, not too chewy and krispy just right. Prices were reasonable and the service was lovely. No line for a late lunch on a hot Sunday. 5-stars all around!
The food tasted amazing, and the service was exemplary--What a bargain. So good, that we came back 3 days later and brought friends. This place is legit.
Best curry in Vegas. Hands down. Tastes just like CoCo's Curry in Japan, with a hint of spice thats just enough to give it flavor, but not so much that you're dying. Definitely my new curry spot!

I enjoy the Japanese curry here - I really do. There's a lot of homemade and wholesome qualities about the place and food, and it doesn't taste like the curry is oversaturated with monosodium glutamate, which is great! In fact, the curry is quite smooth - not as thick of a consistency as I am used to, but also does not have chunks of anything included. The rice is very fluffy and sticky. Their main downfall is that portion sizes are unimpressive - I can find a similar sized katsu curry dish in an Asian supermarket food court for a few dollars cheaper. Eating a full dish did satisfy me, however, but I got hungry a few hours later, and it seems like you need to include add-ons or appetizers to really complete the meal. Looking through the pricing, I did not find any add-ons or appetizers worth it.

I've tried the chicken katsu and pork katsu - chicken seemed to taste just a little better in some way - maybe it was the more varied texture and grooves of the breading. I've tried having the cheese for a topping, and it was pretty cool - it did partially melt and provided melty goodness, but it also would have more or less tasted the same without. I've tasted the curry with no spice added, and with a spice level of 4 ("blaZEN" levels range from 1-10 and cost between 20 to 45 cents extra). Level 4 adds a good kick to it, but nothing really spicy on the tongue.

I also did not like that you have to ask for fukujinzuke for it to be included. The menu pictures show them included, and I wouldn't have even known that they had to be requested, had I not overheard someone. I must be spoiled from curry places around my area and from overseas.

One of my absolute favorite places in Las Vegas for Japanese curry. I always get either the chicken or pork katsu curry. You can also choose your spice level for the curry sauce. It goes from 1-10, but be warned.. their spice is no joke! I usually go for level 2 or level 3. 2 is good enough for me, but 3 is when I want that feel that kick in there. Service is always great and fast. The servers really know how to move the customers along and they will quintuple seat tables at a time. I don't know how they keep up! Overall, this place is a must if you like Japanese curry. They even have vegetarian options such as spinach and egg, fried tofu, vegetable, and there's one more but I can't remember it. This is a place for all kinds of crowds. I must say though... Their portion size has decreased over the years. Oh! And go over to Kung Fu Tea afterwards for a dessert drink.

I've eaten here at least 50 times so far and I love it. Consistently great quality and great low price! Even the drinks are are super cheap! I don't usually order soda at restaurants since it's usually over priced but it's like 1.50 here. The chicken Katsu curry is out of this world. I get spicy 10 every time and it's perfect. The gyazo is solid too. Staff is super friendly to boot!

Zen curry you have the most amazing flavor to a simple meal. Each bite reminds me of a home cooked meal. Your prices are reasonable and your customer service is exceptional. I just wish you had more locations.

I remember they would have potato and carrot chunks in their curry, but I went there a few days ago and there was none of that. It was my favorite part! The service from this particular visit was not good and also slow. On the other hand, the portions are large and will definitely fill you up. 

When I came this time, I asked for level 10 spicy on my pork katsu curry but it wasn't as spicy as I was hoping it would be. The pork also tastes like the chicken... weird. 

Anyway, I don't think I would suggest that my friends and I go here if we were ever in a pickle to find a place to eat, but I wouldn't mind going here again if I had to.

A really good Japanese curry restaurant. After being seated and ordering, we had to ask to get our waters. Also, the ratio of rice to curry was a little bit off for me (more rice than curry) but besides that, the currys are pretty good. I probably will be coming back, just not anytime soon
I really like this place! Ordered ck katsu and tokiyaki, love it. Also, the service was excellent :)

Very yummy speciality restaurant in the busiest food mall in town!  you get to select your meat and veggies and it comes smothered on a plate in delicious curry sauce!  I had hamburger and kushi skewers, and it was really good.

One of my most favorite restaurants in Vegas. A winning combination of great food, quick service and attentive servers at a great price. I have visited the restaurant more than 10 times with different groups. Vegetable zen curry is a winner and appeals to all vegetarian and meat lovers alike! You can actually experience the burst of unique flavors melting in your mouth. Seriously! :)
If you are do not mind fried food (although it's not dripping oil), you can try one of katsu items. Tofu katsu is average and chicken katsu is not very different from chicken wings at KFC.
I usually pair the entree with a side of tasty Tofu salad. Thai Ice tea is housemade and is refreshing! I tried Oolong tea for a change last time, but wasn't too happy with my choice, as it was bottled and unsweetened. I guess I will stick with my Thai tea from next time.

It's a very small place but the curry was very good. I'm normally a level 3 gal at most curry restaurants but this level 3 tasted like what I'd expect a level 8 to taste like. It was very very spicy. 

For my 16 month old, I got the curry pan and it was very very good. He ate all of it and nearly licked the plate clean. 

We ordered croquettes as a side order and they were great as well. We will definitely be returning.
Great place to go for Japanese curry.  Also, ya can't beat the price and service.  I will come back to this place....

Going by what was on Yelp we came here at 11:00AM but were disappointed to find out that they actually open at 11:30.. hmm I think pretty much everything in this plaza opens at 11:30 so we went to McDonald's to get some free coffee and to kill some time. hehe Anyways we went in at exactly 11:30 and were warmly greeted by the small staff of 3..

As other Yelpers have mentioned it is a cute little restaurant with less than 4 tables in addition to their solo diner's bar.. They have an open kitchen so you can see the chef making your food. 

I had the chicken katsu curry with brown rice, corn and cheese. The portion size was good.. The curry didn't have any crazy strong tastes but the flavor was all there! I love the little add ons.. especially the pickled onions.. The waitress was very nice and kept our water glasses full. The chef even touched tables and made sure everything was delicious. Amazing service from such a little place.. Love it! The bill for 2 came up to a little over $20..! cheap & tasty = perfect! 

This will definitely be my go to spot when I'm craving curry although like Monta, I would probably stay away during peak times. 

RANDOM: are you the type of curry eater who eats it very clean or do you like to mix everything around on your plate and get a little messy? haha

TIP: don't forget to look at the Specials board.. I definitely want to go back to try the tofu katsu and curry udon ;]]]

This place is super delicious! Customer service is great, and the food is awesome. Simple, and delicious. 

I've tried basically everything on the menu, super yum. Pork tenderloins my fave! Level is usually 5, and its not bad at all. 

They even got specials and side items around the restaurant. Look out what they are and try em too!

Curry comes in so many flavors and that's why I'm not the biggest fan.  However, after visiting Zen Curry I can definitely give curry an endorsement.  After my wife had recently visited Japan she had a craving for curry.  Zen was busy but the wait wasn't too long.  I ordered the Tonkatsu  (breaded pork) curry and an order of Tacoyaki.  The Tonkatsu looked very simple.  The breaded pork was side by side with white rice and the curry gravy was liberally spilled over both.  The pork was delicious and crispy and the curry had a nice spice and all in all it was so awesome!  Takoyaki is a Japanese snack that is in the form of a ball.  In the middle of the deep fried dough ball is a small piece of octopus.  If you come to Zen don't miss out on the Takoyaki, it was so good!  Over all, I loved this place.  My wife even said that Zen Curry was very close to the curry shops she ate at in Japan.  This is a must go in Las Vegas!

Had the pork katsu curry (spice level 3) and fried shumai   

Delicious and affordable!
Great food as always. Had pork katsu and sausage with level 3. Great portion and amazing curry. Thanks for a great lunch!

Japanese Curry Zen is the place that introduced me to Japanese curry, and also the place where I fell in love with the dish. I no longer live in Vegas but whenever I come home, I make sure to stop by here to eat and get a few orders to go to take back to AZ with me. 

I usually get the Chicken Katsu Curry (no spice) + gyoza. The serving size is generous and the prices are very reasonable. The chicken is always cooked to perfection, and the curry sauce has always been on point. Call me crazy, but I never get tired of the curry here, ever.

Zen is located in a tiny, super busy area of Chinatown with lots of traffic because of next door businesses. The dining area is a bit small, but the wait is usually bearable and the food makes it worth it. Because it's a busy area, parking can get craaazy, so just a heads up. Overall, if you like Japanese curry or would like to try, this is a good place to start.

I was literally dragged here for lunch by Curry Zen addicts, and I now know why it is so addictive. I have always been ambivalent towards curry, but the Japanese curry served here transcends traditional american food palates, and the 1 to 10 heat scale curry options makes it safe for even the most delicate of  tasters. So delicious. One of our party was allergic to peanuts, and as they use peanut oil, was unable to eat. Our waitress was OUTSTANDING and I thought she would literally cry that she couldn't serve her, but accommodated our friend in every possible way. Service was far and above anything I would expect and the food was excellent.

They use curry like chili, topping it on everything. The consistency is the same. The heat is mean. Now I know the difference between Thai and Japanese curry. Both are good. I like how Japanese curry is thick. 

Place is clean, food was fast and fresh.

I have been waiting for another cheap, quick Japanese eatery to open up.  After a couple of ramen places and a soba place, I suppose the move to a curry house makes sense.

I do have to make it clear to some who may not be familiar with "Japanese Curry" that it is NOT like Indian or Thai curry, as much as Japanese "Ramen" is unlike Chinese noodle bowls and such from where it originated from.  Japanese culture has a tendency to import certain things, modify them and make them their own after much time.  Curry is very commonly cooked in Japanese households, and it is almost like hamburger is to the American diet.  

The menu is simple and self explanatory on their website, so I'm not going in to details.  

As for the curry, it was was good, somewhat safe, and not overly unique, but as the only curry house in Vegas (I guess I shouldn't say that now that Kaba is not just in a truck anymore?)  I think it's better to make it not too out of the ordinary.  As for spiciness, it was mild-moderate, definitely a LOT less spicy than that at Cafe de Japon, and I am not certain whether you can ask to make it spicier or not.  

I would say that the portions are quite BIG.  Regular size with pork cutlet to make a katsu curry for example will get you quite full.  I think half size and katsu is almost enough to feed most people.  Even plain curry ($4.50, cheap!) is plenty large.  

Unfortunately they sold of out desserts which included annin dofu and Coffee jello that looked really good.  

The service was quick and friendly, and for an opening day (besides from running out of desserts), they seem to be moving quite efficiently.  

All in all, I was quite pleased to have an authentic curry house in town which should give us additional options for quick inexpensive Japanese food besides from ramen and soba, and I'm looking forward to going back.

Really simple typical Japanese curry joint... Nothing fancy. 

Their menu is simple, you pick the spiciness of the curry and the toppings. 
My favorites are the kushiage and scrambled eggs. 

Takoyaki here is a must try. It's agetako (deep fried) style. Really crunchy on the outside and slimy inside, just like agetako should be. So delicious. 

I'm sure I'll be back when I'm in Vegas next time.

The curry here is delicious.  No wonder the place is full.  But honestly, all the restaurants in Chinatown are full of patrons! It is possible that all trillion of them deserve a try.  The menu is pretty focused here.  For appetizer we ordered the tako yaki, which are fried balls of mixed squid pieces, tempura bitsies and vegetables.  There is a mayo-like sauce on top.
