I was not a big fan, but my husband liked it very much.  It is a very traditional Japanese street food.  
Then I ordered the spinach curry, my husband ordered the vegetable curry, and we split tofu katsu, which are panko crusted blocks of tofu.  Everything was extremely extremely delicious.

We only waited a few minutes for the table.  Other people with bigger parties were waiting longer.  There was no one really hosting guests, and there is no space inside to wait, so we all stood around for a while, until finally we started writing our names on the pad and waiting outside.

You can request the spice level you want from 1 to 10.  I ordered a 2, and it was medium spicy.  I told the waiter a 6, and he said, "6 is not medium.  2 is medium."  And he was right. The entrees were about $10 apiece.

Best Japanese curry I have ever eaten. Simplistic at its best. The dining was a bit small, however the amount of rice and curry given will last you until dinner time and possibly the whole day. They have tasty varieties of food on their menu which makes it difficult to choose from because they are all good. Most of all they have different levels of spice to no spice, mild, or really spicy all depending on your preferences. Customer service is at best courteous and respectful and always making sure you are satisfied. Will definitely return.

Delicious curry! Watch out for the spice level! I get a number 3 and it's super spicy already! I'm gonna try number 2 next time and see how that goes. A guy next to us got a number 10 and wasn't phased, I don't know how he was eating it lol. Definitely try the takoyaki here too! It's delicious. For the curry, I usually get the chicken katsu with additional beef but I recently tried the 5 piece kushi and it was great! It was skewers of fried mushrooms, quail eggs, shrimp, zucchini, and chicken katsu. It's nice if you want a good variety! Don't forget to ask for the pickled ginger. It helps balance out all that spiciness! I have to remember to save room next time for their green tea cheesecake which looked amazing! Their service has been consistently great and fast whenever we've come. Give it a try if the line at monta is too long! Lol

Pros-  
complex curry taste rich with Indian spices. 
Good spice level
Attentive waiters and fast
Chicken Katsu was on point and flavorful
The rice was sticky and nice
The Japanese sausage was smoky and bit sweet

Cons- 
Cramped seating
Waiters too busy to ask if you want dessert
The small tvs. 

Overall:  Great curry flavor and warm Japanese atmosphere.

This is my favorite place to go for Japanese curry. The pricing and portion are just right. I also love how authentic the staff and food is. I've tried other curry places, but they never seem to compare to Curry Zen. This place is becoming one of my favorite places to eat at, in general. I go here at least once a week. I recommend getting the chicken katsu curry plate.

I love me some Japanese curry, so finding a delicious one is key.

My boyfriend and I used to go to a Japapnese curry place in Manhattan a lot during the few months that we lived there called Go-Go Curry. They perhaps had the best Japanese curry I had ever tasted, so when we left NY, that was one of the few restaurants we thought would be hard to replace, until we found Zen Curry.

Now, the flavor is pretty spot on to our favorite curry joint in NY, only suggestion for Zen curry would be to add a little shredded cabbage to the plate. You'd be amazed what that added texture will do for the overall experience.

This place is definitely my favorite in THIS city!

Pretty legit Japanese curry.  I wouldn't say it's comparable to good curry houses in Japan, but it's one of the closest I've come to in the U.S.  I had the beef curry and the beef was cubed a little too large and wasn't really tender enough to easily cut in two.

- The takoyaki is awesome.  Tangy, gooey, just enough octopus, and sauced to perfection
- The fried shumai is ok
- The gyoza is average

- Service is great!

- Value is off the charts

We came here pretty late at night and was not in the mood to wait for food which was perfect because there wasn't a line out the door. The restaurant was small but accommodated around 25-30 people. The service was quick and we got our food pretty quickly. 

We ordered curry with chicken, chicken katsu don, fried oysters, and takoyaki. For the curry with chicken, I thought the plate was large in my opinion and surely should be enough to satisfy your hunger. I thought the curry was flavoured well and the chicken was tender. The chicken katsu don was also a big portion with plenty of egg and rice. I felt so bad I couldn't finish it but there was a good amount of food in that bowl. The katsu don tasted great and reminded me of homestyle cooking. 

The fried oysters came in 3 pieces and was decently priced. I absolutely love takoyaki! It was not too sweet or salty and that dish alone had a good amount of it. Takoyaki is a fun plate to share with a group of friends. 

Overall, cheap place with good food. I recommend coming here especially if you want to take a break from seeing your savings disappear at the casino.

Finally!  A Japanese Curry place in Las Vegas.  I really liked the curry.  It had a nice mix of spices.  My only complaint would be that I think the curry and the chicken/pork katsu I ordered with it could use more salt.  If you want to under salt them for peoples' tastes that's fine, I guess, but put salt shakers on the table.
I was a little surprised you don't get the veggies in the curry that I'm used to.  Also, didn't see an option for some sort of veggie in the curry.  Guess you have to order a salad.
Still...this is just quibbling.  This place is delicious.  If you like Japanese Curry, and you'd be crazy not to, this place will be on your regular spots of places to eat.

Came with friends on a weekend for dinner. Place is pretty small so if you're a big party you might have to wait a lot. Optimal is parties of 4 or less. The parking lot is crazy too because that complex has so many good things in it. This is my first Japanese curry place in vegas and it didn't disappoint. I just wish that they have more creative combinations like curry house in la. This is very traditional, with chicken Katsu, pork Katsu, hamburger steak, and of course the add ons you want like spinach, corn, egg (not soft boiled. Hard boiled) etc. I got the chicken Katsu and it was very moist and flavorful.  My friends got the pork Katsu and hamburger steak and they both enjoyed it. Personally I think the chicken is juicer than the pork. I also had the Takoyaki balls and they were really good. It's like a friend mash potato balls with pieces of octopus in it. Sounds really weird I know but give it a try. 

If you cant eat spicy beware of even ordering a 2. It definitely has a kick to it. The scale is 1 through 10 but a 5 is super super spicy according to the waiter. The one thing I don't like about this place is that they don't automatically give you the pickled radish. If you ask they gave you a small portion of it. I had to ask 3 times cause I love that stuff. They weren't giving me attitude about it but I wish it was just out on the table like kept curry restaurants.
The curry there is really good, and the level of spicy is on point! Enjoyable! Also, great service!
Delicious curry with lots of choices. Very attentive staff. Nice small place with fun atmosphere.

this is the most authentic Japanese curry i could find state side, from CA to LV. the flavor, tenderness of the chicken katsu, spicy levels, and only being offered a spoon to eat your curry is identical to the Coco Ichibanya in Tokyo Japan. the Coco's in LA doesn't even come close to what the Coco's tastes like, and like i said, this is the most authentic i've found thus far.

My favorite order:
Chicken Katsu Curry, spicy level 3, with one order of quail egg kushi, and one extra scoop of rice.

The food is spot on and delicious! Not only is the food good, the customer service is awesome. The cooks, servers, etc are all very polite and sincere, and all of them being able to greet and farewell in the Japanese tongue adds just that bit more of authenticity. Only problem I can see anyone bumping into is the language barrier. Their English isn't horrible, but some of them do have strong accents.

5 out 5 because this place rocks, the people rock, the food rocks, the atmosphere rocks.

I love all kinds of curry, so much so a few recipes I've burned out on we eat it so much. I needed to try something new into our curry rotation. 

The BF and I split our meat toppings of a pork katsu and a tofu cutlet. Pork katsu was crisp and still juicy (which a lot of pork katsus are not). Tofu cutlet was crisp, but still light and was of the silky/soft tofu variety which I much prefer over firm kinds. Curry itself was pretty decent though standard. It's solid for here, but not the best I've had though. I like all the garnishes they set on your table which some curry houses do not do...At least for me, I've never noticed raisins and almonds at other places. Not their fault, but I wish they had my favorite curry topping : an egg. It would really make me a fan. Something about curry rice and egg is perfect. 

We had the coffee jello which was nice, and refreshing to the palette after curry. Halfway eating the waitress asked if we would like more cream for the jello which was a small, but very considerate touch. Really, she was kind and attentive throughout. 

I'm a fan of this place for the humble service you come to expect from Japanese and feel It's a solid and quick lunch plate option.

I recently went on a trip to Japan where I got stuck up about Japanese food.  Sorry 'merica, but even the best Japanese food here is just average food there, lol! 

Anyway, my favorite curry spot when we were in Tokyo was CoCo Curry.  It's a chain there, but the curry is SO good.  The Tonkatsu is SO good - juicy, crispy.  Everything SO good.  So when I got home to Vegas, I was on the hunt for comparable curry.

After trying curry at maybe 2 or 3 spots, I decided to check out Zen Curry.  Not gonna lie, I was slightly disappointed.  The curry didn't have the UMPH I remembered from Japan and the tonkatsu wasn't nearly the same.  HOWEVER, it is good!  Don't get me wrong, its probably the best Japanese curry that Vegas has to offer.  The curry had good flavor and a really nice smooth texture.  The service was aiight... the prices were decent.  I would recommend this place!

My fav thing that we tried was the takoyaki... YUM!  Crispy, creamy inside, bursting with flavor.  Try it.
One of my go to places in Vegas. Disappointed in the service this last time around hence only 4 stars, servers were very inattentive.

This is my favorite Japanese curry place in town. It's a little small so it can get full quickly but once you're in the food is delicious. Huge fan of the Pork Katsu and Chicken Katsu. They also have takeout so you can drop by and get your food to go. On top of all of this the food is really cheap! They also have all kinds of toppings for you to add if toppings are something you like. Definitely recommend this place!

Simple concept. Choose your curry. Heat level and whether you want spinach, veggie, or plain curry. Choose your heat level, I went with 5 and it was pretty spicy. I can handle heat and it was perfect for me. Choose your meat and add your sides. I was surprised they didn't serve gyoza and didn't have the meat combinations set up together but you can just add it on if you want. If you haven't had curry it's like spiced gravy but thicker. Very delicious and comforting. You can also choose white or brown rice which is a nice option. This parking lot gets packed so if you can't find a spot park on the street next to the parking lot and walk over not a long walk but this place gets packed since Monta, Raku and Kung du tea are just some of the places with heavy traffic. Thinking of curry is making me crave some. Good thing we keep it stocked in my house. Probably gonna make some now ;)

The tofu curry is just insane...the consistency of the flavor and cleanness and pureness of the batter is so amazing every time!!! This is one of our MUST GO PLACES every time we travel to Vegas!! This is even better than any curry places we have gone to in LA at Little Tokyo...its seriously that good!! You know some places have batter which tastes oily or gets worse throughout the day, there is zero salty or stale oil flavor here...actually there is zero oil flavor...the batter is so light and crisp day or night!! I also highly recommend their tofu salad, its so refreshing to your palate before you eat the Japanese curry...the pork is also super tender as well...there is really no going wrong but someone MUST get the tofu curry just so everyone can have a bite!!

Bomb. Good is always served timely, even for take out. Chicken and cheese is the way to go. In my opinion best Japanese Curry in Las Vegas. One week I had it 5 days in a row for Lunch at Planet Mazda.
Very nice staff. Cute place. Very small and tight. Delicious food. Found hair in one of my meals. Asked staff about it, they apologized and made me a new dish and added tempura shrimp as compliments.

I usually don't go and eat in sit-down restaurants by myself, to avoid looking like a complete loser, but for here I make the exception!
Everything on the menu is Japanese curry, coming with a choice of pork, chicken, vegetable, and whole bunch of other selections. The spicy scale is from 1-10, but it doesn't come that spicy, I'd say the 7 is their 'medium'.
The chicken katsu curry is on point, that is the one I always get and it's a good dish for first-timers to try.
The service is fast and friendly, it's a small establishment so it's almost always crowded, expect a wait.

Zen Curry! I had been curious since they placed the sign up and I was curious to try it out but I never seemed to have the time.

One day my best friend and I were headed over to Monta Ramen... starving and what not.. and realized maybe it wasn't the greatest idea with 10 parties ahead of us. PERFECT TIMING TO TRY THAT RESTAURANT!!!!

So we walked over and browsed the menu, checked Yelp! and went on in. We were lucky that it wasn't too busy. We were seated promptly by Jason Kim and were served our beverages immediately. The quaintness of the curry shop was GREAT. My friends and I are always looking for comfortable restaurants with welcoming atmospheres. The chef and owner came and greeted us personally which I felt was rare in most restaurants. 

I ordered the pork cutlet curry with potato croquette, and Di had the chicken cutlet with potato croquette. The curry was delicious and they had everything you needed to customize to your preference! They had their own mild blend of spices, the medium, the spicy, raisins, and almonds. The service was very prompt and since the restaurant is small, it felt very personal. The prices are awesome too, I think we paid about $10 for each plate.

Since I had seen on Yelp! that someone else recommended trying their specials... I came back several days later to try the Spinach Curry. I LOVED that they were consistent with the flavor and texture of the curry. I also tried their Curry Pan.. which is a fried pastry with a bit of their curry. IT IS AWESOME! I'm on a diet but I bought two to-go so I could eat them at work the next day! 

LOVE THIS PLACE :)

Never mind the small location (which has since been renovated from the size of a broom closet to the size of the coat closet... Lol). It's all about that dreamy sauce. Put it on a shoe, I'd be tempted (only briefly), but ladle it on a piece of perfectly crisp and succulent chicken or pork and it's curry nirvana for me (Japanese kind, not any other kind). If I could I would eat here twice a week but I have to settle with once a week (when I can). Everyone who I've brought here (I myself was brought too) has since returned in the same week they went the first time. IT'S THAT GOOD

Curry/Katsu has got to be one of the most simple and delicious meals out there. 

I ordered:

TOFU KATSU- It was between this or the shrimp Katsu for me and I'm definitely glad I got the tofu! Being a pescatarian there wasn't much options but I didn't mind because I was fine with tofu, shrimp, and the potential option of adding on items. I got a spiciness level of 5 which wasn't too bad at all. The flavors were perfect and the amount of rice to tofu to sauce ratio was amazing! 

CUSTOMER SERVICE- The service was a bit slow but the food made up for it.

Partied too hard?  You know, dinner, ultra lounge, casino gaming for pre-gaming, a club, an after hours club.  Mobile filled with numbers of people called "the hot one", "the hot hot one", "the hottest one".  Enter Japanese Curry Zen; cure for a hangover and tragically lighter money clip.

The dish is simple.  Rice with plain curry topped with mostly deep fried goodies.

Ordering:
1.  Choose the size:  small $3.75, regular $5.95, or extra rice plus $1.00.
2.  Choose the heat level (this is Japanese not Thai.  J-Level 10 = T-Level 4 AND the taste is altered).
3.  Select toppings (braised beef, chicken, pork or tofu katsu, deep fried shrimp, potato croquette, or vegetables); $2.00 - $6.50.
4.  Done.

Typical Japanese curry (viscous, vegetable base with a complex, aromatic blend of Indian spices and a gentle heat).  No coconut milk, no painful chilies in the mix.  Everyday quality short grain white or brown rice.  The braised beef, tender, fall apart goodness.  The fried items, crunchy on the outside, correctly cooked on the inside.  The veg, cooked to death, very soft and lending their flavor to the mix.  A single order of any topping is enough to fill most up.  Typical offering of pickled veg and raisins at the table.

Multiple visits, very consistent.

A simple meal, done right.

The portions don't look like much, the plate is very shallow but when you finished the curry dish, you are stuffed!

Very good Japanese curry, not much veggies but very rich and thick.  The plates start off around $6 or so, but add a dollar or so for an add-on.

Also ordered the fried oyster special 6 for $6.  The oysters were on the small side but very crispy and juicy on the inside.  A good choice to compliment your curry meal.

Another excellent option in the heart of Las Vegas Chinatown.

I've only ever tasted Japanese curry in Los Angeles which is pretty hard to compete with. Japanese Curry Zen has exceeded all my expectations! So yummy! Came into a quaint and traditional Japanese style restaurant and was immediately greeted with a warm smile. Luigi was my waiter and was exceptional in every way. I'm personally in the service industry and I can say with confidence that the flow of my service was spectacular. He met ever demand with ease and has a very genuine/kind way about him. THE CURRY! So delicious! I got vegetable curry, spice level 7, with a chicken katsu. The chicken Katsu in itself was something to praise. All white meat with a good amount of chicken in between the outer crust. It was perfectly golden! Everything about this place was amazing! My friend's and I will definitely be spending a fair amount of time here in the future.

This is the best homemade Japanese curry we've ever had. Everything comes together perfectly: the fry cook does their job admirably (GBD without overcooking the contents), the homemade curry is a perfect melding of flavors, and the service is prompt. Surprisingly, even the hot tea from an oolong tea bag was pretty good.

There aren't a ton of seats so you might end up waiting a few minutes, but be patient, it's worth the wait.

PS: I'm not sure what it is about this little strip mall, but it's densely packed with a ton of 4+ star Yelp reviews. There's Monta Ramen, an Asian fusion restaurant called Big Wong, a snow-ice place, a boba tea place amusingly called Kung Fu Tea, and the one-and-only Raku.  This may be one of the densest Yelp stars per square foot I've ever seen.
Great authentic Japanese curry. Chicken Katsu curry with veggies, yummy!! Even the potato Croquette is delish!

2016 Yelp 100 Review Challenge 70/100

My Hawai'i friends were in town and this is their fave place for Japanese Curry in Vegas! It was my first time here, I'm not usually a fan of curry (had a bad experience) but when I tried Curry Zen it was onoliscious and I surprisingly, cleaned my plate! 

I got the curry with spinach and scrambled eggs and brown rice. It comes with a few slices of tomato as well. The curry for this plate is a darker color than the usual brown that's served with the other curry plates. I'm keeping it healthy these days, so I'm glad I saw this vegetarian option on the menu! I enjoyed it and like I said I cleaned off all the curry on my plate. It was flavorful. The brown rice was cooked well too and went well with the spinach and curry. 

I also appreciated the health benefits of spices in their curry, listed on their menu.  And they use a vegetable broth for their curry. I wish I had seen the mixed multi grain rice, I would've ordered that instead of the brown rice. 

Had the fried gyoza as well, and it was just okay. I've had better, but nothing bad about this one. 

5 star friendly service here. Kind, friendly and welcoming Japanese servers. Our server was awesome. It's a small restaurant, able to fit maybe 30 patrons at most, so there may be a wait. We went during lunch time and it was busy. They also serve Japanese beer, sake and wine, so you can get your drink on. 

Next time I'm here, I'm looking forward to trying the curry pan, mixed grain rice, and other fried options.

I love this place so much. The serving size is perfect to get me filled up. I always get the chicken Katsu curry with cheese. 

The food is phenomenal, it definitely is homemade. Also the owner is always working and is the main reason your food is amazing! Great guy with an authentic restaurant that makes you feel happy when you arrive and when you leave.

This is the first time I've tried curry of any sort. My bf & I ordered the pork curry (5 spicy), chicken katsu curry (3 spicy), spam on the side & takoyaki. The fried spam & the curry sauce were my favorite. I ordered the takoyaki on a whim cuz it looked good & didn't really ask what it was. Personally I thought it was gross, it's not for everybody lol.

I am not much of a curry person, but my friend wanted to go here so I agreed. It was pretty good. The small size was still pretty good sized hehe. I came like a couple years ago when it was just this tiny little place, but they have extended it and the decoration is awesome. The service was great! Rui was so nice and helped me pick a dish because I was so unsure. I will come back to try the tako yaki :)

Zen on Spring Mountain has excellent Japanese style curry and many simple options for everyone. 

This is a great place to also try curry if you've never had curry before. I suggest the chicken katsu if you're a first timer to curry. 

Zen also offers great specials off the menu, such as the curry udon. 

The staff is friendly and service is fast!

My first time eating Japanese Curry!

I have to say, if one were to compare them to Thai, Indian, or other curries I've had in the past, Japanese curry seemed more bland and thick, almost like a gravy.

They had plenty of seasoning shakers on the table though, so a few sprinkles of extra hot woke up the dish, and it was very enjoyable!

We tried a little bit of everything here, with Cathy ordering the Pork cutlet, Chicken Cutlet, Kurobuta Sausage and Croquette for us to try. It was cooked well, with lots of juicy meat and great flavor in the breading. 

This place is super tiny, so not for the claustrophobic...but a great place to get some good eats for not much money!

Almost don't wanna write a review for this place for fear that next time I come back it will be over crowded and ill have to wait in long lines. 

That being said, definitely a gem in Vegas. If you know what curry house (Hawaii establishment) is then you will welcome this new place especially when it starts to get cold out! 

Menu is pretty small but they know what they are good at and stick to it. I love the fact that they offer brown rice as an alternative to white rice, important to me because I try and cut carbs when reasonable. Lol. 

I love the pork katsu and curry with cheese so much, I ordered one to take home and eat the next morning...sadly it doesn't microwave very well (pork cutlet drys up in the microwave) :( but I was happy none the less to make this my last meal in Vegas before catching a 2pm flight.

I like everything about Zen. My co-workers go at least once a week. Stand-outs include the Curry Pan, 16 grain rice, and the TOFU!

Las Vegas Locals know what's up.

Such a nice restaurant with really great food with great staff showing great customer service.

This place specializes in curry which is very similar to CoCo Ichibanya. Their whole menu and ordering system is also very similar. You get to choose the spicy level with extra charge and you can also add toppings as you like such as pork katsu, croquette, corn and etc.

I really enjoyed my Chicken Katsu Curry with spicy level 2 since I cant really eat spicy food. Anyway, it was perfect to my liking and the katsu was large and the meat was very tender. Curry was very simple but had the taste of curry and it wasnt missing anything though it just looks BROWN.

The guy server who was shorter than the other guy (there were two), was super super nice and kind. I enjoyed my dinner a lot more because of his attentive service and his kindness. He filled up my water cup even before I asked. I drink lots of water so thats always a plus!

I will come back here and tell my friends to visit when they come to Vegas!
This is my favorite Japanese curry in town. It's super clean, super friendly staff, and QUICK! The food here is amazing. Try the chicken katsu curry (spicy level 7)!! It's superb.

Time and time again, Curry Zen delivers the best tasting curry and perfectly prepared and cooked pork and croquette.  The tofu salad has amazing tasting dressing (sesame) and the lettuce and ingredients come out ice cold and crispy.  Absolutely love the sound of the crunch of fresh, cold iceberg lettuce.  Easing over to Kung Fu Tea, in the same center for boba to fight the heat and spice.

There's not a lot of places in Vegas that serve japanese curry compared to LA so I was super happy that I found this place. The place is small but the food makes up for it. The servers are nice and friendly. The food is nicely proportioned but I do wish they would add more meat. My fave japanese curry place in vegas!

Japanese Curry is one of the only  curries I like.  I don't like thai curry or indian curry, so i had to try this place.   If you notice my other reviews it's like i never left this mall. And yes, I almost ate at every location in this mall.   I came here right when they opened for and early lunch.  I got the  Veggie curry with the croquette and i added corn and had it with brown rice. My friend had the chicken katsu curry with a croquette.  You can choose your spice level.   They said that 5 is pretty spicy so keep that in mind.   The dish was really good, and because i had a sore throat i wasn't able to finish it.  The brown rice actually went pretty good with the curry and they didn't charge us extra for the brown rice.   It's a great place to come on a cold day.  The service was great and the place was clean. I would return there the next time i'm back.

Basic, nothing special.  If you want more bang for your buck, just mosey on over to Greenland and pick up a pork cutlet and package of curry mix.  Make yourself the same thing -- either 4 days of food for yourself, or a curry party for your friends.  I'm not saying curry zen was bad...but seriously something easy to DIY.  But if you don't have the time, then Curry Zen is your spot.

I have quickly become a fan of Curry with Chicken and brown rice. The service in this establishment is very attentive, friendly and outgoing. I have been here several times and they have never disappointed with service and quality of food. The business is clean and maintains clean restrooms!

My favorites are the Chicken Katsu Curry or the meatloaf with brown rice.

My favorite server is the always smiling Misaki (I hope I spelled it correctly).

The service is top notch

I actually lived in Japan for almost 3 years when I was stationed there for the US Navy. So I know a thing or two about Japanese Curry, as this is one of their most popular dishes besides Sushi. This place is authentic as it gets! It's run by a small Japanese family and gets real Japanese customers. (A great sign of authenticity with ethnic food)

The inside of the restaurant is fairly small (reminds me of the small restaurants that are common in rural parts of Japan) The decor isn't fancy like other curry houses and not as nice. It's just a simple place to enjoy great food. The staff especially the guy who takes our order are especially nice all the time and makes sure to check up on all the customers often.

The condiments are on the house, and I always load on the the pickled baby onions and curry powders. The flavor of the curry itself is perfect. I usually order the pork cutlet (chicken cutlet is a healthier option, and tastes just as good) with white rice, corn, sausage, and steamed veggies. They give you a very generous portion for the price, and I always leave this place fully stuffed and satisfied.

This 18-seater is quite the little gem. I can appreciate a simple menu. I noticed the Chef giving his food approval before serving it. On one occassion, he came out to ask how things were and then thanked us for coming. Very nice.  

Pros
+ Great food
+ Reasonably priced
+ Attentive service

Cons
- Limited seating

Tucked away in little China Town is this gem! I don't normally do curry, or at least I though I didn't until I tried this place. It's ridiculously fresh and delicious. Plus their open late so that is a plus for most. Potato croquettes are the best. I literally have to have 2 every time I come! Staff is cool. Sometimes there is a wait but it's never more than 8-10 minutes. Place is small, but you have enough room to be comfortable and enjoy such a good meal.

Very welcoming atmosphere. The waitress was nice, informative, and kept checking on us with the willingness to talk even though the place was packed. The curry always makes me happy no matter what mood I may have previously been in. There's just something special about it, perhaps made with chef's love for cooking :)? We didn't enjoy the Croquette, but maybe it's just because we aren't fans of the specific fillings in it? It's nice to try new things and I'm thankful I was able to find it here!

This place is great. Every time I'm in Vegas I can't decide to go to Monta or this place (Monta usually wins). But one day I decided to go here since I already had my Monta fix that weekend. I was not disappointed. The curry is flavorful, best I've ever had. The spice level of the curry is actually spicier than other curry places I've been too. I always get spice level 10 at curry places and don't really feel a kick, but this place does have a decent kick for me at level 10. I had the Chicken Katsu w/ Kushi 5pc add on. Everything was still crispy till the end of the meal, Chicken was moist, and i loved the quail eggs. Service was excellent and food comes out pretty fast. This place would probably be one of places I must go while I'm in Vegas

We decided to try this place on one of those rare rainy days in Las Vegas. My boyfriend and I both had the chicken katsu with curry. One curry at #4 spice and the other at #5. The chicken is nicely breaded and fried fresh and slightly crispy. The curry tastes just like the authentic Japanese curry we've had several times in Japan. Probably because it is! The shumai was also a tasty appetizer. The mustard flavor with the shoyu is a nice combination with the pork. Nice, hot, spicy, and just all-around good food! We will be back.

Whenever I go out to eat, I make sure that the food that I chose to get is something unique and something that I could not be able to make at home myself. Upon arriving I came in with a group of seven, we were placed right in the middle of the restaurant. We waited for about ten to fifteen minutes before ordering and I ordered the Chicken Katsu with an addition of sausage. I did not get any spicy level because it being my first time I wanted to taste the curry itself. We waited for another fifteen minutes until our food came and we still didn't have our napkins/ eating utensils. So when we asked for that and the pickled ginger we didn't touch our food probably until eight minutes after it came out. Service was a bit slow in the beginning but our server was very nice. 

The food is a 3/5. Like I have mentioned before, I go out to eat especially to new places to determine if their food is worthy of being unique, meaning I wouldn't be able to replicate back at home. However, this curry was something that I knew I or my family could make at home. Of course it was good but there wasn't anything that stood out to me. Their chicken katsu was the same as well as their sausages. I paid about $3 extra for three pieces of sausages. Towards the end I didn't finish eating my curry because the rice/ curry ratio was completely off. There were more curry and meat itself than rice so that was frustrating. I pushed the curry to the side to see where the rice line ended and it didn't cover at least half the plate, it was about 1/4 of it. The food was overall okay, I just wished my rice ratio and sausage portion was bigger and the curry stood out opposed to thinking about "I could make this at home" type of thought. Calculating my bill without tip it came out to about $16. The plate is big but with the actually quality in the curry plates it does not break even to the amount you pay vs. what you get. Waiting for our checks and paying alone took longer than us eating, which we were confused about. We seen other people go got their checks after a leave the store before us.
I'm picking up vegetable curry with chicken tenderloin and chicken tenderloin with curry. I love the curry here. The Katsu is delicious too.

ordered a level 7 spiciness beef curry (which was the type of spiciness that builds up with each bite and might possibly give you heartburn) with chicken katsu and it was one of the best curry houses i've eaten at. This tastes like nothing I would make from a box at home. It's ~6.95 with just curry and rice. ~9.95 for beef curry with rice and you can add a chicken katsu for an additional $3.

the takoyaki is ~$4.95 and still one of my favorite things to eat. I wish they had okonomiyaki but no.. 

They don't serve ginger with your food but if you would like ginger, let them know. 

The peach jello sake was also delicious.
Got the Chicken Tender curry level 2 hot, it was on point, I recommend it, it's located in a small shopping center so I recommend parking on the outside. You'll enjoy the Asahi on draft.

We always seem to end up here on every trip to Vegas. I might because one of my buddies thanks is the best place in the entire world. It's pretty good we always just get the Chicken and Curry.   I always get a 2 or 3 hotness.    Be careful not to go to high...    :)   Good food, we will be back.

Just like CoCo Curry in Japan!  Only smaller!  

Service is always fast and good. 

Japanese style curry that be beat!  

We are here at least once a week.

Got takeout of veggie curry and curry udon. Didn't get to eat until like 30 mins later but everything was still super warm and perfect. So good and hit the spot. Lots of veggies, good amount, great taste. Want to go back tmrw!
They need to expand, the place is so small. other than that staff is always nice, they're decently priced and menu is also great!

Saw a friend bookmarking this place so I sent him a message through Yelp; one day later, I am here at Japanese Curry Zen with my sis and friends. The moment I sat down, I noticed right away how clean the table was. It was so clean and shiny, it glistened under the fluorescent lighting. 

They have a very limited menu consisting of several fried meat/protein options to go with your rice curry. I got to taste the vegetable curry, chicken and quail curry as well as my dish, the tofu curry. I think my favorite is the vegetable curry since it was the most flavorful out of the three. I also tried the coffee jelly and loved it! All of the items we ordered were very very delicious and well deserved the high ratings from everyone. 

Come here if you're in the mood for some comfort food. Don't forget to try the yellow (medium spicy) spice mix on the table. It smelled so darn good I wish I could take the whole bottle home.

Japanese Curry Zen was a pleasant surprise for my group and I on our last trip to Vegas.  My group has come to the conclusion that they add crack to their curry sauce.  The first bite is nice and flavorful; however, as you continue downing your meal, you find yourself becoming more and more addicted with each bite!  It doesn't really matter what meat/vegetables you order; it is definitely the curry sauce that makes the meal here.  Thinking about the curry right now while writing this review is making me want to go back to Vegas just to have some more of it. Yum!

Note: Their curry spice levels are pretty spicy in general; two people in our party ordered level 3 (out of 10), and they already thought that was pretty spicy.  I ordered a 5 and was sweating quite a bit by the end of my meal as well.

Another note:  The place is pretty darn small, so don't be surprised if you end up needing to wait a little bit to get a seat!

I come to this place everytime I'm Vegas, and they never disappoint. The curry is as authentic as authentic can be! If you been to Japan and been to cocos curry, this is 98% similar! They renovated the place since I last been here, it is much nicer.

Superb authentic curry straight from Nippon!!! It was very spicy. I got level 5 and I was breaking a sweat. It was like I just did a workout. I got the chicken katsu dish. The other meats looked good though. The atmosphere was very chill and relaxing. The staff was very helpful and kind. This is my new favorite restaurant in LV!!!!
I had tonkatsu curry few days ago. They serve me a rock hard tonkatsu that I have couldn't chew on!

...for those who dont know curry and pork are HUGE in Japan...that said the food is decent...reminds me of one of the restaurants I have seen in many Japanese films where the working class guy just sits down to have a brief respite from the world and enjoy a meal...delightful

I came here on a Tuesday afternoon and ordered 
1. Original Curry, 5.95
- Pork Cutlet: 3.50 
2. Original Curry, 5.95
- Chicken Cutlet: 3.00 
for 22.89

- Came during lunch, around 1pm, a little packed. We were seated on a small table for 2. 
- Takaya was our server. fine service. 
- No extra charge for dicon, scallions, almonds
- Crispy cutlet. 
- Little portion. I counted the slices on my plate. Sigh....
- Original curry was good! But Kaba Curry had corn and vegetables without paying extra. 
- Presentation was nice. 
- Stomach left unsatisfied. Definitely need to pay more to get a better experience. Lame. 
- Expensive for 2. I'd rather just go to Tonkatsu Kiyoshi. Kaba has better value.

Ordered Kushi Katsu, the pork curry, and one of their appetizers on special. Everything was great, but just about everything on their menu was fried, which was a bit off-putting. Bottom line, delicious fried food, but not a big selection. On the plus side, they do serve alcohol!

This place is amazing. The curry isn't traditional Japanese style. They use garam masala, which is Indian. You can even get naan, but all the other ingredients are Japanese. I got curry udon, which already has scallions and pork. Then you can pick from quite a few different additions, so I went with corn, breaded pork katsu, and kurobuta sausage. Went with spice level 10, which had decent kick, but I also added some of what was in the shaker on the table, pretty sure it was cayenne. There's a sweet and salty Japanese sauce as well. Throw in some gyoza, which were as good as any I've had anywhere, and takoyaki (fried octopus balls, and it was a great meal for a great price.

One of my favorite foods when I lived in Japan was curry. I love so many different Japanese dishes but that is the one thing that is pretty hard to find in many places in the U.S. I was thrilled to find Japanese curry zen. For anyone who's had Japanese curry I assure you this place is exactly what you are looking for if you have that craving, and  for anyone who has never had it before it's definitely worth it to try some new delicious Japanese food.

I skipped lunch so by the time I got to JCZ, I was famished.  At 5pm, the place was empty but I can imagine it can get easily packed at normal dining hours since it only has a few tables and a bar.  This is located in the same complex as Monta, Raku, Trattoria Nakamura-ya and Kabuto.

I was fiddling around with the condiments, raisins and almonds that were on the table.  I ordered a pork cutlet with brown rice, corn and croquette - and no, I didn't have to use any of the condiments.  It tasted great on its own and it was filling.  My bro-in-law got the chicken cutlet with white rice, cheese and corn which he annihilated in a few minutes!  The curry was spicier than what I'm used to (I'm a wimp when it comes to spicy food) but I didn't mind.  On the back of the menu is a list of spices they use for their curry and what health benefits you could get from each spice which I thought was pretty interesting.  I thought my Chinese grandmother was just making stuff up when I was little!

Our server, Jason, was great and easy on the eyes.  The chef came out of the kitchen to personally thank us for coming.  More people started coming in as we were getting ready to leave.

Curry use to be the one thing I didn't want, but this place changed my mind. The curry here has a lot of flavor but isn't too overpowering like many other places. I'm def not a curry expert but I like the food here.

Food
-katsu curry- yum, the curry goes great with katsu and rice. I like how the katsu isn't breaded too thickly. The only drawback is they don't give you that much katsu, and there are no vegetables. 
-katsu don- good flavor with a decent amount of food. Meat was a little dry though 
-tako yaki- yum

Service- service is usually good, friendly waiters who do their best to accommodate you. I like how they split the bill for you. 

Environment- nice and clean, fair amount of tables. Parking lot is small and crowded though. 

Overall, this place gave me a new perspective on curry. They offer good food and service.

Tasty as can be!!! addicted ? maybe just a little. Small place but clean and busy all the time . Thumbs up! My Favorite is  Chicken Katsu Curry. Spicy level number 1... just the right amount of kick. Staff is great and service is fast. Each visit leaves me wanting more.

Last year, this restaurant ignited my unknown love for Japanese curry and now I can't get enough of it. It is a blessing and a curse that I hate the parking situation of the plaza it's in or else I would be eating here far too often. The parking lot has the potential of being a pain based on the hour of the day; however, the food here is definitely worth.

It's a cozy, small restaurant. There have been times when there's a wait; however, the maximum time that I've waited was fifteen minutes and a majority of the time, we were seated immediately. Please note that every time that I've been here, it was for lunch. The service is always super friendly and fast!

I can't lie and say that I've tried and loved everything on the menu simply because I order the same thing every single time - chicken katsu curry with the spice level at three. The portion is fair and fills me up about halfway through the meal. The chicken is crispy and goes so, so well with the curry sauce and rice. You can pick and choose your toppings with their popular ones being corn and cheese, but I love a fried egg on top! 

I would definitely give this place a try whether you're an avid curry lover or it's something that you've never had!
One of my favorite places to eat Japanese curry. I get the chicken katsu curry with a level 2 on their spicy level. The dish is simple but very good

This place is great. Went for Udon next door but wait was to long. So thought what the heck lets try this place. Use to curry all the time when I was stationed in Japan. But as years pass you forget how good it is. This place was fast, easy to order, and quick as we were on lunch break. Bring the kids back on my time they'll love it as I do.

I am a very critical when it comes to Japanese curry. I love Japanese curry, but I feel very loyal to Curry house so I compare everything to Curry house.

I came here with my friends for a late lunch while we were in Vegas. I got the spiciest level of curry here. I love spicy food. It was a good spice level. 

I got the standard chicken katsu curry. Portions are pretty big here.  it was pretty good, but the flavor of the curry was okay.

If tasty, fast and simple is what you are after, look no further. This hidden gem offers a flavorful twist to the curry most of us are used to and couples it with tasty protein choices. The service is excellent and the prices are very economical. You must check this place out!

There is Japanese curry, and then there is Japanese Curry Zen. Big difference. With one bite of their delicious curry, I was completely sold. You can just taste the quality of their curry in its thick texture and genuine flavor.

I always have the Chicken Katsu with curry. Their curry has a small kick to it, so keep that in mind when you are ordering. Luckily, you can customize the spiciness. I usually get spicy-level 3, the perfect amount of spicy (and tasty!). Sometimes when I'm extra hungry, I will add corn or vegetables to my meal. There are lots of other sides you can choose from though, so feel free to build-your-own-plate. They also have two types of pickled radishes on the tables. The waiters are always so accommodating to refill them since we really love our radishes.

Overall, great service and even better curry. Hubby & I can be spotted here regularly. What can we say, it's our go-to spot for genuine, Japanese curry!

I originally ordered two original curries from Postmates, but when the order arrived there was only one curry. This didn't upset me, I know people make mistakes and it probably could've been the Postmates driver's fault. So I call Curry Zen, explain my dilemma and ask if I can go pick up my second order, they agree and so I head over. I walk in and as I'm waiting I make eye contact with two waitresses yet I'm not greeted, I wait a bit longer and two couples enter behind me. One of the waitresses goes up to the couples and seats them completely ignoring me.  At this point I'm furious for having to drive across town to just be ignored. After seating them, they continue to ignore me until I finally go up to one of them and ask to speak to a manager. This waitress completely disregards my question and simply says "How can I help you?"  I tell her I called earlier about my order being incomplete and she walks away to get my order. Finally the server comes back with my meal but I ask her that I think it would be fair if they give me a sort of credit for all the trouble they had put me through, she struggles to understand what I'm saying (there may have been a language barrier) and says no. She then calls another server to help (I'm assuming the manager). The next server is quite nice and provides me with an extra order for all the trouble, I then thank her and leave. I finally get home and when eating my curry I come to find out that it is extremely spicy though I had ordered no spice (level 3). So I end up having to throw my meal away because I tend to get sick from eating food that is too spicy. I feel as if they purposely did this for asking for some sort of compensation, which I think is ridiculous after everything they put me through. I wasted an hour and a half of my time and money that I'll never get back. I'm hoping this was just a fluke, but I hope they read this and not let some other poor soul go through what I had to.

Curry Zen is always going to be my favorite Japanese Curry Place. The parking is tough. The Restaurant is located in a small plaza with a bunch of other good places to eat. The service is always quick and the servers are very nice. I'm always getting regular curry with brown rice with spam. Get the Japanese pickles and a curry pan!

I am by no means an afficionado on Japanese style curry. For the most part I don't even like Japanese curry. I do however like Curry Zen very much. I like that they put out all of the condiments for their curries on the table. Their radish dish is usually decimated between the group. The raisins and almonds give the meal a textural change. 

The portions are more than reasonable and often filling. The flavor is the main reason why I keep coming back. For someone who boldly states his dislike for any dish, I will continue to try it until someone proves me wrong. Maybe I just had bad versions in the past. That is not the case here. I had to wait and sit on this review for some time just to make sure that the experience was consistent.

What I find most appealing about this place is the level of service. The food comes out quickly. The presentation is neat. The staff is friendly. The chef is so humble and comes out to thank his diners at the end of the meal. It is a warm atmosphere. With the new addition, it can easily seat more. It is just another great establishment for a jammed pack powerhouse of a plaza.

One of the best curry restaurants I've been to! I normally get chicken katsu curry with spicy level 8-10. The spicy level is from 0 (least spicy) and 10 (super spicy) but 8-10 is not hot to the point that you can't even enjoy it. The restaurant is not that big so it can get packed during lunch peak time. Customer service 10/10, food quality 10/10

The concept of Zen is something I've never given much thought to or belief in.  It sounds nice and all (understatement of the year?), but frankly I'm too concerned with work, beating the next level of Candy Crush (427!), and watching every minute of every NFL game possible to give any time towards self-meditation.   Total enlightenment can wait, the Browns vs Jaguars is on the NFL Network.   Who would have known I would take the first step towards this total enlightenment in the form of an hour lunch break at a curry joint on Spring Mountain?

Holy Buddha is this curry legit!  The broth contains more spices than Snoop Lion's tour bus, and each has health benefits if you're to believe the back of the menu and table displays.   I believe! The first time I went with what Tetsuro P proclaimed to be the best item there which was the pork cutlet.  I also added spinach and requested brown rice.  Each and every piece of pork was perfectly cooked, juicy and flavorful.   The spinach sopped up lots of the broth and the combination of all the components on the plate was a revelation.  Even better, they provide several additional fixings at no cost including raisins, almonds, and some japanese pickled veggies.   I tried incorporating each and every one in different ways and I'm not exaggerating when I say every single bite was delicious.  You couldnt mess this broth up if you TRIED.  Next time I'm bringing some durian and gummy bears and dropping them in and seeing what happens.   Odds are it'll still be delicious.   On the 2nd visit I tried the Beef, and it was as good as I expected even if I preferred the pork cutlet overall.   

As an added bonus the service is incredible.   Greeted warmly when I enter, making sure no drink or side is ever empty, and a gracious goodbye upon exiting.   It doesn't get any better

When I think back upon my two incredible experiences here, I now find myself sometimes staring blankly into my computer screen at work, mouth watering from the thought of this wonderful restaurant.  Mind and body united in want of curry drenched pork cutlet.   Total enlightenment achieved.
Just let me say bunch of idiots here I order to go ordered a chicken Katsu curry open getting home and ready to eat I got my curry but no chicken bunch of idiots but other then that the food is good

So basically I ate about 2 1/2 pieces of 8 of the Crispy chicken curry with rice and it tasted like paper and chewy or gummy! So I kindly asked if I could order another type of meat instead because I always get pork (which is usually great) I just decided to try chicken since the pork was so good. But I was wrong in my opinion the chicken tastes really processed or fake. So they refuse to give me pork because I was unhappy with the chicken, unless I bought it again at that moment. I thought since I came here literally 4 days in a row they'd be like sure since I am a loyal customer basically. But they just went from a 5  to 2  automatically because the customer should always get what they want if they're paying for what they're eating. Anyways the pork is good the chicken just taste fake like paper or whatever. Sad I loved them until now with that bull ish.

BLUF: Try it. The curry is delicious and reasonably priced.

This was my first experience with Japanese curry and it didn't disappoint.

Parking in this area isn't the greatest. There's a large quantity of restaurants in the area and we had to search out a spot. Once inside, it took maybe five minutes for a table to open up, which was better than expected. It's a smaller restaurant so I could see them being pretty busy at times. 

The food was great. I got the curry udon and tried some of my friends katsudon. The curry udon had a great flavor. I would definitely get that again but I'd probably get a side of rice to go with it to mix up the flavors and textures a little next time. The Katsudon was delicious. It was cooked perfectly and had this kind of sweet but not normal sweet taste to it that I loved. Also something I would definitely get again.

I wanted to try some of the appetizers as well, but figured the portions would be a good size. One appetizer to 3-4 people would probably make more sense unless you are local or are in a hotel where you can take leftovers with you.

Ok this is a 3.5 star review. I really wanna go with 4 but then I feel I'm not being true to the other places I gave a 4 star too because they were exceptional. But this place is a very good place for curry. Given the selection in Vegas it's probably one of the best. I've been here more than a few times if that tells you anything. The curry is pretty good and consistent in flavor each time. I really like the curry udon but my girlfriend thinks it's only ok. But hey when do couples ever agree. It's a pretty good place and it will definitely take care of your curry craving.
Awesome curry plates. Be careful when choosing the spice level; I got a 6, and I was sweating like crazy. Service was really good.

I've been going to Curry Zen to fulfill my Japanese curry cravings and it's probably one of the best spots in Vegas to do so! The curry isn't heavy and leaves me wanting more! I usually get the Tonkatsu Curry for ~$10 and it fills me up! I wish the size of the tonkatsu was just a bit bigger though! I've also tried the 3 piece Kushikatsu (Deep fried zucchini, quail egg, and chicken skewer). I didn't enjoy the kushikatsu as much unfortunately so I probably won't get it again - mostly because the chicken was pretty tough and chewy and it was a lot of quail egg for me to finish lol. The service is always fast and friendly so this is a great place to grab a quick bite!
I had chicken katsu curry and it tasted just like the curry in Japan. If I lived around here,  it would be one of my go to places!

I've never had curry much up until now but everything is perfect here from the food to the service. Got the chicken curry with a 3pc kushi and I've eaten at this place 2 times within the last week love the consistency of the flavors.

UPDATED - they have expanded since I wrote this review (reason why I rated it a 4 versus 5). Plus!

I came across this place when the wait next door at Monta was too long and I must say I am glad I decided to eat here. The curry is amazing and I like that they give you the option to get brown rice. Spice level is 1-10 but don't be fooled. I usually love spicy food  and even when I get food with a spice level from 1-10 (for instance thai) I get a 7. But here, I get 3. I knocked off a star because the seating in this place is minimal. I usually go here for lunch as it's right across from work but I try to arrive a little early. Also, the portion size is great and the price is affordable for lunch!

Good variety of menu items also offers lighter versions. My favorite is the spinach curry with the katsu and the croquette. The only reason I docked one star is because of the spicy levels. Its never consistent and they charge u for extra spice levels 5 to 10.
Unfortunately I'm not a big fan of this place. The ambience and mood isn't as great as Kaba Curry. I had the chicken katsu with curry and the curry tasted water down.

Love this place! 

I am a huge fan of hole in the wall specialty Japanese restaurants (Monta, Ichiza, etc) so I decided to try this place out.

Prices are super cheap, the dish is very filling, and extremely good! They even have a brown rice option if you are looking to avoid white rice. (Huge plus in my opinion.)

Staff was super nice, and the owner (possibly also the chef?) even checked up on us to see if we were enjoying the food. I know sometimes people do not like Asian restaurants because of the service, but this is one of the only ones with great service. 

I would like to see some more items added to the menu sometime in the future so that when I get tired of gorging myself on curry I can still come and enjoy a meal. (Or even more options for dessert.)

If you like curry, this place is a must go!

Went with a group for a birthday and we got chicken katsu curry, 5 piece kushi curry, katsu don, croquette, sausages, tofu katsu, spinach curry x2 (all spice level 4). 

The flavor was rich and everything delicious! The katsu breading were perfectly crispy. They are salted just right and portion sizes are not too large nor too small. Prices are reasonable. 

Food coma is kicking in... zzz

World's best curry place ... We love this place ... Amazing staff .. Specially Mr. Zen ... If we ever had to go away from Vegas we will miss this place more than anything else.

God bless them !!!!

At Curry Zen, I love getting the chicken katsu curry because their chicken katsu is on point and their curry is also on point! It is a nice place for a cheap and quick meal! Their service is also always on point, and I love how flavorful their curry is. I always recommend this place to my California friends whenever they visit. Definitely try this place out!

Since I was a young kid I have always always always loved japanese curry. The only place I knew that had this type of curry was in California ans it was called curry house. I LOVE THIS PLACE I dont know how else to say it lol
Incredible! Level 6 spicy was perfect. The curry was so thick and flavorful. I will definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas.

Simply put, Zen Curry is a great place for Japanese style curry. I feel like its becoming as mainstream as Thai or Indian curry is (despite the lack of Indian places around). 

Zen Curry also offers a delicious Katsu-Don (Donburi/Bowl), I wish they offered other types though, not just katsu. The toppings for your curry are endless and there are many different sides you can get with your meal. I recommend getting the tofu salad and the takoyaki to accompany your meal.

This location is definitely in a poor plaza. There are too many places packed around this two row parking lot. Don't let this scare you. Zen Curry js a must try, and there's many other delicious places surrounding it as well.
Omg!!  This is what REAL Japanese curry tastes like?!?!  Not the yellow pasty, grainy, raw curry in other Japanese restaurants. Almost like my Mom's!!!

This is a great place for curry. If you are from Hawaii, longing for Curry House, then this is your best bet. They offer an array of meat to accompany your curry, or you can opt for a simple curry sauce and rice. Zen is located in the same complex where Monta Ramen is. If you don't know about Monta...yelp. 

There is a base price of 5.95 and price goes up depending what and how many items you add into your curry. The great thing about this place is that they do have vegeterian selections, and they also offer side dishes/appetizers such as takoyaki, deep fried oysters, shumai, edamame, and much more but my photographic memory failed me.

Today, we ordered 2 of the chicken katsu curry, deep fried shumai, and a spam curry. My son loves spam so of course he had to order it. The spam slices came out really thick, think he only had three slices of it, but again...they were pretty thick of a cut. I shared my katsu plate with my 6 year old so we ordered an extra scoop of rice. I love curry; I just don't enjoy the heavy feeling. Sharing with my son was the perfect portion for both of us. The chicken katsu itself was delightful. It was perfectly crisped, the meat didn't look "dead" inside (you know...that dry old chicken look),  and the fact that it isn't seasoned at all or heavily season is also a plus to me, because it'll be chillin on top of curry sauce anyway. As well all know...curry has enough depth, the extra sodium on a breaded chicken would be unnecessary. 1 thing I did wish is that my curry sauce came out a little bit more hot temperature wise. It was more like lukewarm. I'm just one of those people who love seeing steam come from my plate. It's confirmation to me my food is coming out fresh. Hell, it could've been microwaved for all I know if there were steam, but I wouldn't know--I just know I want it to look like it came fresh out the pot.

It was busy when we arrived, but we did not have to wait at all. We came in on a Tuesday afternoon, but twas Veteran's day so perhaps twas the reason for a full house? The facility was very clean. The waitresses were attentive. We did have to ask for our waters to get refilled at the end of our meal, but two refills prior to that they came without question. Tables kinda sit close to each other as the facility isn't big. So no nasty talk unless you want the people next to you joining in. Lol. I don't recommend bringing a stroller in there as well. I didn't have mine, but when I walked in I thought thank goodness I didn't bring it in. Kinda figured considering we are on Spring Mountain and such eateries along it don't offer plenty of stroller room anyway. 

For my family of 6 our bill came out into a whopping 32bucks, that's with tax. Can't say the same for others because I still have kids that are in the sharing zone. Good deal to us. Anyway, before I get 'curried' away....pause....I will certainly be returning whenever we are feeling Zen like.

The original location of Curry Zen has stolen my heart. I've come as a regular before their 2nd location and before their expansion of the building. Every time, their sauce has been hearty, savory, with that bit of sweetness that makes Japanese curry different from the rest. 

There's just one thing that gripes me about this place and it's most likely due to their recent wild success. When I used to come back in the day in their tiny little hole-in-the-wall type of restaurant, my chicken always came consistently. However these days, it seems as though my chicken comes somewhat dry. It's not largely noticeable, nor is it huge enough to complain loudly about, but coming from one of my favorite curry houses ever, it's something I wish would always stay the same. 

My favorite curry house of all-time will always be CoCo ICHIBANYA, a popular curry house from Japan that landed its way to some parts in the states. I particularly like their sauce just a bit more and I love that they have naan bread to dip in the sauce. 

I request that Curry Zen brings in the naan bread and I will come running every time.

I would consider myself a regular here, coming here mostly during lunch breaks. My usual go-to order is a chicken katsu curry with spinach. The spinach adds an additional different flavor to the curry itself, and with its texture mixed with that of the chicken and rice together makes a great combo. The food usually comes out pretty quick, and the services is often very good. I've only had one bad experience with the service recently. I had ordered my usual, chicken katsu with spinach. However, the order that came out was only a plate of rice with spinach, no chicken. So I had let them know, and they apologized and brought out a separate plate of chicken katsu. But that process even took much longer than it should have. It might have been the service herself who made the mistake, because at times I would see new faces taking orders. This experience doesn't hinder me from going back, because it's a great place for Japanese curry, probably the best in town. Love it here, would go back for more lunches to come.

If I ever need my fix for J-curry, this is where I'll go from now on.  Apparently that's also the case for many Japanese in town including the owner of Cafe de Japon who we bumped into and had the pleasure of dining with.  He got natto with his curry.  I didn't know that was something Japanese did?  I think natto is super gross but I guess drowning it in rich curry sauce would be the most acceptable way for me to scarf it down.  

Most of the meat options are breaded and fried with the exception of the kurobuta sausage.  I got the pork katsu with cheese and my wife went with chicken katsu and cheese.  Both were excellent and terrific portions.  I also liked how they offered almonds, raisins, sweet onions and pickles on the side.  I'd never put almonds on my curry before but it made for great texture.  I ate a ton of onions since that went really well with the crunch and juiciness of the pork.    

I would like to see a few more options for curry including a straight up beef option and maybe an unfried chicken too but that's not a big thing.  Friendly service, Japaneezy atmosphere and great curry is what will ensure my return.  Free wifi is a plus.

PLEASE EAT HERE! ????????????
Ok so I rarely give 5 stars and especially rarely give it for a Japanese restaurant in the US.... That's mainly because my wife is Japanese (from japan) and I of course lived there for 7 yrs... We've actually only been back in the US for about 2 weeks ... So Japanese food (real) is still fresh on our pallets. 
So those of you that know me, know that CoCoIchibanya is my absolute #1-2-3-4-5 favorite restaurant of allllllll time. ???????????????????????
So when we found this spot on Yelp, Sakino recommend we try it as she knows I'm missing curry, specifically CoCos.. When in Hawaii, I drag her there. When in LA, I drag her there. When at our home in Okinawa... Well that's home so I can't drag her anywhere lol, but she lets me go like once a week! 
So of course I'm feeling a little standoffish about this place... Most of our American Japanese dining experiences thus far have been ehhhh.... So in we go.
Right off the bat, they have that CoCoIchi yellowish colored menu...  Ok. Then I notice something, everyone in this place (staff) is actually Japanese, and speaking Japanese! This please my wife and I a lot... Sounds silly I know but it's kinda rare to have actual Japanese people that speak Japanese in a Japanese restaurant in America. And they were legit, when my wife conversed with them they didn't skip a beat or look lost. Plus 1 pt for these guys! ???????so then I order.. Old faithful. Chicken katsu curry with cheese level 2. Exactly as I would a CoCos... Sakino ordered the same only level 3. 
So, what I will tell you is this: if you know and love CoCos, this place WILL DO JUST FINE! Is it better? No. Is it pretty much equal? Ehhhh yea sure. Point is for Vegas, this place is basically CoCos, which earns it a 5 star for me... The food is great, the service is great and authentic... Point in case, we come in and Sakino (my wife) sees a young Japanese waitress... She keeps staring and telling me hey hey doesn't she look so familiar? I'm like yea I guess. Sakino was like you know when I was an exchange student at University of Hawaii, I swear that waitress was also a student there on exchange from mainland Japan! I'm like sure I guess but I don't remember babe... So my wife is like ok, after we eat I'll ask her... Well before that even happens, the young girl walks over and is like omg hey remember me from Hawaii etc etc... Turns out it IS Misakichan and she is HERE going to school now... And not only that, today was her first day at this job! What a crazy coincidence that a girl from Okinawa, a girl from mainland Japan, both exchange student to Hawaii, 2yrs later bump into each other at a curry house in Las Vegas? Wtf?! Point is, the people here are great. They are authentic as it gets, and the food is ON POINT! Large for me small for her, 2 drinks, plus tip.. $25 total... Which by the way, is exactly what I'd pay at CoCoIchi.... These guys here at Zen Curry in Vegas are onto something... If the local Air Force guys here that have been stationed at Kadena AFB ever find out.. This place will be packed! 
Please please please ... Check this place out! So worth it 
??????
My favorite curry place. Decent price and original curry.  Feels like home and they have good customer service. I actually left the place full and no need to go anywhere.
Best katsu chicken katsu curry! Good service and great food. Will definitely be returning.

Curry zen has never cease to fail me whenever I go especially whenever I get back home from college breaks because they don't have it down in San Diego. I hope everyone in Vegas decides to come here at least once and experience what s great place this is to eat at from great service to great food.

This place was really good. The service was good. The people were friendly. The food came out quick. The place was clean. The chicken Katsu curry was really good. At first I was like, "Why didn't they bring me a knife?" and then realized it was so tender you can cut it with the fork. I like that they have brown rice and other toppings. The Thai tea was so good.

I have never tried curry before but this place made me fall in love with it. Their food is amazing and the spiciness level of the curry is reasonable:) it's a small place so might have to wait a little to be seated but it worth the wait.

I love the food , there's just never a parking spot , you aren't allowed to park on the street next to it or the parking lot across the street. I went to eat there circled the parking lot 5 times and left lol. One of my favorite food places for sure though.

Chicken Katsu all day, baby!

This place is fantastic. Service is quick, food is delicious, and they make a good Thai Ice Tea. Medium spicy was about perfect for me, giving a nice kick but not causing you to sweat your face off. 

The only negative about this place is that it's located somewhat far away from the strip where most people spend their time and stay in hotels. But this review is about the food and service, both of which are excellent.
Always packed and although parking can be a challenge it's definitely worth it. I recommend the chicken katsu with cheese and added potatoes, spicy level for me a 10 was hot but not inedible.

theres always a surprise in small joints like this! 

super GOOD curry + friendly staff + hungry me= HAPPY TUMMY!!! its the BOMBDIGGITY! ;)

Love this place. 
Food is very tasty. I had the chicken katsu with a number 7 in spice volume. And a thai tea which was super sweet. Other than the Thai tea being sweet I love this place.  Definitely one of our eating spot when we're in town.

I liked it, and would go back. It fell short vs some of the better curry shops i've had in tokyo, but its a nice visit and something a little different vs. a typical vegas restaurant. felt pretty legit.

2nd time trying Japanese curry in my life!! Recommend by my boyfriend and my supervisor at work. Not a huge curry fan so I was scared I wasn't going to eat when I came here...I actually did enjoy the food. We went on a week day evening wasn't busy at all. We got sat right away, ordered within a few minutes, and our food came out shortly after. I shared a plate with my bf and we ordered curry with pork & chicken Katsu, vegetables at spicy level3. I probably would come back again and have my own plate! I wouldn't order vegetables though since they do charge $3 extra for that.

Needing a fix for Japanese curry, one that I've had since spending 6 months in Japan a few years ago, I'm glad I finally stopped in.  Chicken Katsu was excellent, added cheese with a side of pickled radish.  Curry was great and the spice level I ordered was just the right amount of pop(#5), chicken was crispy and moist,  and servers were knowledgeable and friendly.  Def recommend!

The food here is really basic- figure out what level of heat you want and pick your protein. Curry is rich and delicious. Great option when you are tired, hungry and don't want too many choices. Maybe you've had a few drinks earlier and just want to get in, out and get to sleep- whatever your story. 
 Service is lightning fast and food comes out almost right away. 
 On a late Saturday night they were packed with not one open table, but they turn fast, so stick around and a table will likely open up quickly. We only waited about a minute before a couple that was done with their meal got up so we could grab a seat. 
 They do have a few very reasonably priced draft selections, if you are drinking. 
 All in all, not a special trip place, but quick, satisfying and effortless.
Delicious food. Friendly faces :) if you don't eat too much rice and curry you could get the smaller bowl for $2/3 less. It's still plenty. Think if it like a panda bowl. Lol :) enjoy!

Bomb curry. I had the chicken katsu and slam curry with added cheese and corn. My bf had the meatloaf and slam curry and we couldn't be happier. Happy tummy and happier camper :). Friends had regular pork curry and beef with sausage. Very delicious! Will be back in a few days! :) :) :)

yummy. delicious meal. katsu chicken curry is tender n juicy. the curry is perfect. i like spicy so 12 out of 10 ($1.00 additional to the bill) cheap fulfilling meal. I'll eat this any days with rice n lots of spicy of course. services are good. next time I'll get spicy level of 15 cause 10 & 12 is still not spicy enough. but what can i say. i just love spicy foods. there right amount of rice curry n meat. give it a try. parking can be a pain but it is in the small plaza. i like to go over to kung fu tea after. Bobas. pretty decent milkteas. definitely will come back again. even tho this place opens at 11:30 am. they were ready n open at 11:20 am. the foods clean. n non greasy curry with crisp chicken. just love it w the spicy.
We are regular customers there, they do the best curry sauce , the draft beers very cheap and the people are there very friendly, any time if we've been there , we got the food fast.

If you're looking for a delicious tasty curry Zen curry is the spot. Been here multiple times, and there's never a dull moment eating here. This time I bought to go and it was ready in a short time. I always add cheese and corn to my chicken cutlet curry. Their curry sauce has a tangy flavor with a hint of sweetness when you bite into it.

The chicken is crispy and tender served in a big portion. This place does get very busy, being in the Chinatown area of spring mountain. Would always come back as this place is my number spot for curry.

Favorite curry spot when I'm out in Vegas for SEMA!!! Delicious food, great prices, and reasonable wait time if they're busy. Definitely worth making the stop if you're wanting to get away from the strip.

This Is The Best Japanese Curry In Las Vegas! I Come Here Every Other Week! They Always Give Me Fresh , Tasty and Perfectly Served Food. I Usually Get The Chicken Katsu w potato Croquet. 100% recommend if you love curry!

Delicious!

The curry is on point every time, especially their spice level.  

Don't get too nervous about the fried foods, it's actually not greasy at all, very clean tasting.

Tip: get the curry udon, it's kinda amazing.

Best Japanese Curry I've had since living in Japan and/or Hawaii. The flavors are on point and the presentation is always appetizing. I lived in Vegas for 8yrs before finding this place a few months ago. The spice levels are there for a reason, so choose wisely! Coco House flashbacks with every bite

To say this place was AWESOME is an understatement.... It was THE best curry I have ever had. Glad I read the other posts about the level of spice-- my hubby and I both ordered a level 3 and was perfect. 

We've been searching for a place similar to the CURRY HOUSE in Hawaii and I'm happy to day we have found it. Love love love this place!

It's all hype....

My friend and I decided to eat here because we heard it was the best Japanese curry in town....it's mediocre at best. 

The service was good but we were really disappointed on the quality of the curry. The only thing that had it going was the chicken katsu. 

Still on the look out for the "Best Japanese Curry in Las Vegas"

I had the Tofu salad very good loved the dressing & the Katsu-Don.

I would go back very friendly & good service.

I once tried Curry Zen (when it first opened) and was thoroughly unimpressed. So unimpressed that I forgot I had been here already! This is no surprise because I'm notoriously anti-fried food and need greens with every meal. However, after visiting Japan this summer I am all about the curry and kushiage life now.

SERVICE & LOCATION
Quick and friendly service, as with any respectable Japanese curry place. I would be annoyed if they were fancy and asked me about my day! Just tryin' to shovel some spice level 5 in without small talk. The venue itself is pretty plain and unassuming, and a tad bit cramped. Being located in one of the busiest plazas in Vegas makes parking a headache during peak hours.

FOOD
Ahh, the star of the show is of course their curry. Fragrant, filling, and can be made to an obnoxiously spicy level. (They charge you above level 2, I think). You can customize it with toppings or choose from premade sets. I personally like vegetable curry with potato croquette! (I heard you liked carbs, so we took carbs, wrapped it in carbs... deep fried!)

Chicken kushiage is kind of dry but the zucchini is delicious. Oh, and the side salad is somehow super addicting. 

This place is perfect if you're really hungry (huge portions). If you have a small appetite, like my mother, you can totally split a plate with some other weenie.

After 5 years of coming to this restaurant we had the worst experience. After paying our check, the male waiter (only one male) suggested for us to vacate as people are waiting outside. We just got done eating, was still drinking my tea. That was very rude. Very bad business practice for sure.
If you love curry this place is a must try !! I would like to say this is the best curry town. Go Now !

What we ordered: Pork Katsu Curry with cheese (9.95 + .75) | Takoyaki ($4.95)
